a	<h3>a</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>art.</i></font><br>表示“一(个, 件…)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He needs an assistant.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他需要一位助手。</font><br>(非特指的)一(个)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He works in a factory.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在一家工厂工作。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When I entered the room, I saw a man standing at the window.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我走进房间时, 看见一个男人站在窗前。</font><br>(同类事物中的)任何一(个)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A child needs love.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 儿童需要爱。</font><br>(用于表示时间、速度、价格等意义的)每一<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The boy was paid two dollars a day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那男孩每天挣两美元。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Apple costs five dollars a kilogram.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 苹果每千克五美元。</font><br>(用在某些物质名词和抽象名词前)一阵、一场、一种<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A gentle wind disturbed the surface of the water.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 微风拂动水面。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was caught in a heavy rain.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他遇上了一阵大雨。</font><br>\n
abandon	<h3>abandon</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>离弃, 丢弃<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jackson has abandoned his old car.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 杰克逊把他那辆旧车扔了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The car badly damaged, so they abandoned it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那辆车坏得太厉害了, 所以他们丢弃了它。</font><br>遗弃, 抛弃<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm sorry I abandoned you like that.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 很抱歉我那样突然抛下你走了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She abandoned her husband and children and went off with another man.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她抛弃了自己的丈夫和孩子, 跟另外一个男人跑了。</font><br>放弃<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We will never abandon our principles.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们应该坚持原则。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She abandoned her journey temporarily.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她暂时放弃了旅行。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The scientist abandoned his research for lack of fund.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 由于缺乏资金, 这位科学家放弃了他的研究工作。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>放任; 纵情<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp People were shouting and cheering with abandon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 人们兴高采烈，纵情欢呼。</font><br>\n
ability	<h3>ability</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>能力; 力量<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His ability is limited.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的能力有限。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She has no ability in that kind of work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她没有做那种工作的能力。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The ability to use a language can be acquired by the act of using the language.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 运用语言的能力只能通过不断练习才能获得。</font><br>智慧, 才智; 天资<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Most schools cater for children of different abilities.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大多数学校能够满足具有不同天资的儿童的需要。</font><br>\n
able	<h3>able</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>能够…的, 得以…的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Most children are able to walk before they are able to talk.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 多数孩子在会说话前就会走路。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The patient was soon able to sit up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 病人很快就能坐起来了。</font><br>有才干的, 有本事的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was acknowledged as an able statesman.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他被公认为是个有才干的政治家。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The general impression at the studio was that he was able.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在这个画室获得的总的印象是他很有才能。</font><br>\n
abnormal	<h3>abnormal</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>反常的, 异常的; 变态的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Is the child abnormal in any way?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这孩子是否在哪方面有点不正常?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This warm weather is abnormal for February.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 二月里这种温暖的天气不太正常。</font><br>\n
aboard	<h3>aboard</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>prep.</i></font><br>在(船、飞机、车)上, 上(船、飞机、车)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They were all aboard the ship last night.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 昨天夜里他们都在船上。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>在船(或飞机、车)上, 上船(或飞机、车)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The diesels roared, the conductors jumped aboard, and off the train went.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 内燃机发出轰鸣声, 列车员跳上车厢, 火车开走了。</font><br>\n
abolish	<h3>abolish</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>废除, 废止<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The Americans abolished slavery in 1863.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 美国于1863年废除奴隶制度。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Do abolish this kind of bad evil.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一定要废除这种恶劣习俗。</font><br>\n
abortion	<h3>abortion</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>人工流产(手术), 堕胎<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The abortion arose from an accidental fall.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 流产是由于(孕妇)不慎摔倒所致。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Abortion is illegal in many countries.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在许多国家, 堕胎都是违法的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She had an abortion at the women's health clinic.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在妇女保健医院做了流产手术。</font><br>(计划等)失败, 中止<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His plan proved an abortion.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的计划中途夭折。</font><br>\n
about	<h3>about</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>prep.</i></font><br>(表示位置)在…周围; 在…的各处; 在…的附近<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Fish are abundant about the reefs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 暗礁附近鱼很多。</font><br>(表示对象)对, 对于<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I am very sorry about your troubles.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 对于你遇到的麻烦我非常遗憾。</font><br>(表示原因)由于, 因为<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp John is anxious about his exam results.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 约翰为考试结果而担忧。</font><br>(表示论及)关于; 涉及; 在…方面<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What is the book about?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这本书是关于什么内容的?</font><br>(表示所属)属于, 体现在…身上<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His face is the worst thing about him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他吃亏就吃在他的面孔上。</font><br>(表示过程)忙于, 从事<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Henry's gone a long time. I wonder what he's about.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 亨利去了很长时间了, 我不知道他在干什么。</font><br>(表示伴随)在身边<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Do you happen to have his letter about you?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你是否正好带着他的信了?</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>大约, 差不多<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She died about two years ago.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她大约在两年前就死了。</font><br>在四周, 处处<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He lay asleep with his clothes scattered about.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他躺着睡了, 脱下的衣服四处放着。</font><br>在附近<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Nobody seemed about, so I went in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 附近好像没人, 于是我就进去了。</font><br>\n
above	<h3>above</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>prep.</i></font><br>(表示位置)在…正上方<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The aeroplane was flying a few feet above the sea.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 飞机正在距海面几英尺的低空飞行。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The chorus was seated above the orchestra.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 合唱队的座位高于乐队席。</font><br>(表示方向)在…的另一侧; 在…往北<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The water is smoother above the dam.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 坝的另一边水面平静些。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The greatest part of Europe is situated above the 45th degree of Northern Latitude.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 欧洲绝大部分地区位于北纬45度以北。</font><br>(表示比较)优于, 胜于; 较…更为; 高出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Because of her beauty, she has managed to marry above her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 由于貌美, 她得以嫁给一个地位比她高的人。</font><br>(表示环境)处在…之中; 逆着, 透过<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The captain's voice was heard above the din.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 透过一片嘈杂声听到了船长的说话声。</font><br>(表示程度)超过, 超越; 为…所不及<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can't expect to succeed if you attempt tasks above your ability.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果你要做能力达不到的事, 就别指望成功。</font><br>(表示等级)在…之上, 高于<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A lieutenant colonel ranks above a major.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 陆军中校比少校级别高。</font><br>(表示否定)不受…的影响; 不至于<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is above meanness and deceit.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他不至于搞卑鄙和欺骗行为。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was quite above owing his meal to the request of a little girl.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他绝不屑于应一个小姑娘的邀请去吃饭。</font><br>(表示数目)超过, 超出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Above two hundred people attended the meeting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 二百多人出席了会议。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>在上面<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My room is just above.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的房间就在楼上。</font><br>以上<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is a military meeting for captains and above.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是一个由上尉及上尉以上军官参加的军事会议。</font><br>上述<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp As is stated above, this principle applies to all cases.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如前文所讲, 这一原则适合所有案例。</font><br>\n
abroad	<h3>abroad</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>到国外, 在国外<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All my near relations live abroad.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我所有的近亲都在国外。</font><br>到处, 广泛流传<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The news soon spread abroad.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 消息迅速传开。</font><br>在户外, 在室外<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The young people were still abroad at the dead of night.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些年轻人深更半夜还在外边。</font><br>\n
abrupt	<h3>abrupt</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>突然的, 意外的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don't know the cause of his abrupt leave.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不知道他突然离去的原因。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There were abrupt weather changes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 天有不测风云。</font><br>唐突的, 鲁莽的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She always sounds abrupt on the telephone.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在电话中听起来她总像很无礼。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp An abrupt descent suddenly appeared before him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他面前突然出现一个陡峭的斜坡。</font><br>\n
absence	<h3>absence</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>缺席, 离开, 不在场<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She called in your absence.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你不在时她来过。</font><br>不在场的次数或时间<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Ade's constant absences from work made his boss very angry.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 艾德经常旷工使他的老板很生气。</font><br>缺乏, 不存在<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A major problem is the absence of water.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 主要的问题是缺水。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Absolute liberty is absence of restraint.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 绝对的自由就是无约束。</font><br>\n
absent	<h3>absent</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>缺席的, 不在场的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp At times he would be absent for a couple of days.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他有时会离开几天。</font><br>缺乏的, 不存在的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Snow is absent in some countries.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有些国家不下雪。</font><br>心不在焉的, 恍惚的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He listened with an absent air and kept glancing at the door.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他一副心不在焉的样子听着, 不时地瞥一眼门。</font><br>\n
absolute	<h3>absolute</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>绝对的, 完全的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I look upon this as an absolute necessity.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我认为这是绝对必要的。</font><br>不受任何限制[约束]的; 无条件的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can an absolute ruler do just as he pleases?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 独裁者就能为所欲为吗?</font><br>有无上权力或权威的; 专制的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The power of the commander-in-chief was absolute.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 总司令拥有全权。</font><br>\n
absorb	<h3>absorb</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>吸收<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Dry earth absorbs water quickly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 干土吸水很快。</font><br>把…并入, 同化<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They absorbed a great deal of the Roman culture.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们大量地吸收了罗马文化。</font><br>吸引…的注意力, 使全神贯注<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp International affairs absorb his attention.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他专心研究国际问题。</font><br>\n
absorbed	<h3>absorbed</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>全神贯注的,一心一意的<br>\n
abstract	<h3>abstract</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>抽象的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Abstract nouns are usually uncountable nouns in English.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 英语中的抽象名词通常是不可数名词。</font><br>抽象派的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is an abstract painter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是一个抽象派画家。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>抽象, 抽象概念, 抽象性<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's the abstract that is called system analysis.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这就是所谓系统分析这个抽象概念。</font><br>抽象派艺术作品<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There're two abstracts on the wall.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 墙上挂着两幅抽象派画。</font><br>摘要, 梗概<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He made an abstract of a long article.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他对一篇长文章做了摘要。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>提取, 抽取<br>做…的摘要<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has abstracted the speech.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他对讲话作了摘要。</font><br>\n
abundant	<h3>abundant</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>大量的, 充足的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Rainfall is abundant in the region.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 该地区降雨丰沛。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp China is abundant with natural resources.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 中国自然资源丰富。</font><br>\n
abuse	<h3>abuse</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>滥用, 妄用, 虐待<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm afraid the position is open to abuse.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 恐怕这个职位容易使人滥用职权。</font><br>恶习, 不正之风<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They decided to reform social abuses.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们决定改革社会陋习。</font><br>恶言, 辱骂<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He burst into a storm of abuse.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他破口大骂。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>滥用, 妄用<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He never abuses his privilege.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他从不滥用特权。</font><br>虐待, 伤害<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Stop abusing the child.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 住手, 不要伤害这孩子。</font><br>辱骂, 毁谤<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Most of the foremen abused the workmen in the foulest languages.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大多数的工头用极其污秽的语言辱骂工人。</font><br>\n
academic	<h3>academic</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>学校的, 学院的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The university is composed of five academic schools.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 整个大学由五个学院组成。</font><br>学术性的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They asked for academic freedom.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们要求学术自由。</font><br>纯理论的, 不切实际的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That is merely an academic discussion.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那只是一个理论性的讨论。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>大学教师; 专业学者<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her husband is a famous academic.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的丈夫是一位著名的学者。</font><br>\n
academy	<h3>academy</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>专科学校<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is an academy of music.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是一所音乐专科学院。</font><br>研究院, 学会<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I visited Chinese Academy of Sciences yesterday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我昨天去访问了中国科学院。</font><br>\n
accelerate	<h3>accelerate</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使)加快, (使)增速<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The car suddenly accelerated.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汽车突然加速。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our country should accelerate the economic growth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我国应加快经济增长。</font><br>\n
accent	<h3>accent</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>口音, 腔调<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He speaks in his broad accent.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他说话地方口音很重。</font><br>重音, 重音符号<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is a secondary accent.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个是次重音。</font><br>强调, 重点<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The accent of the report is on safety.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 报告的重点是安全问题。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>重读<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please accent the first syllable.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请重读第一个音节。</font><br>\n
accept	<h3>accept</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>接受, 领受, 收受<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you accept, please let me know.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果你接受的话, 请通知我。</font><br>承担责任; 承兑<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The firm accepted personal cheques.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这家公司承兑私人支票。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>承认, 同意; 认为, 相信<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please accept me as a friend.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请把我当作朋友。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The police accepted his story as true.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警察对他的话信以为真。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He accepted me as having seen the much of the world.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他承认我见识广。</font><br>\n
acceptable	<h3>acceptable</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>值得接受的, 可接受的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The terms of the contract are acceptable to us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们认为这个合同的条件可以接受。</font><br>\n
acceptance	<h3>acceptance</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>接受, 认可<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We have the pleasure to ask your acceptance of our presents.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 恭请接受我们的礼物。</font><br>赞成, 赞同<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The new laws gained widespread acceptance.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 新法令受到广泛赞同。</font><br>\n
access	<h3>access</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>通道, 入口<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is no access to the street through that door.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个门不通向大街。</font><br>接近[取得]…的方法[权利等]<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can easily get access to her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你很容易接近她。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>存取(计算机文件)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This scientist accessed enormous different files to find the correct information.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这位科学家在计算机上调阅了大量的不同文件以找寻所要的信息。</font><br>\n
accessible	<h3>accessible</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>容易取得的, 容易达到的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Medicine should not be kept where it is accessible to children.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 药物不应放在容易被小孩拿到的地方。</font><br>\n
accident	<h3>accident</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>意外遭遇, 事故<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp An awful accident has happened.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 发生了一起可怕的意外事故。</font><br>机遇, 命运, 造化<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was a lucky accident that we saw each other.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你我邂逅相遇, 幸运之至。</font><br>\n
accidental	<h3>accidental</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>意外的; 偶然(发生)的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our meeting in New York was quite accidental.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们在纽约的会见完全是偶然的。</font><br>\n
accommodation	<h3>accommodation</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>住处(尤指仅供短期使用的)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They provided comfortable accommodations for visitors.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们为旅客提供舒适的住处。</font><br>\n
accompany	<h3>accompany</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>陪伴, 陪同<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp May we accompany you on your walk?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们陪你一起散步好吗?</font><br>伴随…同时发生<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Thunder often accompanies lightning.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 雷声常伴着闪电。</font><br>伴奏<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He accompanied me at the guitar.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他用吉他给我伴奏。</font><br>\n
accomplish	<h3>accomplish</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>完成, 实现, 做成功<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My grandmother has accomplished the age of 97 years of her life.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我祖母已达97岁高龄。</font><br>\n
accord	<h3>accord</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>一致, 符合<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They came to an accord that profits should be shared equally.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们达成协议, 收益由大家均分。</font><br>(尤指国与国之间的)谅解, 协议<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government expected a temporary accord with the Opposition before the end of the year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府期望年底以前和反对党达成临时协议。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>给予, 赠予<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We accorded the boy due praise.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们给了孩子适当的表扬。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The committee accorded a scholarship to her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 委员会批准给她奖学金。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>符合, 一致<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The two statements accord superficially.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这两项声明表面上一致。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Most of my classmates accord in that opinion.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们班大多数同学都是那个意见。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His story accords with what I saw.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他讲的与我看到的是吻合的。</font><br>\n
accordance	<h3>accordance</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>一致, 和谐, 符合<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He acted in accordance with his beliefs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他按照自己的信念行事。</font><br>\n
accordingly	<h3>accordingly</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>照着, 相应地<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please inform us of your decision and we will act accordingly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请把你们的决定通知我们, 我们会照着去办的。</font><br>因此, 所以, 于是<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was told to speak briefly; accordingly he cut short his remarks.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 人家叫他说话简短, 于是他就长话短说了。</font><br>\n
according to	<h3>according to</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>prep.</i></font><br>(表示依据)根据, 按照<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You've been in prison three times according to our records.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 根据我们的记录, 你曾入狱三次。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Fill up the form according to the instructions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 按照说明将表填好。</font><br>\n
account	<h3>account</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>账, 账户<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The sum of money has been transferred into my account.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那笔钱已转到我账上。</font><br>记述, 描述, 报道<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The two accounts of the accident do not agree.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有关这次事件两则报道不一致。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>解释; 说明<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His illness accounts for his absence.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他因为生病, 所以才缺席。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has to account to the chairman for how he spends the company's money.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他一定要向主席说明他是如何花公司的钱的。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>认为<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We all account him a qualified teacher.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们都认为他是一名合格的教师。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Tom accounts himself (to be) lucky.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汤姆认为自己运气好。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He accounted it fun to go to sea.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他认为去海边很有趣。</font><br>\n
accountant	<h3>accountant</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>会计人员, 会计师<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They are all accountants.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们都是会计师。</font><br>\n
accumulate	<h3>accumulate</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>堆积; 积累<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Snow accumulated on the ground.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 地上积了一层雪。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They set to work accumulating a huge mass of data.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们已开始积累大量的资料。</font><br>\n
accuracy	<h3>accuracy</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>精确(性), 准确(性)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I doubt the accuracy of your statement.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我怀疑你的话的正确性。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He aims at great accuracy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他力求十分准确。</font><br>\n
accurate	<h3>accurate</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>精确的, 准确的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has made an accurate measurement of my garden.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他准确地丈量了我的花园。</font><br>正确无误的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is always accurate in what he says and does.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他说的和做的总是正确无误。</font><br>\n
accuse	<h3>accuse</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>指责, 谴责; 控告<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We accused him of taking bribes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们控告他受贿。</font><br>\n
accustomed	<h3>accustomed</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>惯常的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is his accustomed hour to go to bed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是他就寝的惯常时间。</font><br>习惯于…的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They are accustomed to this sort of work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们惯于干这种工作。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We have got accustomed to living in an air-conditioned room.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们对生活在有空调的房间里已习惯了。</font><br>\n
ache	<h3>ache</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>疼痛<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She felt an ache in her back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她感到后背隐隐作痛。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>疼痛<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her left arm aches[is aching].</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她左臂疼。</font><br>渴望<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His heart ached for her love.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他渴望得到她的爱。</font><br>\n
achieve	<h3>achieve</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>取得, 获得<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They achieved some victories despite these setbacks.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 尽管受到这些挫折, 他们还是取得了一些胜利。</font><br>实现, 达到, 完成<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You will achieve your ambition if you work hard.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果你努力, 你的抱负是可以实现的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Only practice can achieve mastery.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 只有实践才能达到精通。</font><br>\n
achievement	<h3>achievement</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>成就; 成绩; 功绩<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Altogether, our achievements are very great.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 总而言之，我们的成绩是很大的。</font><br>达到; 完成<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Such a goal is impossible of achievement.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这样的一个目标是不可能完成的。</font><br>\n
acid	<h3>acid</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>酸味的, 酸的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Lemons taste acid.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 柠檬吃起来有些酸。</font><br>尖刻的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Everyone doesn't like to hear the acid remarks.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 没有人喜欢听那尖酸刻薄的话。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>〈化〉酸<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This chemical acts a part of an acid in our experiment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种化学药品在我们的试验中起酸的作用。</font><br>酸味物质<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Strong acids attack metals.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 强酸性物质腐蚀金属。</font><br>\n
acknowledge	<h3>acknowledge</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>承认, 供认<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He grudgingly acknowledged having made a mistake.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他勉强承认他做错了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I acknowledged him as an authority.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我视他为专家。</font><br>告知已收到<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We must acknowledge his letter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们应当告诉他信收到了。</font><br>鸣谢, 感谢<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They wishes to acknowledge the assistance of the police in the making of this film.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们希望鸣谢警方在拍摄此片中所给予的帮助。</font><br>\n
acquaint	<h3>acquaint</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>使熟悉, 使了解<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This book acquaints the students with the ancient cultures of Europe.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这本书帮助学生了解欧洲的古代文化。</font><br>通知, 告知<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Acquaint him with your plans.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把你的计划告知他。</font><br>\n
acquaintance	<h3>acquaintance</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>相识的人, 熟人<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We are only casual acquaintances.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们只是泛泛之交。</font><br>对…有了解, 熟知, 认识<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I have no acquaintance with this book.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不熟悉这本书。</font><br>\n
acquire	<h3>acquire</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>获得, 得到, 养成<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The company has recently acquired new offices in central London.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 公司最近在伦敦市中心弄到了新的办公室。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We should acquire more firsthand information.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们应当取得更多的第一手资料。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I tried to acquire the information I needed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我千方百计地搞到了我所需要的资料。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His character acquired him a good name.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的品格使他得到好名声。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her manner acquired her universal odium.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的举止遭到普遍的非议。</font><br>\n
acquisition	<h3>acquisition</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>获得, 得到<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The children progressed in the acquisition of basic skills.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们在掌握基本技术方面取得了进步。</font><br>获得者, 获得物<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is a valuable acquisition to our firm.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是我们公司新来的得力雇员。</font><br>\n
acre	<h3>acre</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>英亩<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The playground covers over an acre in extent.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 操场的面积超过一英亩。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They own 200 acres of farmland.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们拥有200英亩的农田。</font><br>\n
across	<h3>across</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>prep.</i></font><br>(表示位置)在…对面[另一边]; 横在[披在]…上; 掠过…; 透过<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There's a hotel across the road.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 路的另一边有一家旅馆。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was wearing a silver fox fur across her shoulders.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她肩上披了一张银狐皮。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A smile of pleasure passed across his face.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他脸上掠过一丝快乐的微笑。</font><br>(表示方向)横越, 横跨; 横穿, 穿越; 从…的另一面[边]<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A straight line was ruled across the map.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一条直线横划在地图上。</font><br>(表示状态)与…交叉着; 触及, 波及, 影响到<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This policy stretches across several different departments.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这项政策影响着几个不同的部门。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>从这一边到另一边<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He turned his head and looked across at me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他转过头, 打量着我。</font><br>在对面, 向对面<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We leave Dover at ten and we should be across in France by midnight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 十点钟离开多佛的话, 我们午夜时分可以到达对面的法国。</font><br>跨度<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The river is half a mile across.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 江面宽半英里。</font><br>成十字形, 成交叉状<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He sat there quietly, with his arms across.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他双臂交叉, 静静地坐在那儿。</font><br>传达过来<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He began to talk, slipping the words across.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他开始讲话, 轻声把字吐出来。</font><br>\n
act	<h3>act</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>行动, 做<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The time for thinking is past, we must now act.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 思考的时间过去了, 我们现在必须行动。</font><br>表演, 假装<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Oliver is acting tonight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 奥利弗今晚演出。</font><br>起作用<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The medicine acts well.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这药有效。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>行为, 行动<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My first act was to run into the waiting room.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的第一个行动就是跑进客厅。</font><br>法令, 条例<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The drug was banned by an act of parliament.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 议会的法案明令禁止该药品。</font><br>(一)幕<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Most modern plays have three acts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大多数现代戏剧有三幕。</font><br>\n
action	<h3>action</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>行动, 活动<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The time has come for action.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 行动的时候到了。</font><br>所做之事, 行为<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was sorry for his actions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他为自己的行为感到懊悔。</font><br>情节<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The action is set in France.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 事情发生在法国。</font><br>作用, 功能<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Photographs are produced by the action of light on film.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 光对底片发生作用从而产生照片。</font><br>\n
active	<h3>active</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>活泼的, 活跃的; 积极的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is an active girl.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她是一位活泼的姑娘。</font><br>起作用的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His pulse is low, but his heart is still active.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他脉搏很弱, 但心脏还跳着。</font><br>主动的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This sentence is in the active voice.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 本句子用的是主动语态。</font><br>\n
activity	<h3>activity</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>活动性, 活力<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The house has been full of activity all day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 房子里整天都很热闹。</font><br>\n
actor	<h3>actor</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>演员(尤指男演员)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp An actor must be able to memorize his lines.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 演员须善于熟记台词。</font><br>\n
actress	<h3>actress</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>女演员<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp As actress Jane is not in the same class as Susan.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 作为演员, 简不如苏珊。</font><br>\n
actual	<h3>actual</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>实在的, 实际的, 事实上的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All actual objects are concrete.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一切实际存在的物体都是具体的。</font><br>\n
acute	<h3>acute</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>极大的, 严重的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There's an acute shortage of water.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这里严重缺水。</font><br>敏锐的, 深刻的, 剧烈的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is an acute observer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是个敏锐的观察家。</font><br>急性的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They think his mother's illness is acute rather than chronic.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们认为他母亲的病是急性的, 不是慢性的。</font><br>\n
ad	<h3>ad</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n. abbr.</i></font><br>广告<br>\n
adapt	<h3>adapt</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使)适应, (使)适合<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She knew how to adapt herself.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她懂得如何适应环境。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>改编, 改写<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Many of Dickens' books have been adapted as films.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 狄更斯的许多书都已改编成电影。</font><br>\n
add	<h3>add</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>加, 加入; 增加, 添加<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She tasted her lemonade, then added more sugar.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她尝尝柠檬水，然后又往里加了点糖。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>还说, 接着说<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'll add a few words when you finish.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你说完后我接着说几句。</font><br>\n
addition	<h3>addition</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>加; 加法<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That is a simple addition.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那是简单的加法。</font><br>增加的人或事物<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They've just had an addition to the family.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们家里刚刚添了一口人。</font><br>\n
additional	<h3>additional</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>增加的, 额外的, 另外的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Passengers have to pay additional charges for their extra luggages.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 旅客们超量携带的行李要额外付费。</font><br>\n
address	<h3>address</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>演说, 演讲<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The President gave an address to the nation over the radio.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 总统向全国发表广播演说。</font><br>住址, 地址<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What's your home address?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你的家庭地址在哪儿?</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>向…讲话, 向…发表演说; 写信给…<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He addressed the audience in an eloquent speech.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他对听众讲起话来滔滔不绝。</font><br>称呼<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How shall we address a prince?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们如何称呼一个王子?</font><br>在(信封或包裹等)上写上收信人的姓名、地址<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The letter was addressed to the wrong house.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这封信写错了地址。</font><br>\n
adequate	<h3>adequate</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>充分的, 足够的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There was adequate rain and snow last winter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 去年冬天雨雪充足。</font><br>适当的, 胜任的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Though a bit too old, he is still adequate to the work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 虽然他年纪大了点，却仍能胜任这项工作。</font><br>\n
adjective	<h3>adjective</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>形容词<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In “the black cat”the adjective “black” modifies the noun “cat”.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在“the black cat”这一词组中, 形容词“black”修饰名词“cat”。</font><br>\n
adjust	<h3>adjust</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(改变…以)适应; 调整; 校正<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The man adjusted very precisely.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个人调得很准。</font><br>\n
administration	<h3>administration</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>实行, 执行<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The administration of the law is very important.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 法律的执行是很重要的。</font><br>管理, 经营, 支配<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Who is in charge of the administration of your company?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你们公司的行政工作由谁负责?</font><br>政府, 内阁<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Not much was done by the last Administration.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 上届政府没有多少政绩。</font><br>\n
administrative	<h3>administrative</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>行政的, 管理的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has a lot of administrative work to do.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他有许多行政工作要做。</font><br>\n
admire	<h3>admire</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>赞赏; 钦佩<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We admire his working so hard.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们钦佩他工作努力。</font><br>称赞, 夸奖<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't forget to admire the baby.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要忘了夸奖那孩子。</font><br>〈美口〉想要, 喜欢<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We would admire to hear.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们喜欢听。</font><br>\n
admission	<h3>admission</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>准许进入<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He gained admission into the association.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他获准加入这个协会。</font><br>入场费, 入场券<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You have to pay ￡2 admission.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你须付2英镑入场费。</font><br>承认, 供认<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He made an admission that he was the thief.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他承认他是贼。</font><br>\n
admit	<h3>admit</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>许可进入<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This ticket admits two persons.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这张票可让两人进场。</font><br>承认, 供认<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She admitted having done wrong.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她承认自己做错了。</font><br>\n
adopt	<h3>adopt</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>收养<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Many childless couples adopt children.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 许多无子女的夫妇收养孩子。</font><br>采用, 采纳, 采取<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The factories have adopted the newest modern technology.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那几家工厂采用了现代的最新技术。</font><br>正式接受, 通过<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After going to France he soon adopted the French way of life.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他去法国后, 很快就接受了法国的生活方式。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The meeting adopted a resolution.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 会议通过了一项议案。</font><br>\n
adult	<h3>adult</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>成熟的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is adult in behaviour.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 从行为上看, 他已成熟了。</font><br>成年人的, 适宜于成年人的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We should do our best to develop the adult education.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们应当努力发展成人教育。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>成年的人或动物<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Anyone over eighteen years of age counts as adult.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 凡是超过18岁的都算成年人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The bear was a fully grown adult.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那只熊已完全发育成熟。</font><br>\n
advance	<h3>advance</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使)前进, (使)发展; 促进<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I signed to him to keep away, but he continued to advance.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我示意他离开, 但他还是继续往前走。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She advanced greatly in her knowledge.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在学识上大有长进。</font><br>提高, 提升<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Prices are advancing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 各种物价都在上涨。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He advanced in office.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的职务提升了。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>提出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He advanced many reasonable proposals.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他提出了许多合理化建议。</font><br>提前<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They advanced the time of the meeting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们把会议时间提前了。</font><br>预付, 贷(款项等)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I advanced 200 pounds more on these books.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些书我又多预付了200英镑。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>前进, 发展, 改进, 进步<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Nothing could stop the advance of the soldiers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 什么也无法阻挡战士们的前进步伐。</font><br>增长, 提高<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There has been no advance in the price of rice for many years.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 许多年来米价一直没有上涨。</font><br>借款, 预付款, 贷款<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The factory gave me an advance so that I could get my necessities.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 工厂先付钱给我, 便于我买一些必需品。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>预先的, 在前的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We sent out an advance party of soldiers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们派出一支先头部队。</font><br>预先做好的; 预先供给的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They have got advance information of the storm's approach.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们事前已得到将有暴风雨的消息。</font><br>\n
advanced	<h3>advanced</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>超前的, 先进的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His ideas are advanced, and only a few people could understand him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的思想是先进的, 只有少数人能理解他。</font><br>高级的, 高等的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They're going to start an advanced course in English at that institute.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个学院要开一个英语高级班。</font><br>\n
advantage	<h3>advantage</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>有利条件, 有利因素, 优势<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her Olimpic experience gave her a big advantage over the other contestants for the final victory.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的奥运会参赛经历使她比起其他竞技对手在争取最后获胜上具有很大的优势。</font><br>益处, 利益<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There are advantages to not having servants.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不用仆人有不用仆人的优越性。</font><br>\n
adventure	<h3>adventure</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>冒险活动; 冒险经历; 奇遇<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All the children listened to his adventures with eager attention.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们注意力十分集中地听他讲他的冒险经历。</font><br>冒险, 刺激<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The trip to Afghanistan was an adventure for Helen.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 到阿富汗旅行对海伦来说是一次冒险的经历。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>冒险<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp No man would adventure it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 没有人敢冒险做这种事。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is foolish to haphazardly adventure.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 随便冒险是愚蠢的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Those explorers gallantly adventured on unknown seas.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那些探险家们大胆地在陌生的海域探险。</font><br>\n
adverb	<h3>adverb</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>〈语〉副词<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Complete the following sentences by filling the blanks with proper prepositions and adverbs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 用适当的冠词和副词填空, 完成下列句子。</font><br>\n
advertise	<h3>advertise</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>公布, 宣传<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is unwise of them to advertise their willingness to make concessions at the negotiations.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们宣扬愿意在谈判中让步, 这是不明智的。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(给…)做广告宣传<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Are lawyers allowed to advertise?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 准许律师做广告吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They advertised their goods.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们为他们的商品做广告。</font><br>\n
advertisement	<h3>advertisement</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>出公告, 做广告<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you want to sell your old sofa, why not put an advertisement in the local newspaper?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果你想卖掉旧沙发, 何不在本地报纸上登个广告呢?</font><br>广告<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He glanced his eyes down the classified advertisements.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他浏览分类广告栏。</font><br>\n
advice	<h3>advice</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>劝告, 忠告, 意见<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Good advice is beyond price.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 忠告好, 无价宝。</font><br>消息, 报道; (商业)通知<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Do not sell on any account until further advice.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在另行通知前切勿出售。</font><br>\n
advisable	<h3>advisable</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>明智的; 可取的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was advisable for you not to mention that.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你不提及那件事是明智的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's advisable that they go with a clearly defined goal in mind.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们去时最好在思想上有一个明确的目标。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I do not think it advisable to park our car here.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我认为将我们的小汽车停放在此处是不妥当的。</font><br>\n
advise	<h3>advise</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>劝告, 提建议<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is easy for you to advise, but difficult to take advice from others.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 劝告别人容易, 接受劝告就难了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He advised going slowly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他建议走慢点。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He advised me to rest.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他劝我休息。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>(商业)通知, 报告<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please advise the date of shipment as soon as possible.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请尽快通知装货日期。</font><br>\n
advisory	<h3>advisory</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>劝告的, 提供咨询的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The advisory committee did not apply for a general increase in the ceiling.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 咨询委员会没有请求最高限价作普遍的提高。</font><br>\n
advocate	<h3>advocate</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>提倡, 主张<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don't advocate doing such things.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不主张干这样的事情。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>提倡者, 拥护者<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is an advocate of more airplanes and fewer warships.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是一个提倡多造飞机、少造军舰的人。</font><br>辩护律师, 辩护人<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He got the best advocate in town to defend him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他请城里最好的律师为他辩护。</font><br>\n
aeroplane	<h3>aeroplane</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>飞机<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp An aeroplane started for Tokyo yesterday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 昨天有一架飞机飞往东京。</font><br>\n
affair	<h3>affair</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>发生的事情; 大事; 事件<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The exhibition will be a big affair.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这次展出将是一个盛举。</font><br>事务, 事态<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I know nothing of legal affairs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我对法律方面的事情一无所知。</font><br>\n
affect	<h3>affect</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>影响<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The tax increases have affected us all.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 加税已经影响了我们所有的人。</font><br>感动<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The audience was deeply affected.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 听众被深深地打动了。</font><br>假装<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He affected not to see me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他假装没看见我。</font><br>\n
affection	<h3>affection</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>喜爱, 爱<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The officer transferred his affections to the other girl.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那军官爱上了另一个姑娘。</font><br>〈心〉感情<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has a deep affection for his old friend.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他对老朋友感情很深。</font><br>\n
affirmative	<h3>affirmative</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>肯定的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He replied in the affirmative to my question.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 就我的问题他给予了肯定的回答。</font><br>\n
afford	<h3>afford</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>买得起, 担负得起<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She cannot afford a new dress.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她没钱买新衣裳。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We can ill afford the time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们抽不出时间。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She cannot afford the expense.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她花不起这笔钱。</font><br>提供, 给予<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Some trees afford resin.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有些树产树脂。</font><br>\n
afraid	<h3>afraid</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>害怕的, 恐惧的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I am afraid I can't help you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 恐怕我帮不了你。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “Are you late?” “I am afraid so.”“你晚点了吗?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ”“恐怕是晚了。”</font><br>担忧, 忧虑<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The mother is very much afraid for her son who is seriously ill.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 母亲很担心自己的儿子, 他病得很重。</font><br>\n
after	<h3>after</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>prep.</i></font><br>(表示时间)在…以后<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After the play they called for the author to show himself.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 剧终之后他们请求编剧和大家见面。</font><br>(表示位置、顺序)在…后面<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The King came in, with all his servants following after him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 国王走了进来, 所有侍从跟在他的后面。</font><br>(表示原因)由于, 鉴于<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She succeeded in solving the problem after hard work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 由于努力干, 她终于解决了那个问题。</font><br>(表示条件)与…一致; 符合<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was built after his father.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的体型像父亲。</font><br>(表示方式)像, 仿照<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This box is made after a new pattern.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这箱子是仿照新样式制作的。</font><br>(表示依据)以…之名命名<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The boy was named Tom after his grandfather.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这小孩按他祖父的名字被起名为汤姆。</font><br>(表示论及)关于; 涉及<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He inquired after your health.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他询问你的健康状况。</font><br>(表示目标)追求, 追寻<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There were always lots of men after her because she was clever as well as pretty.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 总有许多男人追求她, 因为她既漂亮又聪明。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I wonder what those children are after in that shed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不知道那些孩子在棚子里寻找什么。</font><br>(表示让步)尽管, 仍然<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After all my advice, he still went his own way.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在我苦口婆心地相劝后, 他仍然一意孤行。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>conj.</i></font><br>在…以后<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After he goes, we shall eat.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他走之后, 我们就吃饭。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>以后, 继后<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They arrived soon after.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们没多久就到达了。</font><br>\n
afternoon	<h3>afternoon</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>下午<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We have no class this afternoon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们今天下午没有课。</font><br>\n
afterward	<h3>afterward</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>以后, 过后, 后来<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has waited for a few minutes and left afterward.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他等了一会儿, 然后离开了。</font><br>\n
again	<h3>again</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>再(次), 又(一次)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's good to see all my teachers and friends again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 又见到我的老师和朋友们真是好极了。</font><br>此外, 另一方面<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp And again, can you acknowledge it as true?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 再者, 你会认为真有此事吗?</font><br>反响, 反应<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You will be loved again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你的爱定会得到回报。</font><br>\n
against	<h3>against</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>prep.</i></font><br>(表示方向)与…方向相反, 逆着, 迎着, 顶着<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You should fly your kite against the wind.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你应该迎着风放风筝。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She always advances against difficulties.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她总是迎着困难上。</font><br>(表示方位)紧靠着…, 倚靠着…<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The seats have no back against which to lean.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些座位都没有靠背可倚。</font><br>(表示对象)对…不利, 对…有害; 和…碰撞, 与…撞击; 预防, 以…为抵御对象; 以…为竞争对手; 违反, 违背<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The present economic climate works against the smaller companies.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当前的经济气候对小公司不利。</font><br>(表示目的)为…做准备, 防备…之用<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is preparing a substantial meal against his return.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她正在准备一顿丰盛的饭菜为他接风。</font><br>(表示态度)反对, 反抗<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He fought against the disease for a long time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他同疾病做了长时间的斗争。</font><br>(表示依据)以…为标准<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I checked my watch against the steeple clock.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我根据教堂尖塔的大钟对了表。</font><br>以…兑换, 以…交换<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please deliver this package against payment of cost.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请把这件货物送去, 把货款带回。</font><br>(表示对比)和…比, 和…对照; 以…为背景<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is elected by a majority of 40 votes against 10.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他以40票对10票的大多数票当选。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The mountain looks magnificent against the sky.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在蓝天的衬托下, 这座山显得雄伟壮丽。</font><br>\n
age	<h3>age</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>年龄, 年纪<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They married at a late age.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们年龄很大时才结婚。</font><br>老年, 老<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You have something to learn in youth and in age.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 年轻和年老都有东西可学。</font><br>时代, 时期<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The sage is the instructor of a hundred ages.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这位哲人是百代之师。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使)长大, 变老<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After his wife's death, he aged quickly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 妻子死后, 他老得很快。</font><br>\n
agency	<h3>agency</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>经销处, 代理行<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp An agency has been opened at the following address.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一个分销处已在下述地点开始营业。</font><br>部, 处<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There are many specialized agencies in the United Nations.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 联合国有许多专门机构。</font><br>\n
agenda	<h3>agenda</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>议事日程<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The agendas for the next two meetings have yet to be worked out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 下两次会议的议程尚需制定。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The first item on the agenda was how to cut down the cost in manufacture.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 第一项议程是如何减少生产费用。</font><br>\n
agent	<h3>agent</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>代理人, 代理商; 经纪人<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A commercial agent manages the business affairs of company.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 商务代理人负责代公司处理商业性事务。</font><br>作用者, 原动力, 动因; 作用剂<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Soap is not the only cleansing agent.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 肥皂并不是唯一的清洁剂。</font><br>\n
aggressive	<h3>aggressive</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>好争斗的, 挑衅的, 侵略性的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The dogs are trained to be aggressive.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些狗被训练得具有攻击性。</font><br>\n
ago	<h3>ago</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>以前<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I realized it three weeks ago.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我在三个星期以前才明白的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How long ago is it that you last saw her?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你上次看见她是多久以前?</font><br>\n
agony	<h3>agony</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>极大的痛苦<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He lay in agony until the doctor arrived.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在医生来到之前, 他一直非常痛苦地躺在那里。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was in an agony of doubt.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我疑虑不安, 十分痛苦。</font><br>\n
agree	<h3>agree</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>同意, 赞同<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I asked him to come with me and he agreed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我请他和我一起来, 他同意了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We must agree the arrangements for this.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们必须接受为此所作的安排。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They agreed to reserve four tickets for us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们答应给我们留四张票。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>相同, 相符, 一致<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The essential thing is that the two of you ought to agree.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 根本的问题是你们俩应意见一致。</font><br>(气候、食物等)适宜, 相和<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These two shades do not agree.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这两种色调不协调。</font><br>\n
agreeable	<h3>agreeable</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>欣然同意的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was quite agreeable to accepting the plan.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他乐意接受这项计划。</font><br>令人愉快的, 惬意的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's very agreeable to have you here.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有你在这里很令人愉快。</font><br>\n
agreement	<h3>agreement</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>协定, 协议, 契约<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A signed agreement is not susceptible of change.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 已签署的协议不可再改动。</font><br>达成协议<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It took three years for the two countries to hammer out an agreement.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 两国花了3年的时间经过反复讨论才达成协议。</font><br>同意<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His silence implied agreement.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的沉默意味着同意。</font><br>\n
agriculture	<h3>agriculture</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>农业<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Problems also exist in agriculture.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 农业也存在着一些问题。</font><br>农学, 农艺<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our knowledge about agriculture has so far been exclusively confined to books.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们对农业学的知识至今只限于书本上所说的。</font><br>\n
ahead	<h3>ahead</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>在(某人或某事物的)前面<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The road forks further ahead.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 路在前面分岔。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Do you know the man ahead?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你认识前面那个人吗?</font><br>\n
aid	<h3>aid</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>帮助, 援助<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They aided the poor.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们帮助穷人。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>帮助, 援助, 救助<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He went to the aid of the hurt man.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他前去帮助那受伤的人。</font><br>助手, 辅助物, 辅助手段<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was a doctor's aid for a time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他一度做过一名大夫的助手。</font><br>\n
AIDS	<h3>AIDS</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>艾滋病<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Do you know what is AIDS?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你知道什么是艾滋病吗？</font><br>\n
aim	<h3>aim</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(以…)瞄准; 针对<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She aimed the gun carefully.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她用枪仔细瞄准。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>以…为目标[目的]<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You aim too low.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你志向太低。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>瞄准<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His aim was very good.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他瞄得很准。</font><br>目标, 目的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has a high aim in life.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他目标很高。</font><br>\n
air	<h3>air</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>天空, 大气, 空气; 气氛<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We breathe air.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们呼吸空气。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There was an air of excitement at the meeting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 会议上气氛激昂。</font><br>空中<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Many birds are flying in the air.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 许多鸟儿在空中飞翔。</font><br>样子, 神态, 姿态<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They were displeased with her haughty airs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们讨厌她高傲的派头。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>晾晒, 烘干<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The straw mattresses are airing there.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 草垫子正在那里晾着。</font><br>播送, 广播<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The program airs daily.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 本节目每天广播。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>使房间通风, 透气<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We air the room by opening the windows.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们打开窗子让屋子通风。</font><br>\n
air-conditioning	<h3>air-conditioning</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>空调设备, 空调系统<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She bent her glance on the air-conditioning.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把目光转到空调上。</font><br>\n
