inner	<h3>inner</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>内部的, 里面的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The label is on the inner side of the box.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 标签贴在盒子内侧。</font><br>内心的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I could not guess what his inner thought might be.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我真猜不出他的内心想法。</font><br>\n
innocence	<h3>innocence</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>清白; 无辜<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His innocence was proved at last.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的清白终于得到了证实。</font><br>天真, 单纯<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She has the innocence of a child.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她有小孩般的天真。</font><br>\n
innocent	<h3>innocent</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>清白的, 无罪的, 无辜的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They have imprisoned an innocent man.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们监禁了一个无辜的男子。</font><br>无害的, 没有恶意的<br>涉世不深的; 天真的, 单纯的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was very young, and very innocent.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我那时非常年轻, 幼稚无知。</font><br>头脑简单的; 愚钝的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm not quite so innocent as to believe that.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我还不至于简单到相信那种事的地步。</font><br>\n
input	<h3>input</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>输入, 投入<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp As the input of energy is increased, the volume gets louder.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 随着能量输入的增加, 音量变得更大。</font><br>〈电〉输入端<br>输入的数据<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>把…输入电脑<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Have you inputted the new data yet?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你把新数据输进电脑了吗?</font><br>\n
inquire	<h3>inquire</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>打听, 询问<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The pilot inquired about the weather condition.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这飞行员查问天气情况。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I inquired the way to the station.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我打听去火车站怎么走。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I will inquire when to begin our lessons.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我要去问一下我们什么时候开始上课。</font><br>\n

insect	<h3>insect</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>昆虫<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was bitten by an insect in the garden.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在花园里被虫子咬了一口。</font><br>\n

inside	<h3>inside</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>里面, 内部<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He did not see the inside of the house before he bought it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他买这栋房子前也没进去看看里面是什么样的。</font><br>内脏<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>内部的; 里面的; 内侧的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I keep my wallet in an inside pocket.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我把钱包放在里面的口袋里。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What does your inside leg measure?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你的腿从内侧量有多长?</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>prep.</i></font><br>(表示位置或方向)在或到…里面<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Two minutes later we were inside the taxi.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 两分钟以后我们已经坐在出租车里面了。</font><br>(表示时间)少于<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He will be back inside two days.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他将在两天内回来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She will be here inside an hour.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她一小时之内会到这儿。</font><br>\n

insist	<h3>insist</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>坚决宣称, 坚持认为<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I will have another glass if you insist.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你这样坚持我就再喝一杯。</font><br>坚决要求<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I insisted that they should wait for our return.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我坚决要求他们等我们回来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We insist upon a definite answer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们一定要得到一个肯定的答复。</font><br>\n
inspect	<h3>inspect</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>检查, 检验<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The fire prevention branch inspects factories and all sorts of public buildings.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 消防部门对工厂和各种公共建筑进行检查。</font><br>视察<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The mayor will inspect our school tomorrow.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 市长明天要来视察我们学校。</font><br>\n
inspiration	<h3>inspiration</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>灵感<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These events provided the inspiration for his first novel.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些事件给了他创作第一部小说的灵感。</font><br>鼓舞人心的人[事物]<br>〈口〉突然想出的好主意; 妙计<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I've just had an inspiration; why don't we try turning it the other way!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我突然想出一个好主意—我们为什么不试着向相反的方向转一转呢！</font><br>\n
inspire	<h3>inspire</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>鼓舞, 激励<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His speech inspired the crowd.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的演说鼓舞了群众。</font><br>赋予某人灵感; 启迪<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You inspired me by playing the piano so beautifully.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你弹奏的优美的钢琴曲激发了我的灵感。</font><br>\n

instant	<h3>instant</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>片刻, 顷刻, 刹那<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'll be back in an instant.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我马上就回来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It all happened in an instant.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这一切都发生在一刹那间。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>立即的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I took an instant dislike to him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我一见到他就不喜欢他。</font><br>即食的, 立即可冲食的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'd like a cup of instant coffee.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我要杯速溶咖啡。</font><br>\n
instead	<h3>instead</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>代替; 顶替<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Instead, he did experiments to test and prove an idea before he was ready to accept it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 相反, 他在准备接受一种观念之前, 总是进行试验, 进行验证。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mike doesn't study at all.Instead, he sits idle all day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 迈克根本不肯读书, 相反地, 他终日游手好闲。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She stayed home, and her sister went riding instead.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她留在家里, 她的妹妹骑车去了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I gave up my epic and wrote this little tale instead.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我放弃了写叙事诗, 而写了这个小故事。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you can't go, I will go instead.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果你不能去, 我替你去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If Henry is not well enough to go with you, take me instead.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果亨利不舒服不能跟你去, 那就带我去吧。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mr.Black was ill, so she was taking his class instead.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 布莱克先生生病了, 因此她在代他的课。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The water here is not good, so I'm drinking beer instead.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 此地的水不好, 所以我改喝啤酒。</font><br>\n
instinct	<h3>instinct</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>本能; 天性; 直觉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The sight of the hopeless little boy aroused her maternal instincts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个绝望的小男孩的模样唤起了她的母性。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't ask me;  follow your instincts and do what you think is right.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要问我, 凭你自己的直觉行事, 你认为什么是对的就去做什么。</font><br>\n
institute	<h3>institute</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>建立, 制定; 开始, 着手<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government instituted a consumer protection agency.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府设立了一个消费者保护机构。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>协会, 学会; 学院, 研究院<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I visited a number of scientific institutes in Asia.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我访问了亚洲的许多科学协会。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Many universities have institutes of education.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 许多大学都设有教育学院。</font><br>\n
institution	<h3>institution</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>惯例, 习俗; 制度<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They adopted western culture, institutions, and even clothing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们接受了西方的文化、习俗甚至服饰。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The institution of slavery was once widespread.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 奴隶制度一度广为流行。</font><br>为人熟知常在某处的人<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That old man in the park is a regular institution.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那老人是这公园的常客。</font><br>知名人士, 名流<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My uncle has become quite an institution at the club!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我叔叔在俱乐部里已是颇有名气的人物了!</font><br>慈善机构<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government built a charitable institution for the education of young children.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府建立了一个儿童教育慈善机构。</font><br>建立, 制定<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Institution of such schools was geared to these needs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种学校的建立是与这些需要相配合的。</font><br>\n
instruct	<h3>instruct</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>命令, 指示<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The union issued an order instructing its members not to work overtime.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 工会发出指示, 不让会员超时工作。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The captain instructed the soldiers to retreat.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 上尉命令士兵们撤退。</font><br>教, 指导<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She instructs music once a week at a middle school.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在中学每周教一次音乐课。</font><br>通知<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My agent has instructed me that you still owe me ￡50.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的代理人通知我, 你还欠我50英镑。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We should instruct the passengers what customs regulations are.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们应该向乘客说明海关规则是什么。</font><br>\n
instruction	<h3>instruction</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>命令, 指示<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They had received instructions to watch him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们收到了监视他的命令。</font><br>讲授, 指导, 教学<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I anticipate deriving much instruction from the lecture.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我期望从这演讲中获得很多教益。</font><br>使用说明书, 操作指南<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The instructions for assembling the toy are very clear.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如何装配玩具的说明非常清楚明了。</font><br>\n

insult	<h3>insult</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>侮辱, 冒犯<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don't mean to insult you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我没有侮辱你的意思。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You will insult her if you don't go to her party.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你要是不去参加她举办的聚会, 就对她太无礼了。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>侮辱, 辱骂, 侮辱性的言论<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He turned crimson under the insults.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的脸因受到侮辱而涨得通红。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He shouted insults at the boy who had kicked him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他大声辱骂那个踢了他的男孩。</font><br>\n
insurance	<h3>insurance</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>保险<br>保险业<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She works in insurance.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她从事保险业工作。</font><br>保险费<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He pays out insurance every year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他每年付保险费。</font><br>保险措施, 安全保障<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I have one lock but I bought another as an additional insurance against thieves.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我有一把锁, 可是另外又买了一把作为附加的防盗保障。</font><br>\n
insure	<h3>insure</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>保证, 确保<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Check your work to insure its accuracy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 检查一下你的工作, 以保证它的准确性。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Will it insure success to[for] you?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这将保证你成功吗?</font><br>为…保险, 投保<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp An insurance company will insure your life.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 保险公司可以给你保寿险。</font><br>\n
intact	<h3>intact</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>完整无缺的; 未经触动的; 未受损伤的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He can scarcely survive this scandal with his reputation intact.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他经此丑闻名誉很难不受损。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The glasses remained intact after being dropped.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 眼镜坠地后依然完好无损。</font><br>\n
integrate	<h3>integrate</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>使结合成为整体<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The committee can integrate the different plans.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 委员会能够把几个计划合而为一。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使)融入<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They have lived in this country for ten years, but have never really integrated.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们已在这个国家生活了十年, 但还没有融入这个社会。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Immigrants are integrated into the community.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 移民与该地区的居民融为一体。</font><br>\n
integrity	<h3>integrity</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>正直; 诚实, 诚恳<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is a man of the highest integrity.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是个极其正直的人。</font><br>完整, 完全, 完善<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The old Roman walls may still be seen but not in their integrity.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 古罗马城墙尚可见, 但已残缺不全。</font><br>\n
intellectual	<h3>intellectual</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>智力的; 理智的, 善于思维的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Maths is an intellectual exercise.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 数学是一种智力训练。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Do you know the intellectual property rights?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你知道什么是知识产权吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is an intellectual woman.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她是一个有才华的女人。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>知识分子<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These views were common among intellectuals.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些观点在知识分子中是很普遍的。</font><br>\n
intelligence	<h3>intelligence</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>智力, 智慧; 理解力<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The children were given an intelligence test.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 儿童们接受了智力测验。</font><br>情报, 消息<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The general had secret intelligence of the enemy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 将军掌握了有关敌人的秘密情报。</font><br>情报人员<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Intelligence has[have] reported that enemy is planning a new attack.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 情报人员报告说敌军正在策划发动新攻势。</font><br>\n
intelligent	<h3>intelligent</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>聪明的; 理解力强的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I have not arrived at a very intelligent opinion on that matter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我对那件事还没有高见。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All human beings are much more intelligent than animal.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 整个人类都比动物聪明得多。</font><br>\n
intend	<h3>intend</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>意欲, 打算<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He seems to intend mischief.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 看来他想捣蛋。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He did not intend paying the bill.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他不打算付账。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I intended the gift for you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我打算把这礼物送给你。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I intend this article as teaching material.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我打算把这篇文章用作教材。</font><br>打算使, 想让…做<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She intended that her daughter should study English.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她想让她的女儿学英语。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don't think he intended her any disrespect.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我认为他对她没有不恭的意思。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The father intended his sons to leave with him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 父亲希望儿子们留下来陪他。</font><br>\n
intense	<h3>intense</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>强烈的, 剧烈的; 极端的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Susan was an intense young lady.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 苏珊是一个热情的年轻姑娘。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her dislike for Dick was intense.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她对迪克怀有强烈的憎恶。</font><br>热情的, 热切的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The patient has an intense will to recover.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个病人热切地希望恢复健康。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I find her exhausting to be with—she's too intense.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我感到和她在一起很累, 她这个人太热情了。</font><br>紧张的, 认真的<br>\n
intensify	<h3>intensify</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使)增强, (使)加剧<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The drought has intensified.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 旱情加剧了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Blowing on fire intensifies the heat.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 吹火使热度加强。</font><br>\n
intensive	<h3>intensive</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>加强的, 集中的, 密集的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'll make an intensive study of a subject.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我将集中学一门课程。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Intensive care in hospital is given to the seriously ill.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 病情严重的人在医院里得到了精心的护理。</font><br>彻底的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His investigations were intensive and thorough but revealed nothing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他进行了深入彻底的调查, 但没有发现什么。</font><br>加强语气的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In “It's a bloody miracle!”, “bloody” is used as an intensive word.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在“It's a bloody miracle!”一句中, bloody是用作加强语气的词。</font><br>\n
intention	<h3>intention</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>意图, 意向; 目的; 打算<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is motivated by good intentions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的动机是善良的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The intention of the clause is clear.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那条款的含义是清楚的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm sorry I offended you, but it wasn't my intention.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 对不起, 冒犯你了, 但我绝不是有意的。</font><br>\n
interact	<h3>interact</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>相互作用[影响], 互相配合<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The two ideas interact.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这两种看法互相影响。</font><br>\n
interest	<h3>interest</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>兴趣; 爱好, 嗜好<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He lost interest in much of his research.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他对大部分研究工作失去了兴趣。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His two interests in life are music and paintings.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他生平两大爱好是音乐和绘画。</font><br>利益<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp One should not look after one's own interests alone.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一个人不应当只顾自己的利益。</font><br>利息<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The loan is interest free.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这项贷款是无息的。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>使产生兴趣<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This book interests me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这本书引起了我的兴趣。</font><br>引起…的意愿<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It may interest you to know that Bill will be leaving next week.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 比尔下周就要走了, 你也许很想知道吧。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We shall be interested to hear about it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们都想听到这个消息。</font><br>\n
interesting	<h3>interesting</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>令人感兴趣的, 有趣的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Brewer is a very interesting man.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 布鲁尔是一个很有趣的人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp At the meeting we discussed matters most interesting to us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在会上我们讨论了最感兴趣的那些问题。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp English is interesting to me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 英语在我看来很有趣。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The stories are interesting to listen to.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那些故事听起来很有趣。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is very interesting to listen to him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 听他讲话很有趣。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I find the book very interesting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我觉得这本书很有趣。</font><br>\n
interfere	<h3>interfere</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>干预; 调停<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I have the right to interfere.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我有干预的权利。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp As he is always interfering, I told him to mind his own business.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 因为他常来指手画脚, 所以我让他少管闲事。</font><br>妨碍<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you had not interfered, I should have finished my work by now.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 要不是你打扰我的话, 我现在早已完成了我的工作。</font><br>\n
interference	<h3>interference</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>干涉, 介入<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I wanted to do the thing on my own without outside interference or help.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想独立完成这件事, 不受外界干扰, 也不要外来帮助。</font><br>阻碍, 干扰<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I couldn't hear the program because there was too much interference.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 因干扰太大, 我听不清节目。</font><br>\n
interior	<h3>interior</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>内部<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is water in the interior of the cave.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在山洞的内部有水。</font><br>内地<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She led an expedition into the interior.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她带领一支考察队到内陆地区。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>内部的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They went into the interior room.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们进了内室。</font><br>内地的, 国内的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We arrived at an interior town.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们到达了一个内地城镇。</font><br>\n
intermediate	<h3>intermediate</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>中间的; 中级的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This country is now at an intermediate stage of development.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个国家目前正处于发展的中间阶段。</font><br>\n
internal	<h3>internal</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>内部的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is talking to Tom on the internal telephone.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他正在内线电话上与汤姆交谈。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's not difficult to understand this world when you mastered the internal relations of things.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 掌握了事物的内部联系你就不难理解这个世界。</font><br>国内的, 内政的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The nation's internal affairs are bad.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个国家的内部情况很乱。</font><br>体内的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He suffered internal injuries in an accident.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在一次意外事故中受了内伤。</font><br>\n
international	<h3>international</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>国际的, 国际间进行的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp International trade helps all nations.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 国际贸易有助于所有的国家。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The drug problem is international.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 毒品问题是世界性的。</font><br>\n
Internet	<h3>Internet</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>国际互联网; 因特网<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can find it on the Internet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你可以在因特网上找到它。</font><br>\n
interpret	<h3>interpret</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>解释; 说明<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He interpreted a difficult passage in a book.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他解释了书中一段难懂的文字。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I interpreted his silence as a refusal.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我把他的沉默看作是拒绝的表示。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>口译; 翻译<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please interpret the comments of our foreign guest.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请把外宾的话翻译一下。</font><br>\n
interpretation	<h3>interpretation</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>解释, 说明; 诠释<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This rule does not allow of more than one interpretation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这条规则只能有一种解释。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This passage is open to a variety of interpretations.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这篇文章可以有各种不同的解释。</font><br>表演; 演奏<br>\n
interrupt	<h3>interrupt</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>打断<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Children must learn not to interrupt.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 儿童应学会不要打断别人的讲话。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You'd better not interrupt him. He is sleeping.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你最好别打扰他, 他在睡觉。</font><br>\n
interval	<h3>interval</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>间隔时间<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The interval between the two trees measures 40 feet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这两棵树的间隔是40英尺。</font><br>幕间休息<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The audience were going out for the interval.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 幕间休息时观众走出了剧场。</font><br>\n
interview	<h3>interview</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>面谈, 面试<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The matter can't be discussed except at a personal interview.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这件事只能在面谈时讨论。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't be late for your job interview.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 求职面试不能迟到。</font><br>采访, 交谈<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I never accept interviews.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我从不接受采访。</font><br>会谈, 会见<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The manager has an interview with us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 经理会见了我们。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>面试<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm interviewing all this afternoon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 整个下午, 我都要进行面试。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We interviewed 8 people for the job.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们对谋求这份工作的八个人进行了面试。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>采访; 会见<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I interviewed him about some things.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 就一些事情我采访了他。</font><br>\n
intimate	<h3>intimate</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>亲密的, 密切的; 有性关系的(尤指婚外的)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is my intimate friend.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是我的密友。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Both felt that they had become very intimate.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 两人都感到了他们之间已变得非常亲密。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was intimate with her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他跟她有暧昧关系。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I have long been intimate with him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我和他相识已久。</font><br>私人的, 个人的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can't tell them my intimate thoughts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不能告诉他们我内心深处的想法。</font><br>详尽的, 精通的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is an intimate knowledge of African religions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是一本关于非洲宗教的详尽知识的书。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>至交, 密友<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is my intimate.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是我的至交。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>示意, 暗示<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He intimated his wishes with a slight nod of his head.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他微微点头示意。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He intimated a wish to go by saying that it was late.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他说时间不早了, 暗示他该走了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He intimated to do this work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他暗示他将做这项工作。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She intimated that she had a few words to say.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她示意有几句话要说。</font><br>\n
intimidate	<h3>intimidate</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>恐吓, 威胁<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The gang tried to intimidate the bank manager.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那帮歹徒企图恐吓银行经理。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He intimidates the children by shouting at them.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他朝孩子们大声叫喊以吓唬他们。</font><br>\n
into	<h3>into</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>prep.</i></font><br>(表示时间)持续到, 进行到<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The meeting carried on into the afternoon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 会议一直延续到下午。</font><br>(表示方向)进入…中, 到…里<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Anney dived into the water.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 安尼潜入水中。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He came into the room.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他到房子里面。</font><br>(表示状态)进入…状态, 欠…债<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They burst into laughter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们突然大笑起来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is into me for one hundred yuan.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他欠我100元。</font><br>(表示对象)撞上, 渗进, 非常喜欢<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He bumped into me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他撞上了我。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The oil will soak into the wood.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 油会渗进木头里。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is into music.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她喜欢音乐。</font><br>(表示目标)对着, 朝着<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She looked into my eyes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她盯着我的眼睛看。</font><br>(表示结果)分成, 变成<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He sawed the stick into pieces.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把棍子锯成几截。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Dusk deepened into night.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 黄昏变成了夜色。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She must be into her thirties by now.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她一定30来岁了。</font><br>(表示所属)输入<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The information goes into a computer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这信息输入到电脑中。</font><br>(表示过程)从事于<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He talked of going into medicine.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他谈到要学医。</font><br>(表示运算) 除<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Dividing 3 into 6 gives 2.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 六除以三等于二。</font><br>\n
introduce	<h3>introduce</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>介绍, 引见<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Allow me to introduce myself.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请允许我自我介绍一下。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They shook hands all around and introduced one another.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们一一握手, 互相介绍。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He introduced Mary as his daughter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他介绍说玛丽是他女儿。</font><br>提出, 提出供讨论<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She introduced a suggestion that the committee should meet every week.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她提出了委员会每周碰头的建议。</font><br>引进, 采用<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Production is going up because we have introduced new techniques.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 产量提高了, 因为我们采用了新技术。</font><br>将…放[插]入<br>作为…的开头<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A slow theme introduces the first movement.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 第一乐章以缓慢的主旋律开始。</font><br>\n
introduction	<h3>introduction</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>介绍, 引见<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mary was shy at her introduction to the company.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在向公司介绍自己时, 玛丽感到胆怯。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp With a smile, he makes introductions all round.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他微笑着将在场的人一一作了介绍。</font><br>引言, 导论<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The introduction tells you how to use the book.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 引言告诉你怎样使用这本书。</font><br>引进, 传入; 采用<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He encouraged the introduction of new medical treatments.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他鼓励采用新的医疗方法。</font><br>新采用的东西<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The rabbit is a relatively recent introduction in Australia.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 兔子是相对较新引入澳大利亚的物种。</font><br>\n
invade	<h3>invade</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>侵入, 侵略<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He ordered the army to invade at dawn.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他命令军队在拂晓入侵。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>涌入, 侵袭<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Thousands of tourists invaded the old town.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 数以千计的游客涌入那古老的镇上。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The disease invades their bodies.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 疾病侵袭了他们的身体。</font><br>侵犯, 干扰<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The king invaded our private rights.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 国王侵犯了我们的权利。</font><br>\n
invasion	<h3>invasion</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>侵犯, 侵入, 闯入<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The invasion of tourists brought life to the summer resort.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大批游客涌入, 使这个避暑胜地热闹起来。</font><br>\n
invent	<h3>invent</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>发明; 创造<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Edison invented the electric light.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 爱迪生发明了电灯。</font><br>编造<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She invented false news.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她捏造了假消息。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His stories were purely invented.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的故事纯属虚构。</font><br>\n
invention	<h3>invention</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>发明, 创造<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Necessity is the mother of invention.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 需要是发明之母。</font><br>发明物<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's a most useful invention.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是一项极其有用的发明。</font><br>捏造, 虚构<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The whole story is a pure invention.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这一切纯粹是捏造。</font><br>\n
invest	<h3>invest</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>投资; 花费<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The best time to invest is now.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 现在是投资的最佳时机。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>授予<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He invested his lawyer with complete power to act for him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他让律师全权代办。</font><br>\n

invisible	<h3>invisible</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>看不见的; 暗藏的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The air is full of millions of invisible germs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 空气中充满了许多看不见的细菌。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When I called, he was invisible.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我去访问时, 他没露面。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Many stars are invisible without a telescope.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 许多星辰不用望远镜便看不见。</font><br>\n
invitation	<h3>invitation</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>邀请<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Thank you for your kind invitation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 谢谢你的盛情邀请。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He declined an invitation to dinner.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他谢绝了赴宴的邀请。</font><br>请柬, 请帖<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The invitations are out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请帖已发出。</font><br>\n
invite	<h3>invite</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>邀请<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Did they invite you?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们邀请你了吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They invited me to visit their factory.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们邀我去参观他们的工厂。</font><br>请求, 要求<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She invited our opinion of her story.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她征求我们对她的故事的意见。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After his lecture, he invited questions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 课后, 他请同学们提问。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The audience is invited to ask questions at the end.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 最后请听众提问题。</font><br>引诱, 怂恿; 招致<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Recklessness invites disaster.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 粗心大意招致灾难。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The calm water in the lake invited us to swim.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 平静的湖水引起我们去游泳的兴趣。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't leave the windows open—it's inviting thieves to enter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别让窗户那么开着, 会招来小偷的。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>邀请<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Do you get an invite?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你收到请帖了吗?</font><br>\n

iron	<h3>iron</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>铁<br>熨斗<br>镣铐<br>坚强, 刚强; 冷酷<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is more iron to her than I supposed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她比我原来想像的要坚强得多。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>熨平<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She's been ironing all afternoon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她一下午都在熨衣服。</font><br>\n
irrigate	<h3>irrigate</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>灌溉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They have built canals to irrigate the desert.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们建造成水渠以灌溉沙漠。</font><br>冲洗(伤口)<br>\n

isolate	<h3>isolate</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>使隔离, 使孤立, 使脱离<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Do not isolate yourself from others.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要把自己孤立起来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A chemist can isolate the oxygen from the hydrogen in water.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 化学家可以把水中的氢和氧分离开来。</font><br>\n
issue	<h3>issue</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>问题, 议题; 争论点<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There was no issue at all between us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们之间毫无争议。</font><br>发行物<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is a new issue of Christmas stamps every year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 每年都出一套新的圣诞邮票。</font><br>放出, 流出; 发出, 发行<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I bought the book the day after its issue.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这书出版后的第一天, 我就去买了它。</font><br>〈正〉结果, 结局<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>出版, 发行<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government issues money and stamps.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府发行货币及邮票。</font><br>发表, 发布<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The inspiring call was issued by the President.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这鼓舞人心的号召是总统发出的。</font><br>分配, 发给<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We also issued agricultural loans.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们还发放了农业贷款。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The end hut is to be used for issuing guns to the new soldiers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 最边上的那间小屋要用来给新兵发放武器。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They advised the government not to issue him a passport to travel abroad.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们奉劝政府不要给他发护照出国旅游。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>冒出, 流出; 传出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Strange sounds issued from the castle.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 城堡传来怪异的声音。</font><br>\n
it	<h3>it</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>pron.</i></font><br>它<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This suitcase looks heavy but actually it is very light.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个皮箱看上去很重, 实际上很轻。</font><br>他<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her baby's due next month.She hopes it will be a boy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她怀的孩子下个月出生, 她希望是个男孩儿。</font><br>事实[情况]<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is a very long way from the West Coast to the East of America.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 从美国的西岸到东岸的距离是很长的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is ten o'clock in the morning.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 现在是早上十点钟。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is raining.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 下雨了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was on Sunday that an American friend of mine came to see me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个星期天, 我的一个美国朋友来看我。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Where did she go?—It was to Britain that she went.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她去了什么地方?——她去的地方是英国。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don't like it that he should be alone with my girlfriend.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我可不喜欢他单独和我的女朋友在一起。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is not easy if you ask her to stop.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你让她停下来可不容易。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's very clear what the red-haired man means.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个红头发男人的意思很明显。</font><br>\n
italic	<h3>italic</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>(印刷字体)斜体的<br>(书写)整齐尖细的<br>(I-)古意大利的<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>斜体字<br>\n
item	<h3>item</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>一项, 一件, 一条; 项目<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The police examined several items of clothing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警方检查了几件衣服。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is the next item on the agenda.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是议事日程上的下一个项目。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Are there any interesting news items in the paper this morning?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 今天早晨报上有什么有趣的新闻吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The shop window was filled with hundreds of items.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这家商店的橱窗里摆满了几百种物品。</font><br>\n
its	<h3>its</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>pron.</i></font><br>(it的所有格形式)它的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The audience showed its approval by cheering loudly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 观众高声喝彩表示赞许。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A monkey is very alert in its movements.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 猴子的动作很敏捷。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The rabbit seems to be very alert all its life.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 兔子似乎一生都小心翼翼, 十分警觉。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her skin was admired for its velvety softness.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的皮肤如天鹅绒般柔软, 令人赞叹。</font><br>\n
itself	<h3>itself</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>pron.</i></font><br>(it的反身形式)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The arrow embedded itself in the wall.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 箭牢牢地扎进墙里。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The Nile discharges itself into the Mediterranean.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 尼罗河水注入地中海。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This trifle developed itself into a serious problem.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这件小事已发展成一个很严重的问题。</font><br>(it的强调形式)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The land itself is worth the money, without the house.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不算房子, 这地皮本身就值那些钱。</font><br>\n
jacket	<h3>jacket</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>短上衣, 夹克<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's in my jacket pocket.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 它在我上衣口袋里。</font><br>书籍的护封<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I like the design on this book jacket.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我喜欢这本书的护封上的图案。</font><br>\n
jail	<h3>jail</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>监狱<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The castle had been used as a jail.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这城堡曾用作监狱。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>监禁, 拘留<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was jailed for life for murder.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他因杀人罪被终生监禁。</font><br>\n
jam	<h3>jam</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>果酱<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The knives and forks were kept in a jam jar.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 刀叉原来放在一个果酱罐里。</font><br>拥挤, 堵塞<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There was such a jam of people that we couldn't get in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 由于人多拥挤, 我们无法进入。</font><br>困难的处境; 窘境<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He's in an awful jam over his marriage.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他因婚事而陷入极大的困境。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使)塞紧, (使)挤满<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Shoppers jammed the stores at Christmas time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 圣诞节时购物的人挤满了商店。</font><br>发生故障; 夹住, 卡住<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The door has jammed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 门卡住了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The girl jammed her hand when she closed the drawer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个女孩在关抽屉时夹了手。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>堵塞<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The parade jammed traffic all over the town.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 游行队伍阻塞了全市的交通。</font><br>(发射无线电波)干扰(信息, 节目)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They were sent to jam the enemy's radio stations during the war.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 战争期间他们被派去干扰敌人的电台。</font><br>\n
January	<h3>January</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>一月<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Generally speaking, the coldest weather comes in January.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一般来说, 一月的天气是最冷的。</font><br>\n
jar	<h3>jar</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>罐子, 广口瓶<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The jar contained assorted hard candies.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这罐子里装有什锦糖。</font><br>(啤酒)杯<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He's going down to the bar for a few jars tomorrow.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他打算明天去酒吧喝几杯啤酒。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>发出刺耳的声音<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The chalk jarred against the blackboard.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 粉笔在黑板上发出吱吱声。</font><br>不和谐; 不一致<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Try to avoid colours that jar when choosing curtains and rugs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 选择窗帘和地毯时, 尽量避免颜色不调和。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>使震动<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The fall jarred every bone in my body.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那一跤摔得我浑身骨头酸痛。</font><br>\n

join	<h3>join</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>连接, 联结<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The two estates join at this point.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 两块房地产在这儿邻接。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Which two rivers join at Lyon?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 哪两条河在里昂相汇合?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The three roads join near the bridge.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 桥附近三条路交会。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The two roads join here.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 两条路在这里交叉。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Parallel lines are lines that never join.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 平行线是永不相交的线。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Nouns join to form compounds.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 名词和名词结合构成复合词。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He joined the ends of the chain.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把链子的两端接起来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Use some paste to join the broken ends.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 用点糨糊把断头接起来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp To join these two pieces of metal, it will be necessary to heat them.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 要把这两块金属接合起来, 就要将它们加热。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Join those two ends of wire and you'll make a circuit.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把那两个导线连接起来即构成一个电路。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How can we join this island and that one?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们怎样才能将这个岛和那个岛连接起来?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They joined their two hands and smiled.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们将手放在一起, 笑了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A bridge joins the two banks of the river.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一座桥把河的两岸连在一起。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The two houses join each other.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这两座房子毗连。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The pupil joined the two points by a straight line.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个小学生用直线把两点连接起来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The cars joined their trains.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 车厢挂到列车上。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The lane joins the main road.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这条小巷通大路。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The lean-to joined the hut at the eaves.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个棚子和小屋子的后檐连在一起。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Where do the two streams join each other?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这两条小溪在什么地方汇流?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The Grand Canal joins the Hai River at Tianjin.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大运河在天津和海河汇合。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Wait for me where this road joins the main road.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在这条路和大路会合的地方等我。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is where the road to Oxford joins the road to London.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是去牛津的路与去伦敦的路的汇合处。</font><br>加入, 参加, 同…一起做某事<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Has he joined or not?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他参加了还是没参加?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Anyone who wants to can join.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 愿意的都可以参加。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They joined a moving line of marchers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们加入了行进者的行列。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When did you join the air force?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你什么时候参加的空军部队?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His son joined the army last year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他儿子去年入伍。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was eighteen years old when he joined the army.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他18岁参军。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The regular troops of Baden joined the insurgents.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 巴登的正规军参加到起义军方面来了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp John joined a football club a few days ago.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 约翰几天前加入了一个足球俱乐部。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mary joined a church yesterday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 玛丽昨天加入了教会。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Who persuaded you to join this society?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 谁劝说你加入这个协会?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He joined the diplomatic service in 1943.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他于1943年进入外交界工作。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Soon afterwards he joined the work of the peasants association.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不久之后, 他就参加了农会的工作。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He joined a flying school in Moscow.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他进了莫斯科一所飞行学校。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Come along and join the ball game.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 过来和我们一块儿打球。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After a little while she joined the dancing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 过了一会儿她参加了跳舞。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Encouraged by them, old men and women also joined them.</font></i><br><font judge	<h3>judge</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>法官<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The powers of a judge are defined by law.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 法官的权限是由法律规定的。</font><br>裁判员, 评判员<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The panel of judges included several well-known writers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 评判小组中包括几位知名作家。</font><br>鉴定人, 鉴赏家<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mr. Tailor is a good judge of the fine arts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 泰勒先生是美术鉴赏行家。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>审判; 评判; 断定<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I am not in the position to judge.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我无权作出判断。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp As far as I can judge, this book is useful.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 据我判断, 这本书有用。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was asked to judge at the art exhibition.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他被邀请当画展的评委。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They have their own minds.They will judge for themselves.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们自己有头脑, 可以自己作出判断。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is hard to judge this case.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个案子很难断。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The court was unable to judge the case before all evidence was put before it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在全部证据被提出来之前, 法庭不能审判这个案子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She seemed to be watching him, judging him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她似乎在观察他, 评价他。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Who is going to judge the horses?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 谁来评判马匹的优劣呢?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Who is going to judge the long-jump competition?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 谁来当跳远比赛的裁判?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Teachers always judge their students on the final examination.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 老师常根据期末考试来评价他们的学生。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We must know how to judge people.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们必须善于识别人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you judge which way to take?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你能判断应走哪一条路吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was calm and concentrated in judging how to defeat his opponent.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他冷静沉着, 聚精会神地判断如何打败对手。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The police judged the criminal was still in the city.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警察断定该罪犯仍在这个城市。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The teacher judged his students had finished the exercises.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 老师估计学生们已做完了练习。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I judged, from his manner, that he was guilty.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 从他的举止态度来看, 我判断他有罪。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I judged that you had forgotten to come.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我判断你是忘记来了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I judged that it was best to resign.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我认为辞职是最好的选择。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We judge that she is the best candidate.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们认为她是最佳人选。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He's too young to judge which is better.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他太年轻, 不能判断哪一个更好。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How will they judge which is likely to be reliable?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们如何断定哪一个是更可靠的?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you judge who will win?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你能断定谁会获胜吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Nobody can judge why he did it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 谁都无法判断他为什么干那事。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you judge how he finished it so soon?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你能判断他怎样如此快速地完成了这件事?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can't judge whether he was right or wrong.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不能断定他是对还是错。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can't judge whether he will come today.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不能断定他今天是否来这里。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I couldn't judge whether the delay was good or bad.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不能断定这样延迟是好还是坏。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I judge him a skilled worker.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我断定他是个熟练工人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We judged the distance to be four miles.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们估计距离在4英里。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He judged them to be the best plays he had ever seen.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他认为它们是他看过的最好的话剧。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They judged her stupid.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们认为她很蠢。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I judge him to be loyal.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我认为他很忠诚。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These horses were judged the best in the county.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些马被评为全县最好的马。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She judged it a useless attempt to advise him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她断定, 给他提建议是徒劳的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He judges it safer to go away than to stay.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他认为离开比留下安全。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The committee judged it better to start the work at once.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 委员会认为最好立即开始这项工作。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She judged them to have finished.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她断定他们已经干完了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I judged them to have gone.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我断定他们已经走了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They judged it of little importance.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们断定它毫不重要。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp By noon, all 61 people were judged out of danger.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 到中午时, 有61个人看来脱离了危险。</font><br>\n
judgement	<h3>judgement</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>审判, 判决; 裁判<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He passed judgement on the accused man.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他对被告做出了判决。</font><br>判断, 判断力<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can't make that decision for you, you will have to use your judgement.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不能代你作决定, 你得自己拿主意了。</font><br>看法, 意见, 评价<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I felt completely unable to come to any judgement about it at all.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 关于这件事我觉得无法提出任何看法。</font><br>\n

kill	<h3>kill</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>杀死<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These flowers kill easily.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些花很容易枯死。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was almost killed in the fighting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在战斗中, 我差一点儿被杀死。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>使停止[结束, 失败]<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This has killed my hopes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这毁灭了我的希望。</font><br>破坏, 减弱, 抵消<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp One colour may kill another near it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一种颜色可能使相近的颜色显不出来。</font><br>\n
killer	<h3>killer</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>杀手,凶手,杀人魔<br>\n

kind	<h3>kind</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>亲切的, 和蔼的, 友好的, 仁慈的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The kind old man is accompanied all the time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这位和蔼的老人一直有人陪伴着。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is kind and friendly despite his rather bluff manner.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他为人厚道, 待人亲切, 虽然态度有点粗鲁。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was kind and generous.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她心地善良, 宽容大量。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They were exceedingly kind.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们极为客气。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She has been very kind about letting us use her house.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她十分友好, 让我们使用她的房子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Be kind to animals.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 对动物要仁慈。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Be kind to old people.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 对老人要爱戴。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is always kind to her pupils.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她对她的学生总是很和善。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is kind and gentle to the weak.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他对弱者总是友好和善。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is kind with his parents.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他和他的双亲关系很好。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You are kind to come.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 难得你来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You were kind enough to wait for us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你等我们, 真是太好了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's very kind of you to show so much concern for us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 谢谢您对我们这么关心。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was very kind of you to visit me when I was ill.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 感谢你在我生病时来看我。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's too kind of you to have told me that.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你把那件事告诉了我, 真是太好了。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>种类<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is the kind who always arrives late.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是那种经常迟到的人。</font><br>本质, 性质<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The analysis of what kind of temperament you possess is vital.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 分析一下你有什么样的气质是十分重要的。</font><br>\n

kindness	<h3>kindness</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>亲切, 仁慈, 好意<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Will you have the kindness to hand me that book?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请把那本书递给我好吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Many thanks for your kindness in seeing me off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 多谢您好意相送。</font><br>友好的行为<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I think it would be a kindness to tell him the bad news.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我认为告诉他这条坏消息倒是友好的行为。</font><br>\n
king	<h3>king</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>君主, 国王<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They made him king.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们拥戴他为国王。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is a portrait of King Charles on the wall.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 墙上挂着查尔斯国王的画像。</font><br>重要的人[动物, 事物]; 大王<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The lion is king of the jungle.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 狮子是丛林之王。</font><br>\n
kingdom	<h3>kingdom</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>王国<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After the old king died, his son ruled over the kingdom.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 老国王死后, 他儿子统治这个王国。</font><br>界<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This creature had the largest eyes in the whole animal kingdom.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种动物在整个动物界中眼睛最大。</font><br>领域<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is the fight of the kingdom of the mind.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是思想领域的斗争。</font><br>\n

knit	<h3>knit</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>编结, 编织<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She knits all day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她整日编织毛线。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mother is knitting a sweater.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 母亲正在织毛衣。</font><br>(使)紧密地结合<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A broken bone can knit.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 碎骨可长合。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The doctor knit the two broken bones in his arm.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 医生把他臂上的两块折骨接好了。</font><br>\n
knock	<h3>knock</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>短促的敲打(声)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When he heard the knock, he ceased writing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当他听到敲门声, 就停下来不写了。</font><br>爆震声<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>敲, 击, 打<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please knock before entering.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 进来前先敲门。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The children were knocking the bottom of the box.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们在敲箱子底。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>批评, 数落, 非难<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The newspapers are too fond of knocking the team.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 报纸专爱挖苦那个队。</font><br>\n
knot	<h3>knot</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>结<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He made a knot in the rope.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在绳子上打了个结。</font><br>一小群人<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A knot of people stood talking outside the door.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一群人站在门外聊天。</font><br>硬节, 节瘤<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A knot sometimes forms in a tired muscle.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 疲乏的肌肉上有时会起硬块。</font><br>节, 海里/小时<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The steamer makes 20 knots an hour.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这艘轮船的时速是20海里。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使)打结, 缠结<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My thread has knotted.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的线打起结来了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She knotted the parcel firmly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把那个小包扎得很紧。</font><br>\n
know	<h3>know</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>知道, 懂得<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I honestly don't know.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我真的不知道。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He knows English and French.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他懂英文和法文。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I know he is always shooting off his mouth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我知道他说话老是漏嘴。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He knew where she was hiding.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他知道她藏在哪里。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>认识, 了解, 熟悉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I got to know him in the autumn of 1963.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我是在1963年秋天认识他的。</font><br>\n
knowledge	<h3>knowledge</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>了解, 理解<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He denied any knowledge of them.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他否认了解他们。</font><br>个人的知识[学识, 见闻]<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is limited in an up-to-date knowledge.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的最新知识有限。</font><br>学问<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is poor in money, but rich in knowledge.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他贫于金钱, 但富于学问。</font><br>\n
