mouth	<h3>mouth</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>口, 嘴巴<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't speak with your mouth full.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当嘴里塞满东西时不要讲话。</font><br>多嘴<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don't want any mouth from you!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你别给我多嘴！</font><br>人; 讲话的人<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is the mouth of the House.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是议会的代言人。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>(嘴)做出说[唱]…的动作 (但不出声)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The actor mouthed the words of the recorded song.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 演员不出声地哼着那首已经事先录好音的歌曲。</font><br>喃喃地说, 心不在焉地说, 言不由衷地说<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was mouthing the usual platitudes about the need for more compassion.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他言不由衷地说些需要更加同情之类的陈腔滥调。</font><br>\n
move	<h3>move</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>移动; 搬动<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Nobody moves.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 谁也不许动。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is going to move his furniture.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他打算把家具移动一下位置。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>搬家, 迁移<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We are moving next week.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们下星期搬家。</font><br>进展, 前进, 展开<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The work moves slowly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 工作进展缓慢。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>使感动, 激起<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The news moved him very much.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这消息使他很感动。</font><br>提议, 要求<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I move that we adopt the agenda as it stands.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我提议不作改变通过这个议程。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>动, 移动<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The snake made a small move.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 蛇稍微动了一下。</font><br>一步, 一着<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp One careless move loses the whole game.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一着不慎, 全盘皆输。</font><br>行动, 行动步骤<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Unless we make a move soon, we shall not be able to fulfill our plan.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果不赶快采取行动, 我们就不能完成计划了。</font><br>迁移, 搬家<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We'll make a move to the city next week.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们下星期要搬家到这个城市来。</font><br>\n
movement	<h3>movement</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>移动; 运动; 活动<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Downward movement is much faster than upward one.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 向下移动比向上移动快得多。</font><br>动作, 姿势<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We were amused at his funny movements in doing morning exercises.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他做早操时的滑稽动作使我们觉得好笑。</font><br>调动<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Troop movements can be observed from space by a satellite.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 借助卫星可以观察到部队的调动。</font><br>动向, 趋向, 倾向<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He could not yet tell where the movement of his thought would take him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他还不敢说他的思想发展趋势会把他引向何方。</font><br>运动, 开展运动的团体<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The trade union movement is[are] concerned with working conditions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 工会运动关注工作条件。</font><br>乐章<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is a beautiful movement.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是一篇优美的乐章。</font><br>\n
movie	<h3>movie</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>电影<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This movie really catches the flavour of New York.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这部影片真正抓住了纽约的特色。</font><br>电影院<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is going to the movies.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他打算去看电影。</font><br>\n
much	<h3>much</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>非常, 很, 十分<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The car was too much damaged.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这部车损坏得太严重。</font><br>差不多, 几乎<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The dress is much the most expensive.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这件衣服差不多是最贵的。</font><br>很多地, 很大地, 程度极高地<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You have much more confidence.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你有更大的信心。</font><br>很大程度上, 常常<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Do you dine out much?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你常常在外面进餐吗?</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>许多的, 大量的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I have got far too much work to do.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我要做的事太多了。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>pron.</i></font><br>很多, 大量, 很大程度<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jack had drunk too much in the party.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 杰克在晚会上喝得太多了。</font><br>很好的东西<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We learned much from the experience.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们从这一经验中学到很多东西。</font><br>\n
mud	<h3>mud</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>泥, 烂泥<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mud caked on his shoes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 烂泥粘在他的鞋上。</font><br>\n
mug	<h3>mug</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>圆筒形有柄大杯<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There are three coffee mugs on the table.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 桌子上有三个大咖啡杯。</font><br>〈口〉容易受骗的人, 傻瓜<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don't think some mug will buy his fake jewellery.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想没有哪个傻瓜会买他的假珠宝。</font><br>〈俚〉脸<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She's got a handsome mug.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她有一张漂亮的脸蛋。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What an ugly mug!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 多难看的一张脸！</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>对…行凶抢劫<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A lot of people won't go out at night for fear of being mugged.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 因害怕遭到行凶抢劫, 许多人在晚上不出门。</font><br>\n
multiple	<h3>multiple</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>多重的, 多种多样的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He excels in multiple-choice questions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他擅长做选择题。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The driver of the crashed car received multiple injuries.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 出事汽车的司机多处受伤。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is a multiple job holder.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她是个兴趣多样的职业者。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>〈数〉倍数<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The number 8 is a multiple of 4.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 八是四的倍数。</font><br>\n
multiply	<h3>multiply</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>乘, (使)相乘<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His son is learning to multiply and divide.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他儿子正在学习乘法和除法。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp One can make 18 by multiplying 3 and 6 (together).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 以3和6相乘可得18。</font><br>(使)增加<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Spending on military equipment has multiplied in the last five years.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 过去的五年中军事装备的开支大大增加。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His experience was multiplied as the years passed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 随着岁月的流逝, 他的经验丰富了。</font><br>(使)繁殖<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When animals have more food, they generally multiply faster.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 动物在有较多的食物时, 一般繁殖得较快。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Hot weather multiplied the bacteria in milk rapidly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 炎热的天气使牛奶中的细菌迅速繁殖。</font><br>\n
murder	<h3>murder</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>谋杀; 谋杀案<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was charged with murder but they found him innocent of the charge.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他被控告谋杀, 但人们发现他是无辜的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is the identical knife with which the murder was committed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这就是谋杀时所用的刀子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Nine murders were committed last week in this city.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 上星期该市发生了九起谋杀案。</font><br>杀戮<br>极艰难[令人沮丧]的经历<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is murder trying to find a parking place for the car.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 找个停车的地方比登天还难。</font><br>对某事物造成极大的伤害[不便]的事物<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>谋杀<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He murdered another man in a fight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在打斗中他把另一个人杀死了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She murdered her husband with a knife.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她用刀杀害了丈夫。</font><br>糟蹋<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They murdered the piece of music.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们把这首曲子演奏得糟透了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Do you ever murder the English language?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你有没有胡乱使用英语?</font><br>\n
muscle	<h3>muscle</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>肌肉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Exercise conditions your muscles.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 锻炼使肌肉健壮。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When you bend your elbow, you contract the muscles of the arm.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你屈肘时, 手臂的肌肉就会收缩。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Lifting weights will build arm and shoulder muscles.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 举重会使手臂和肩膀的肌肉发达。</font><br>肌肉组织<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The heart is made of muscle.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 心脏是肌肉组织。</font><br>肌肉的力量<br>(操纵他人的)力量<br>\n
museum	<h3>museum</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>博物馆<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You won't see live animals in a museum.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在博物馆里你不会看见活的动物。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Employees have liberty to use all the museum facilities.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 雇员获准使用所有博物馆的设备。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is a large library in the British Museum.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大英博物馆有个很大的图书馆。</font><br>\n
mushroom	<h3>mushroom</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>蘑菇<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Some mushrooms are good to eat; some are poisonous.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有些蘑菇可食用, 有些则有毒。</font><br>如蘑菇般生长迅速的事物<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Birmingham is a mushroom.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 伯明翰是个迅猛发展的城市。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The mushroom development of technology will pave the way for improving our economy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 科学技术的迅猛发展将为我们改善经济状况铺平道路。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>迅速成长[发展]<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp New housing estates have mushroomed on the edge of the town.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 城郊的新住宅楼发展得十分迅速。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The little town mushroomed into a city.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那座小镇迅速发展成一座城市。</font><br>成蘑菇状扩散<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The smoke mushroomed into the sky.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 烟呈蘑菇状升上天空。</font><br>\n
music	<h3>music</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>音乐<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was a great deal interested in music.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他对音乐非常感兴趣。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I like the idiom of modern popular music.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我喜欢现代流行音乐的风格。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I listened to the music on the radio.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我收听广播中播放的音乐。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They waltz to the tempo of the music.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们跟着音乐的节奏跳华尔兹舞。</font><br>音乐作品, 乐曲<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He read the words and decided to write new music for them.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他读后决定为这首词谱写一个新曲子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Many people like his music.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 许多人喜欢他的乐曲。</font><br>乐谱<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'd left my music at home.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我把乐谱落在家里了。</font><br>\n
musical	<h3>musical</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>音乐的, 用于音乐的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He showed exceptional musical ability.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他显示出特殊的音乐才能。</font><br>喜爱[精通]音乐的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was from a musical family.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她出身于音乐世家。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is very musical.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她非常喜爱音乐。</font><br>音调优美的; 悦耳的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The piece of bamboo makes a musical sound.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这块竹片能发出悦耳的声音。</font><br>\n
musician	<h3>musician</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>音乐家<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Even great musicians require constant practice.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 即使是伟大的音乐家也需要不断的练习。</font><br>\n
must	<h3>must</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>aux.v.</i></font><br>必须<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you can't finish the book by then, you must come and renew it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这本书如果你到时候还看不完, 就必须来续借。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The children must be back by 4 o'clock.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们必须四点钟以前回来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You must remember to write home.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你必须记着给家里写信。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We mustn't waste our time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们不应该浪费时间。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “May I take this magazine out?”“No, you mustn't.”</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “我可以把这本杂志借走吗?”“不, 不行。”</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He said he must go tomorrow.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他说他明天必须去。</font><br>必然要, 必定会<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We must all die.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 人都是要死的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How long must this go on?What's the sense of this?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种局势要持续多久呢?它有什么意义呢?</font><br>(做出逻辑推断)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He must be mad.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他一定是疯了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You must be joking.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你一定是在开玩笑吧。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This house must belong to John.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这栋房子一定是约翰的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She must have been young when she got married.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她结婚时一定很年轻。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You must win, if you do your best.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果你全力以赴, 一定能赢。</font><br>(表示坚持)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you must smoke, at least you could use an ashtray.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果你一定要吸烟, 起码总可以用一个烟灰缸吧。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Why must you always be finding fault with that girl?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你为何总是要找那个姑娘的错呢?</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>必须做的事, 必不可少的事物<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Warm clothes are a must in the mountains.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 到山区去穿暖和的衣服是必须的。</font><br>\n
mustache	<h3>mustache</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>胡子<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His father shaved off his mustache.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的父亲剃了小胡子。</font><br>\n
mutual	<h3>mutual</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>相互的, 彼此的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They were mutual enemies.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们相互为敌。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We will put military muscle into the mutual defence pact.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们将把兵力加进防御互助条约。</font><br>共同的, 共有的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is our mutual friend.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她是我们共同的朋友。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I like her and I hope the feeling is mutual.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我喜欢她, 我希望她也喜欢我。</font><br>\n
my	<h3>my</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>pron.</i></font><br>我的, 属于我的<br>(用于名词或形容词前作为称呼某人的方式)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My dear Anne!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 亲爱的安妮！</font><br>(用于感叹)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My god!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 天哪！</font><br>\n
myself	<h3>myself</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>pron.</i></font><br>(I的反身形式)我自己<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I hurt myself.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我伤了自己。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I myself can do the job.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我自己能做这项工作。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm not quite myself this morning.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我今天早上不太舒服。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I come to myself.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我清醒过来了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My husband and myself are both doctors.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我丈夫和我都是医生。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp No one knows more about it than myself.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 关于这件事没有一个人比我知道得更多。</font><br>\n
mysterious	<h3>mysterious</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>神秘的; 难以理解的<br>诡秘的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His action was very mysterious.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的行动十分神秘。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was very mysterious in his manner.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的行为举止十分神秘。</font><br>\n
mystery	<h3>mystery</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>神秘(性), 秘密(性)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He often tells stories full of mystery.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他常讲些充满神秘色彩的故事。</font><br>神秘的事, 难以理解的事物<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The flying saucer is yet an unsolved mystery.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 飞碟仍然是未解之谜。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Science can disclose the mysteries of nature.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 科学能解开自然界的奥秘。</font><br>来历不明[难探究竟]的人<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She's a bit of a mystery!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她这人有点来历不明!</font><br>\n
myth	<h3>myth</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>神话<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Nobody believes in the myth about human beings becoming immortals.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 谁也不相信人能成仙的神话。</font><br>杜撰出来的人[事物]<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The story is a pure myth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这故事纯属虚构。</font><br>\n
nail	<h3>nail</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>钉子, 钉状物<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He drove in a nail with one stroke of the hammer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他一锤就把钉子敲进去了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Magnets attract nails.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 磁铁吸引铁钉。</font><br>指甲, 趾甲<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I have tried to discourage him from biting nails.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我曾劝阻他不要咬指甲。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My nails are too long, I must file them down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的指甲太长了, 必须把它们锉平。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>钉住, 钉牢<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He nailed boards together to make a box.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把几块木板钉在一起做了一个箱子。</font><br>抓住, 逮住<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Has the police nailed the man?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警察抓住那个人了吗?</font><br>\n
naked	<h3>naked</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>裸露的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Naked bathing is not allowed to this beach.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个海滩禁止裸泳。</font><br>赤裸裸的, 无遮蔽的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp To the east of our school, there's a naked hillside.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们学校东边有片光秃秃的山坡。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Beneath them the earth was naked of grass.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在他们脚下是寸草不生的土地。</font><br>不加掩饰的; 坦白的, 明显的<br>\n
name	<h3>name</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>名字, 名称<br>名声; 名誉<br>著名的人物, 名人<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All the big names in the pop music world were at the party.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 流行音乐界的头号人物都参加了聚会。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>给…取名<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Have you named the new baby yet?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你给新婴儿取名了吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They named him John.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们给他取名为约翰。</font><br>说出…的名字, 提…的名字; 列举<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The child can name all the flowers in the garden.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那孩子能说出花园里所有的花名。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you name the chief rivers of China?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你能列举出中国的主要河流吗?</font><br>决定; 任命; 提名<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They named Smith as president.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们提名史密斯担任主席。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The President named him to be Secretary of State.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 总统任命他为国务卿。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The President named him to head the delegation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 总统指定他率领代表团。</font><br>\n
namely	<h3>namely</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>即, 也就是<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Only one boy was absent, namely Harry.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 只有一个孩子缺席, 就是哈利。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He could not do anything more than what he promised —namely, to look after Charlotte's estate.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他只能做到自己答应的事, 那就是照看夏洛蒂的产业。</font><br>\n
napkin	<h3>napkin</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>餐巾<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The boys left their dirty napkins at the table.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 男孩子们把他们用过的脏餐巾留在餐桌上。</font><br>〈英·正〉 尿布<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is a disposable napkin.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是一次性尿布。</font><br>\n
narrative	<h3>narrative</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>记叙文; 故事<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His trip through the world made an interesting narrative.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他周游世界的旅行是个很有趣的故事。</font><br>叙述, 讲述; 叙述部分<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In narrative, the reporting verb is in the past tense.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在叙述过程中, 间接引语的动词通常用过去式。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Narrative makes up most of the book.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这本书的大部分篇幅都是叙述性的。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>叙述的; 叙事体的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was a writer of great narrative power.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是一位颇有记述能力的作家。</font><br>\n
narrow	<h3>narrow</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>狭窄的; 狭隘的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The decision was taken for narrow economic reasons, without considering its social effects.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这一决定是从狭隘的经济观点做出的, 并没有考虑社会效应。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Be careful when you back into the garage, the doorway is very narrow.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你倒车入库时要小心, 门道很窄。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The bridge is too narrow for two cars to pass.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这桥太窄, 并排通不过两辆车。</font><br>勉强的; 险胜的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was elected chairman by a narrow margin.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他以微弱多数当选为主席。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She won the champion by a narrow margin.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她以微弱优势赢得冠军。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使)变窄<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The river narrows at this point.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 河在这里变窄了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The road narrows here.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 路在这儿变窄了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The gap has narrowed considerably.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 分歧大大缩小了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In the bright sunlight she had to narrow her eyes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在强烈阳光下她必须眯着双眼。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The doctor narrows his study.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 医生缩小了他的研究范围。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Living in the convent narrowed her views.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 修道院生活使她的视野变窄。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The benefit was narrowed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 利益变得越来越少了。</font><br>\n
nasty	<h3>nasty</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>令人讨厌的; 令人厌恶的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Try to get rid of your nasty cold.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 想法除去你那讨厌的感冒。</font><br>恶意的; 恶毒的; 卑鄙的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The joke is a nasty hit at him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个玩笑对他而言是个恶毒的讽刺。</font><br>严重的; 危险的; 造成痛苦的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She got a nasty knock on the head when she fell.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她跌倒时头部受到严重碰撞。</font><br>下流的, 道德败坏的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They'd be laughing making nasty remarks, and make passes at her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们会笑着说下流话, 并对她非礼。</font><br>\n
nation	<h3>nation</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>国家<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Some nations built their hopes for peace on the talks between big nations.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有些国家把和平的希望建立在大国之间的谈判上。</font><br>民族<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The British nation has not risen up in a generation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 英国民族并非在一代时期崛起。</font><br>\n
national	<h3>national</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>国家的, 民族的, 全国性的, 国民的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These matters are vital to the national security.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些事情对国家安全至关重要。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is a national newspaper.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是一份全国性报纸。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I love the national culture very much.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我非常喜欢民族文化。</font><br>国有的, 国立的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He graduated from a national university.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他毕业于一所国立大学。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>某国国民<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Foreign nationals were asked to leave the country.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 外国侨民被要求离开该国。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A consul's duty is to help his own nationals.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 领事的职责是帮助自己的同胞。</font><br>\n
nationality	<h3>nationality</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>国籍<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She lives in France but has British nationality.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她住在法国但拥有英国国籍。</font><br>民族群体<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A lot of national parks lie in the areas inhabited by minority nationality people.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 许多国家公园都位于少数民族聚居的地方。</font><br>\n
nationwide	<h3>nationwide</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj. & adv.</i></font><br>全国范围的; 全国性的; 在全国<br>\n
native	<h3>native</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>出生地的, 故乡的, 本国的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He read a poem in his native language.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他用母语朗读了一首诗。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp At the end of the year some people will go back to their native homes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 年终时, 有些人要回故乡去。</font><br>当地(人)的; 原产于某地的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our best man was sent to treat with the native leaders.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们最能干的人被派去和当地领导人谈判。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Tobacco is native to America.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 烟草是美洲的土产。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The panda is native to West China.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 熊猫产于中国西部。</font><br>天生的, 有天赋的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His native musical ability impressed his teacher.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他天生的音乐才能给老师留下了深刻印象。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The ability to swim is native to fish.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 鱼生来就会游泳。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>当地人, 本地人<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Are you a native, or just a visitor?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你是本地人还是外来人?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The natives were unwilling to be bent by colonial power.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 土著居民不愿受殖民势力的摆布。</font><br>\n
natural	<h3>natural</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>自然的, 天然的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Social problems cropped up in the wake of natural disasters.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 自然灾害之后, 出现了许多社会问题。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In addition to natural rivers, the Chinese working people have dug many canals.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 除了天然的河流之外, 中国劳动人民还开挖了许多运河。</font><br>表现自然的, 不做作的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He spoke in quite a natural voice.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他说话声音很自然。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Try to look natural for your photograph.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 拍照时要自然一点。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Children are usually more natural in their manner than adults.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们的举止通常比成年人自然。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The movie star is always natural with other people.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个影星对其他人总是很自然。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is natural that he should say so.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他那样说是理所当然的。</font><br>天生的, 生来的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is a natural musician.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是天生的音乐家。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Fighting is natural to dogs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 狗生性爱斗。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>非常适合或肯定成功的人或事物<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is the natural for this job.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她是做这项工作的理想人选。</font><br>\n
naturally	<h3>naturally</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>天然地; 天生地<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Plants grow naturally.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 植物自然地生长。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her hair curls naturally.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的头发是自然卷。</font><br>自然; 当然<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp One will naturally ask why.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 人们当然要问为什么。</font><br>表现自然地, 不做作地<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She behaved naturally before the microphone.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在话筒前表现自然。</font><br>\n
nature	<h3>nature</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>大自然, 自然界<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Nature is at its best in spring.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 春天的大自然是最美的。</font><br>天性, 性格; 性质<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She has a good nature.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她性情温和。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Iron and wood have different natures.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 铁和木头的性质不同。</font><br>类型; 种类<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I think he's a physicist or something of that nature.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想他大概是物理学家或那一类的人。</font><br>\n
naval	<h3>naval</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>海军的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is a naval officer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是一名海军军官。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He took part in a great naval battle.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他参加了一次大海战。</font><br>\n
navy	<h3>navy</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>海军<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The Navy wants[want] more money for ships this year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 海军今年要更多的钱购船。</font><br>\n
near	<h3>near</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>(空间)在近处; 在附近<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We live quite near.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们就住在附近。</font><br>(时间)临近, 来临<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The summer holidays are drawing near.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 暑假快到了。</font><br>(程度)几乎, 差不多, 将近<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was near frozen when they found him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们找到他时, 他差不多冻僵了。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>prep.</i></font><br>(表示位置)靠近, 在…附近<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The small child was afraid to go near the dog.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那小孩子不敢靠近那条狗。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We were near him at the table.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们吃饭时坐在他的附近。</font><br>(表示时间)将近, 快到, 临近<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's near five o'clock.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 现在将近五点钟。</font><br>(表示程度)接近, 近乎, 濒临<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Most views were fairly near the truth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 许多观点与真实情况十分相近。</font><br>(表示关系)与…近似; 与…紧密相关<br>(表示过程)到…去从事活动<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He never goes near a public house.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他从来不到酒馆喝酒。</font><br>(表示数目)大约, 接近<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He must be getting near retiring age.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他一定快到退休年龄了。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>近的; 不远的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you tell me the nearest way to the station?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你能告诉我去火车站最近的路吗?</font><br>亲密的; 近亲的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We are near relatives.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们是近亲。</font><br>近似, 相似<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Very often tragedies or near tragedies occurred.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 悲剧或近乎悲剧的事经常发生。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>接近; 靠近<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Storm clouds neared.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 暴风雨的乌云迫近了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He must be nearing home by now.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他现在一定已经快到家了。</font><br>\n
nearby	<h3>nearby</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>附近的; 不远的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He works in the nearby police station.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在附近的警察局工作。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>附近地; 近旁地<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We will stop nearby for lunch.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们就在附近停下吃饭。</font><br>\n
nearly	<h3>nearly</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>几乎; 差不多<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He can nearly swim.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他差不多会游泳了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was nearly killed in the accident.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我在这场事故中险些丧命。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The wind was so strong that people were nearly blown away as they waited for bus.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 风刮得很厉害, 等候公共汽车的人们几乎要被风吹走。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Joe had a close call when his motorbike nearly collided with a lorry.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 乔的摩托车差点同卡车相撞, 他侥幸地躲过了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was nearly drowned last night, but was fortunate enough to be saved.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我昨天夜里差一点淹死, 真走运, 有人把我救了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was nearly driven mad by his troubles.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他差一点被烦恼事逼疯了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Suddenly the car in front of us drew out and nearly caused an accident.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们前面的小汽车突然横穿了出来, 险些造成车祸。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The car is pretty nearly new.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这部汽车几乎是全新的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Strange thoughts float through my mind when I am nearly asleep.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我快睡着时产生一种奇怪的念头。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Cars, trucks and buses produce exhaust nearly as harmful as the factories.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汽车、卡车和公共汽车排出的废气和工厂的废气差不多同样有害。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The patient, who had been asleep for nearly three hours, began to move his body.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 病人睡了将近3小时, 才开始动一动身体。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Now that they've decided to build a shopping centre, nearly a hundred local people are going to be booked out of their homes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 既然他们现在已经决定要建立一个购物中心, 那么将近100名当地的居民就要被赶出自己的家园。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After nearly one year, the bike he lost was returned to him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 差不多过了一年, 他丢失的那辆自行车又回到他手里了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You're nearly twenty, yet you keep saying silly things like that.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你已经快20岁了, 还老是说出那样傻乎乎的话来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was quite surprised when she was told that she owed them nearly twenty pounds.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当通知她欠了他们近20英镑时, 她感到十分诧异。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Time is nearly up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 时间差不多到了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She stood nearly outside the door.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她几乎站在了门外。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We'd better stop at the garage to fill up, we're nearly out of petrol.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汽油快用光了, 我们最好在汽车修理厂停车加油。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Nearly all of the people believed him because he was a very good man.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 因为他是个很好的人, 几乎所有的人都相信他。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Nearly every building was damaged in the earthquake.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在那次地震中几乎每座建筑物都遭到了破坏。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I used to go out nearly every night but I decided to cut it out because I couldn't really afford it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我以前几乎每晚外出, 但现在已不是这样, 因为我实在抽不出时间。</font><br>\n
neat	<h3>neat</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>整洁的; 爱整洁的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Cats are neat animals.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 猫是爱整洁的动物。</font><br>利索的, 简洁的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She gave a neat answer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她作了简明的回答。</font><br>(酒)纯的, 不掺水的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I like my whiskey neat.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我喜欢喝纯威士忌酒。</font><br>\n
necessarily	<h3>necessarily</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>必要地, 必需地<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A voter must necessarily be no younger than eighteen.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 选民必须在18岁以上。</font><br>必定地; 必然地<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp More work does not necessarily call for more men.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 增加工作量不一定就要增添人员。</font><br>\n
necessary	<h3>necessary</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>必要的; 必需的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It took me a year to get the necessary materials together.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我花了一年的时间才把所需要的资料组织好。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is necessary that one should obey the law.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一个人遵守法律是必要的。</font><br>必然的; 不可避免的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Because the company was doing more business it was necessary to expand the factory.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 由于公司业务的扩大, 扩大工厂是必然的。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>必需品<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has enough money to obtain the necessaries of life.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他有足够的钱购买生活必需品</font><br>\n
necessity	<h3>necessity</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>必要(性); (迫切)需要<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You must understand the necessity of education.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你必须懂得教育的必要性。</font><br>必需品<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Telephone is now a household necessity.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 现在电话是一种家庭必需品。</font><br>自然规律<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Is it a logical necessity that higher wages will lead to higher prices?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 工资高物价就高, 这是合乎逻辑的必然规律吗?</font><br>\n
neck	<h3>neck</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>颈, 脖子<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I bent back too far and hurt my neck.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我向后仰得过度了, 扭伤了脖子。</font><br>领圈, 领口<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The neck of my shirt is dirty.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的衬衫领子脏了。</font><br>\n
need	<h3>need</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>需要; 必须<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These shoes need to be repaired.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些鞋需要修理。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These patients need looking after.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些病人需要照料。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She needs the work done before tomorrow.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她必须在明天以前找人完成这项工作。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>aux.v.</i></font><br>必须<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Need he go yesterday?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 昨天他有去的必要吗?</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>需要, 需求<br>责任, 必要<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is no need of your anxiety.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你的焦虑是不必要的。</font><br>需要的东西<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The hotel staff will supply all your needs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 饭店工作人员会向你们提供一切需用的东西。</font><br>贫穷; 困窘<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We are collecting money for families in need.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们正在为有困难的家庭募捐。</font><br>\n
needle	<h3>needle</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>针<br>针状物<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The pine needles were still quivering.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 松针还在抖动着。</font><br>\n
negative	<h3>negative</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>拒绝的; 怀疑的; 不同意的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He gave us a negative answer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他给了我们一个否定的回答。</font><br>消极的, 非建设性的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can't learn anything with negative attitude.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你用消极的态度什么也学不到。</font><br>无预期结果的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm looking for a house, but with negative results so far.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我在找一所房子, 但至今没有找到。</font><br>〈数〉负的; 〈电〉阴的, 负的<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>否定词语, 否定的观点; 拒绝; 否认<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The answer to my request was a strong negative.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的要求受到强硬的拒绝。</font><br>\n
neglect	<h3>neglect</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>疏忽; 忽略; 遗漏<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government neglected industry.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府忽视了工业。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't neglect your health.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要忽视你的健康。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It won't do to neglect this work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 忽视这项工作是不行的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp No country can afford to neglect education.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 任何国家都不能忽视教育。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp For a time he neglected his studies.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有一段时间, 他放松了学习。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don't trust him for he often neglects his duty.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不信任他, 因为他常玩忽职守。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is bad for us to pay attention to one side and neglect the other.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 只顾一方面, 不顾其他方面, 会对我们不利。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The wrong was neglected.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种错误被忽略了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Some of the most significant issues were neglected.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 最重要的问题中, 有些被忽略了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The study of this subject is undeservedly neglected today.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 现今, 这门学科的研究受到不应有的忽视。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The great importance of the quality of equipment for navigation should never be neglected.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 导航设备的质量极为重要, 不容忽视。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't neglect to study.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要疏忽学习。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He neglected to follow the instructions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他疏忽了, 未遵循指示。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He neglected to write and say “Thank you”.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他忘了写信道谢。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They neglected to lay a good foundation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们没有注意打下了一个良好的基础。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't neglect to lock the door when you leave.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你离开时别忘了锁门。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He neglected to mention that compensation should be made for all the damage done to the building.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他忘了提出对该建筑物造成的损失均应赔偿。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She neglected locking the door.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她忘记锁门了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't neglect writing to your mother.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要忘了给你母亲写信。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He neglected calling Tom to school.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他忘了叫汤姆上学。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't neglect paying him a visit now and then.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别忘了时常去看看他。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>忽略, 疏忽, 玩忽<br>被忽略的状态<br>\n
negotiate	<h3>negotiate</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>谈判; 协商; 议定<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We've decided to negotiate a loan with them.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们决定和他们商定贷款之事。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government negotiated with the opposition party over the new law.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府就新法与反对党进行了协商。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>兑现(支票等)<br>\n

neighbor	<h3>neighbor</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>〈美〉邻居,邻国<br>\n

neighbour	<h3>neighbour</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>邻居<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her neighbours spoke of her as kindly and hospitable.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的邻居都说她和蔼可亲、热情好客。</font><br>邻近的人[物]; 邻国<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our two countries have always been good neighbours.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们两国历来是友好邻邦。</font><br>\n
neighbourhood	<h3>neighbourhood</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>地区; 某地区的人; 与某处邻近的地区<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They are neighbourhood paper.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 它们属于同一区域的报纸。</font><br>\n
neither	<h3>neither</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>(两者)都不的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I went to see Jack and Bill yesterday, but neither one was at home.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 昨天我去看杰克和比尔, 可是两个人都不在家。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Neither man spoke.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 两个人都不说话。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Neither hand is clean.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 两只手都不干净。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp On neither side of the street are there any trees.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 街道两旁都没有什么树木。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In neither case can we agree.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 无论哪一种情况, 我们都不能同意。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>pron.</i></font><br>两者都不<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I have two hats but neither fits me properly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我有两顶帽子, 但对我都不适合我。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Neither of my parents is a teacher.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我父母都不是教师。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Neither of you believes one word that you are saying.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你们连自己说的一句话也不相信。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Which of the two films did you like?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp —Neither！</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>也不<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You didn't see him, and neither did I.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你没有看见他, 我也没有。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you do not go, neither shall I.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你不去我也不去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Just as I haven't good eyes, neither have my children.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 就好像我视力不好, 我的孩子们视力都不好。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The first one was not good, neither was the second one.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 第一个不好, 第二个也不好。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>conj.</i></font><br>不<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Neither Jack nor I have seen this film.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 杰克和我都没有看过这部电影。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Neither volleyball nor basketball is a hundred years old.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 排球和篮球都不到一百年的历史。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Neither you nor he is right.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你和他都不对。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Neither the teacher nor his students know how to work out the problem.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 老师和他的学生们都解不出那道题。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I left my watch on the table, but when I returned I could find neither hide nor hair.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我把手表忘在桌上了;  可当我回来找时, 什么都没有了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This essay hardly makes any sense, it's neither rhyme nor reason.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这篇文章写得不伦不类, 简直不知所云。</font><br>\n
nephew	<h3>nephew</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>侄子, 外甥<br>\n
nerve	<h3>nerve</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>神经<br>神经过敏; 神经紧张<br>勇气; 胆量<br>\n
nervous	<h3>nervous</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>神经系统的, 神经性的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The brain is a part of the nervous system of the human body.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 脑是人体神经系统的一部分。</font><br>害怕的; 胆小的<br>神经紧张的; 神经过敏的; 神经失常的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She felt very nervous with so many people looking at her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这么多人瞧着她, 她感到非常紧张。</font><br>\n
nest	<h3>nest</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>(鸟)窝, 巢<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The swallows are building a nest under the roof of our house.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 燕子正在我们的屋檐下筑巢。</font><br>(某些动物或昆虫的)窝, 穴<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is an ants' nest.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是一个蚁穴。</font><br>温床, 庇护所<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The palace was a nest of intrigue.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这座宫殿曾是阴谋诡计的策源地。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>筑巢<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Most birds nest in a tree.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 多数鸟在树上筑巢。</font><br>\n
net	<h3>net</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>网眼织物<br>网<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The fishermen are mending their nets.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 渔民们正在补渔网。</font><br>网状系统<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is a radar net in our area.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在我们那个地区有一个雷达网。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>用网捕; 布网于<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Net the fruit trees to protect them from birds.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 用网盖住果树以免遭鸟害。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She has netted herself a rich husband.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她施展计谋找了个有钱的丈夫。</font><br>净得, 净赚<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It netted us a handsome profit.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这为我们净赚了一大笔利润。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>净的, 纯的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What's the net weight of it?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 它净重多少?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The net profit from the sale was 100 dollars.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 销售的纯利润是100美元。</font><br>\n
network	<h3>network</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>网状物<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A network of railways has spread over the province.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 铁路网已遍布全省。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They are developing marketing network.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们正在发展销售网络。</font><br>(电视与计算机)网络, 网状系统<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They have built the national network.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们建成了全国性的网络。</font><br>广播网, 电视网<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They are the three big US television networks.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 它们是美国三大电视网。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We are extending the radio network.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们正在扩大广播网。</font><br>\n
neutral	<h3>neutral</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>中立的, 不偏不倚的<br>中立(国家)的<br>暗淡的; 非彩色的<br>(化学中)中性的<br>不带电的<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>(汽车或其他机器的)空挡位置<br>中立人士; 中立国<br>\n
never	<h3>never</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>从不, 永不, 从来没有<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can never understand why Mary said nothing about her wrongs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我毫不理解玛丽说她什么也没有做错。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Neighbours are said never to agree.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 据说, 邻居们永远不会同意。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He never intended to use this method.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他从来没想使用这种方法。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Never having seen him before, I did not know what he looked like.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我从来没见过他, 不知道他长得怎样。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I hope never to see him again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我希望再不要见到他。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Never have I seen such a strange person.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我从来没见过这样的怪人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is never a friend but he remembers the birthday of.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他记得每个朋友的生日。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I have never been abroad, neither[nor] have I ever wished to go.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我从未去过国外, 我也从未想去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He never behaves honestly, nor wisely.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的行为既不诚实, 也不聪明。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can tell him now, remember better late than never.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你现在可以告诉他, 要记得“晚做总比不做好”。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Never mind the expense!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不用担心费用！</font><br>\n
nevertheless	<h3>nevertheless</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>仍然, 然而, 不过<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What you said was true but nevertheless unkind.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你所说的都对, 不过有点不客气。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>conj.</i></font><br>尽管如此, 然而<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The news may be unexpected; nevertheless it is true.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这消息也许是出乎意料的, 然而是真实的。</font><br>\n
new	<h3>new</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>新的, 新出现的, 新生产的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He ordered some new books from America.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他从美国订购一些新书。</font><br>生疏的; 新接触的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Flying in an airplane was a new experience for her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 坐飞机对她来说是件新鲜事。</font><br>\n
news	<h3>news</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>新闻; 消息<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The news was announced as official.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是以官方消息发布的。</font><br>(可当作新闻内容的)人, 物, 事<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Ill news runs space.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 恶事传千里。</font><br>\n
newspaper	<h3>newspaper</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>报纸<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The newspaper is proper for young people.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种报纸适合于青年人看。</font><br>\n
next	<h3>next</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>紧接在后的, 次于的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We may go out next Sunday, but that depends.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们可能下星期天郊游, 但那要看情况而定。</font><br>贴近的, 紧邻的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He contrasted his son with the boy next door.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他将他的儿子与隔壁的男孩比较。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>接下去; 然后<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What are you going to do next?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 然后你要干什么?</font><br>居后地, 次于<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp John arrived first and Jane came next.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 约翰先到了, 然后是简。</font><br>\n
nice	<h3>nice</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>美好的; 美妙的; 令人愉快的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is difficult to choose between two such nice houses.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 两幢房子都这么漂亮, 让人难以做出抉择。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is nice to meet you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 见到你很高兴。</font><br>友好的; 好心的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was the nicest person I know.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她是我所认识的最和善的人。</font><br>细致的; 精细的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is a nice distinction between the two words.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这两个词有细微的区别。</font><br>\n
nickel	<h3>nickel</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>〈化〉镍<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Nickel can be used for making coins.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 镍可做成钱币。</font><br>(美国和加拿大的)五分镍币, 五分钱<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp May I have a nickel?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 能给我五分钱吗?</font><br>\n
niece	<h3>niece</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>侄女, 外甥女<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My mother's nieces are my cousins.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我母亲的侄女是我的表妹。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My niece was left in my trust for the weekend.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我受托周末照顾我的外甥女。</font><br>\n
night	<h3>night</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>夜, 夜晚<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He determined to travel no further that night.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他决定那天晚上不再往前走了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'll never forgive you for what you said to me last night.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我绝不会宽恕你昨晚对我所说的话。</font><br>\n
nightclub	<h3>nightclub</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>夜总会<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She had become a nightclub hostess.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她当上了一家夜总会的女招待。</font><br>\n
nightmare	<h3>nightmare</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>噩梦<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I had a nightmare about being drowned in a lake.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我做了个在湖里淹死的噩梦。</font><br>〈口〉可怕的事情, 无法摆脱的恐惧<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The hurricane was a long nightmare.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这次飓风令人担惊受怕了很久。</font><br>\n
nine	<h3>nine</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>num.</i></font><br>九; 九个<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I have nine good friends.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我有九个好朋友。</font><br>\n
nineteen	<h3>nineteen</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>num.</i></font><br>十九<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's nineteen past nine.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 九点过十九分。</font><br>\n
ninety	<h3>ninety</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>num.</i></font><br>九十<br>\n
ninth	<h3>ninth</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>num.</i></font><br>第九; 九分之一<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The Ninth Symphony of Beethoven is a famous one.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 贝多芬的第九交响乐非常有名。</font><br>\n
nitrogen	<h3>nitrogen</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>〈化〉氮<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Nitrogen is a gas without colour or smell.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 氮是一种无色无臭的气体。</font><br>\n
no	<h3>no</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>不, 不是<br>毫不, 一点也不<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm feeling no better than yesterday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我一点儿也不觉得比昨天好。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>没有的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp No words can express my grief.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的忧伤无法表达。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp No matter what the matter may be, we should do our best.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不论事情会成什么样, 我们都应当尽最大的努力。</font><br>不许的, 不可能的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp No smoking!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不许吸烟！</font><br>完全不是的, 远非的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is no genius.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他根本不是什么天才。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>不, 拒绝, 否定, 否认<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His father gave him a clear no to his request for money.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他爸对他要钱的请求给了明确的拒绝。</font><br>反对票, 投反对票者<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The noes have it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 投反对票者占多数。</font><br>\n
noble	<h3>noble</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>高尚的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is a noble man, we all admire him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是一个道德高尚的人, 我们都敬佩他。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His attempt to save the poor people's homes was truly noble.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他拯救穷人家园的尝试确实非常高尚。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was very noble of you to look after your old neighbour when she was sick.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你的心真好, 你的老邻居生病时你一直照料她。</font><br>雄伟的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Niagara falls is a noble sight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 尼亚加拉瀑布是一壮观的景色。</font><br>贵族的, 显贵的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was descended from a noble family.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他出身于贵族家庭。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was nobler than his neighbours.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他比他的邻居出身高贵。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>贵族<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When the nobles rebelled, the king battled them.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当贵族谋反时, 国王便出兵攻打他们。</font><br>\n
nobody	<h3>nobody</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>pron.</i></font><br>没有人, 无人, 谁也不<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was so cold that nobody can make his hands naked.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 天气太冷, 没有人能把手露在外面。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>小人物, 无足轻重的人<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is a mere nobody, and it is mere a matter of time for people to recognize him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他只不过是个小人物, 要大家认清这一点只是时间问题。</font><br>\n
nod	<h3>nod</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>点头<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I nodded at him in greeting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我向他点头打招呼。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He nodded to show that he understood.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他点头表示他懂了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She nodded her head when she passed me in the street.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当她在街上走过我身旁时, 向我点了点头。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He nodded a welcome to Mary.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他向玛丽点头表示欢迎。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>打盹, 打瞌睡<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Grandmother sat nodding by the fire.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 祖母坐在火炉旁打瞌睡。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>点头<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The judges gave the nod to the winning challenger.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 裁判们对挑战者的胜利给予确认。</font><br>\n
noise	<h3>noise</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>噪声, 喧哗声<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The noise awoke me from my sleep.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 喧闹声使我从睡梦中醒过来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I requested them to stop making such a noise.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我请求他们不要再这样吵闹。</font><br>声音; 响声<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The engine's making funny noises.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 引擎发出奇怪的声音。</font><br>\n
noisy	<h3>noisy</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>嘈杂的; 喧闹的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I wish those noisy children would sober down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我希望那些闹哄哄的孩子们静下来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's very noisy in this office.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个办公室里十分喧闹。</font><br>\n
none	<h3>none</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>pron.</i></font><br>没有人; 一个也没有; 一点儿也没有<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Any principle is preferable to none.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 任何原则都比没原则好。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She has taken a lot of different medicines, but none has cured the disease.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她已经服过许多不同的药, 但没有一种药能治愈这种病。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp As a football player he is second to none.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 作为一名足球队员, 谁都超不过他。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There were none for him to read.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 没有人为他朗读。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you need a repairman, there's none better than my brother.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果你需要一个修理工, 我兄弟再合适不过了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp None has[have] arrived yet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 还没人来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp None of money is mine.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这笔钱没有一点是我的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp None of guests want to stay.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 客人中没有一个想留下不走的。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>毫不, 毫无<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After all his explanations, I remained none the wiser.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他讲了半天, 我还是糊里糊涂。</font><br>不很, 不太<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He did it none too well.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他做得一点也不好。</font><br>\n
nonsense	<h3>nonsense</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>胡说; 废话<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She left out three words when she copied the sentence and the result was nonsense.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她抄这个句子时漏了三个词, 结果使这句话毫无意义。</font><br>愚蠢的行为; 无聊的事物<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Stop that nonsense, children!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别胡闹了, 孩子们！</font><br>\n
noodle	<h3>noodle</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>面条<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He finished off two bowls of chicken noodles soup in no time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他很快吃完了两碗鸡汤面。</font><br>傻子, 笨蛋<br>\n
noon	<h3>noon</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>正午; 中午<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It approached noon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 时已正午。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The Prime Minister is scheduled to arrive at noon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 首相定于中午到达。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The rocket is due to lift off at noon on Friday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 火箭定于星期五中午发射。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The marines landed at noon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 海军陆战队在中午登陆。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The judge handed his decision down at noon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 法官中午下了判决。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The goods will be delivered at noon tomorrow.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 明天中午交货。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you guarantee to get these before noon?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你能保证在中午之前弄到这些吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp By noon, all 61 people were judged out of danger.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 到中午时, 61个人看来都脱离危险了。</font><br>\n
nor	<h3>nor</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>conj.</i></font><br>也不; 也没<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Not a flower nor even a blade of grass will grow in this desert.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 没有一朵花甚至一片草会生长在这沙漠里。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He can't do it, nor can I, nor can you, nor can anybody.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他不能做, 我也不能, 你也不能, 任何人都不能。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All that is true, nor must we forget about it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那全是真的, 我们可不能忘记。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Neither you nor he is right.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你和他都不对。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He would neither come in nor go out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他既不进来, 也不出去。</font><br>\n
norm	<h3>norm</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>标准, 规范<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Of his age, the child is above the norm in arithmetic.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在他那个年龄, 这个孩子的算术能力是超过标准的。</font><br>准则, 行为模式<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Everyone should abide by our social norms.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们每个人都应该遵守社会行为准则。</font><br>\n
normal	<h3>normal</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>正常的, 平常的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She braced herself to lead a normal life.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她振作起来去过正常生活。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Everything is normal here.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这里一切正常。</font><br>正规的; 标准的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He received four years of normal edication at college.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在大学受了四年正规教育。</font><br>\n
normally	<h3>normally</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>通常; 正常地<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let's face it, people who have a capacity for work normally succeed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不管怎么说, 有工作能力的人一般总会成功的。</font><br>\n
