north	<h3>north</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>北; 北方<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I still remember the mountains in the north, locked in snow and ice.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我还记得北方那冰雪封住的群山。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The needle of a compass points to the north.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 罗盘的指针指向北方。</font><br>北部<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The riots swept the industrial north and midland.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 暴动席卷了工业化的北部和中部地区。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Canada bounds the United States on the north.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 加拿大与美国北部接壤。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The North defeated the South in 1865.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 美国北部各州在1865年打败了南部各州。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>北方的, 在北方的; 朝北的, 向北的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Such fish is rarely met with in the north country.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种鱼在北方难得看到。</font><br>(风, 光线)来自北方的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The north wind has frozen the water in the pool in the garden.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 北风使花园里的池水结冰了。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>在北方, 向北方<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Then they headed north to join forces with us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这时他们向北进发去和我们会师。</font><br>自北地<br>\n
northeast	<h3>northeast</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>东北, 东北方向<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Burma is northeast of Sri Lanka.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 缅甸位于斯里兰卡的东北方。</font><br>东北部<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was born in the northeast.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我出生于东北部。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>在东北的, 东北部的, 向东北的, 面朝东北的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The church's northeast window has beautifully coloured glass.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 教堂朝东北的窗子是用精美的彩色玻璃镶嵌成的。</font><br>(风、光线)来自东北方向的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A northeast wind is blowing strongly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 东北风刮得呼呼响。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>向东北<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They voyaged northeast for several days.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们向东北航行了几天。</font><br>自东北地<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The wind blew northeast.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 风从东北方吹来。</font><br>\n
northern	<h3>northern</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>北方的, 北部的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The park is in the northern part of the city.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 公园位于该城市的北部。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her accent is northern.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她说话带有北方口音。</font><br>\n
northwest	<h3>northwest</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>西北, 西北方向<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The wind is blowing from the northwest.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 风从西北方吹来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A strange light appeared in the northwest.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一束奇异的光线在西北方闪现。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The country lies on the northwest of France.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 该国紧靠法国西北部。</font><br>西北部<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was born in the northwest.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他出生于西北部。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>在西北的, 西北部的, 向西北的, 面朝西北的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Take the northwest road;  it is the shortest way.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 走向西北的那条路, 那是最近的路。</font><br>(风、光线)来自西北方的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A northwest wind is blowing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 正刮西北风。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>向西北<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The plane flew northwest.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 飞机往西北飞去。</font><br>自西北地<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The wind was blowing northwest.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 正在刮西北风。</font><br>\n
nose	<h3>nose</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>鼻子<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp An elephant's nose is extraordinarily long!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大象的鼻子特别长！</font><br>似鼻子的东西<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I saw the car's nose appear round the corner.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我看到汽车头出现在拐角处。</font><br>嗅觉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His nose told him that he was getting near the cow shed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的嗅觉告诉他, 他正走近牛棚。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>嗅<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The dog nosed the car carefully.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 狗仔细地嗅着那辆汽车。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I nosed the meat gone.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我闻出这肉坏了。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>窥探, 探听, 四处查看<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The secret has been nosed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 秘密被探听到了。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>小心翼翼地前进<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The little boat nosed carefully between the rocks.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 小船在岩石间谨慎地缓慢航行。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The ship nosed its way.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 船缓缓前进。</font><br>\n
not	<h3>not</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>不, 没<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They're not students.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们不是学生。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm going too, ain't I?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不是也要去吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I asked him not to come.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我请他不要来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don't think it will rain.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想不会下雨的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Is she ready or not?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她准备好了没有?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All he said is not right.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他说的不全对。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Not until last week was the project in full blast.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 工程直到上星期才全部开工。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Not once have the workers of our factory succeeded in inventing new machines, but many times.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们厂的工人们成功地发明新机器已经不止一次了, 而是许多次了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The desk is not two feet high.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这张书桌不到两英尺高。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He didn't half like it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他非常不喜欢它。</font><br>\n
note	<h3>note</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>笔记, 摘记<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He takes[makes] notes in class.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他上课记笔记。</font><br>短信, 短笺<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She sent him a note of thanks.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她寄给他一封简短的感谢信。</font><br>注意<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I took a careful note of where I had left the bag, so as to be sure to find it on my return.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我注意记住我把提包放在什么地方, 这样我回去时就肯定能找到它。</font><br>通牒, 函件<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He presented a note to the British Government.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他向英国政府递交了一份函件。</font><br>评注, 注释<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There ought to be a note on this obsolete word.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个过时的词应有注释。</font><br>暗示, 含义<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The book ended on an optimistic note.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 该书的结尾寓意乐观。</font><br>纸币<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Here is a 5 dollars note for you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 给你一张5美元的钞票。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>记录<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A villager had noted the number of the truck.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一个村民记下了车牌号。</font><br>注意<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please note my words.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请注意我的话。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Note how to do it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 注意看怎么做。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please note that the movie starts at 7 o'clock.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请注意, 电影七点开映。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Note how he swims.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 注意看他如何游泳。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It should be noted that no one would like to take his place.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 应该注意的是, 谁也不愿代替他的位置。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They noted David to be too clever.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们注意到大卫过于聪明。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I noted a change come over his face.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我发觉他脸上的表情发生了变化。</font><br>\n
notebook	<h3>notebook</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>笔记簿<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He noted down her address in his notebook.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把她的地址草草地记在了笔记本上。</font><br>\n
nothing	<h3>nothing</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>pron.</i></font><br>没有东西, 没有事情, 没有一点儿<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Nothing in the world is difficult for one who sets his mind into it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 天下无难事, 只怕有心人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is nothing in this box, it's empty.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这盒子里没有任何东西, 是空的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I had nothing stronger than orange juice to drink.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我只喝了橙汁, 没喝酒。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is nothing wrong with the machine.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这台机器没什么毛病。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I know nothing about the accident.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 对那次事故我什么也不知道。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There's nothing that you can do to help.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你帮不上忙。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is a metre nothing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他身高一米整。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>无关紧要的人[事]<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is an interesting person but her husband is a real nothing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她是个十分有趣的人, 但她的丈夫真就不及她了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I feel what a nothing I am!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我感到我是多么渺小啊！</font><br>\n
notice	<h3>notice</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>预告, 通知<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These rules are subject to change without notice.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些规则可不经通知就进行更改。</font><br>布告, 通告, 启示<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They announced the birth of their baby by putting a notice in the newspaper.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们在报纸上刊登启示, 宣告他们婴儿的诞生。</font><br>注意<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Nobody took notice of the mischief of the matter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 没有人注意到这件事情所带来的危害。</font><br>评价, 短评<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The new play got mixed notices.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这一新剧得到的评价是褒贬不一。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>注意<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She pretended not to notice.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她假装没看见。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I didn't notice you when you passed by.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你走过时, 我没有注意到你。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We noticed how to make the experiment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们注意如何做这个实验。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The teacher noticed that one student was missing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 老师发现一个学生不见了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I noticed how she did it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我注意到了她是怎么做这件事的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I didn't notice you enter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我没注意到你进来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I noticed the man leaving the house.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我注意到那人离开这栋房子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He noticed the situation changed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他发现形势已经变了。</font><br>\n
noticeable	<h3>noticeable</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>显而易见的, 明显的, 显著的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There's been a noticeable improvement in his handwriting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的书法有了明显的进步。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The damage to my car is hardly noticeable.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的汽车被损坏的地方不大明显。</font><br>\n
notify	<h3>notify</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>通知, 告知, 报告<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When my guest arrives, please notify me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的客人到的时候, 请通知我。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Before organizing that procession along the street we ought to have notified the police.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在组织上街游行之前, 我们应该通报警察。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We'll notify the time of the meeting on the bulletin board.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们将在布告栏上公布会议的时间。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The father notified his son's birth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 父亲公告了他儿子的出生。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We'll notify her to draw up a contract.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们将通知她草拟一份合同。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'll notify my lawyer to write out the agreement.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我将通知律师把契约写好。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I have got a letter notifying me to appear before the committee.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我接到一封信, 通知我到委员会去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He didn't notify me how to get in touch with him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他没有告诉我怎样跟他联系。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The court clerk will notify the witness when and where to appear.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 法院办事员将通知证人出庭的时间及地点。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We'll notify you where to get it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们会通知你在什么地方取。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I am glad to notify you that your mother has arrived.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我很高兴告诉你, 你母亲到了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our teacher notified us that there would be a test on Monday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们老师通知我们星期一要考试。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They notified the authorities that pollution in that area was serious.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们报告当局那个地区的污染严重。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I notified the post office that my address had changed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我把变更的地址通知了邮局。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was abruptly notified that a half-hour speech was expected of me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我突然被通知要讲半个小时的话。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please notify us when you arrive, so that we'll be ready.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请通知我们你们什么时候到达, 以便我们做准备。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He will notify us where we are to meet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他将通知我们在什么地方集合。</font><br>\n
notion	<h3>notion</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>概念, 观念, 看法<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp One common Chinese notion is that the elders ought to be respected.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 中国人共有的一种观念是长者应受到尊敬。</font><br>突然的念头, 奇想; 意图, 打算<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He had a sudden notion to visit all his relatives.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他心血来潮, 突然想去拜访他所有的亲戚。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I haven't the faintest notion what you're talking about.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我对于你所讲的话一点儿也不懂。</font><br>\n
noun	<h3>noun</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>名词<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The word “person” is a countable noun.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp person这个词是个可数名词。</font><br>\n
nourish	<h3>nourish</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>养育, 喂养, 滋养<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They needed good food to nourish their bodies.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们需要好食品滋养身体。</font><br>保持, 增长(情绪等)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He's been nourishing the hope of a trip abroad.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他一直怀着出国旅行的愿望。</font><br>\n
novel	<h3>novel</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>(长篇)小说<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp England is the birthplace of the modern novel.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 英国是近代小说发源地。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>新奇的; 新颖的; 新的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has a novel proposal of his own for meeting unemployment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他想出了一条独特的对付失业问题的新建议。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The design of this square is very novel.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个广场的设计很新颖。</font><br>\n
novelist	<h3>novelist</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>(长篇)小说家<br>\n
November	<h3>November</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>十一月<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It happened on November first.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这件事发生在11月1日。</font><br>\n
now	<h3>now</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>现在, 目前<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I had a headache this morning, but I'm all right now.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我今天早上头疼, 但现在好了。</font><br>立刻, 马上<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You've got to ask him.It's now or never.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你得去问他, 马上去否则就没机会了。</font><br>其时, 当时<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Now the noise was very loud.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 此时噪音极大。</font><br>(说话者用以继续进行叙述、请求、警告等转换语气)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Now be quiet for a few moments and listen to this.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请安静一会儿, 注意听着。</font><br>\n
nowadays	<h3>nowadays</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>现在; 现时<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Nowadays people like travelling on foot.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 现在人们喜欢徒步旅行。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Nowadays petrol costs too much.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如今的汽油太贵了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He's much thinner nowadays than he used to be;  I think he's been ill.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 最近他比以前瘦多了, 我想他一直在生病。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Cars go very fast nowadays.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如今的汽车跑得快。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Antiques are much sought after nowadays.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 现在求购古玩成风。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Most films are colour ones nowadays.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 现在大多数影片是彩色的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The novels of Scott are much in demand nowadays.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 斯科特的小说目前十分畅销。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We can see many adulterators in the market nowadays.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 时下我们能见到有许多低劣商品冲击市场。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Many shoes nowadays are made of plastic or similar stuff.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如今, 许多鞋子是用塑料或类似的材料制成的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can't set up a business nowadays without money behind you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 现如今你要是没有钱在后边撑着, 就办不成事。</font><br>\n
nowhere	<h3>nowhere</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>任何地方都不, 无处<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The poor has nowhere to live.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个可怜的老人无处可住。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There's nowhere else I really want to go to.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 没有别的地方是我真正想去的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That kind of talk will get you nowhere.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 说那种话对你没好处。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Five dollars goes nowhere now.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 现在五美元买不到什么东西。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Such methods will get you nowhere.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些做法不会有什么结果。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In the last seconds of the race, he came from nowhere and won.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在比赛的最后几秒钟, 他从后面不知什么地方突然冒出来并赢得了胜利。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She rose to fame out of nowhere.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她莫名其妙地就出名了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Nowhere have I seen your bike.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我从未见过你的自行车。</font><br>\n
nuclear	<h3>nuclear</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>核的, 原子核的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He's very interested in nuclear physics.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他对核物理学非常感兴趣。</font><br>使用或生产核能的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A nuclear reactor is the apparatus in which atoms are split.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 核反应堆是分裂原子的装置。</font><br>\n
nucleus	<h3>nucleus</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>(原子)核<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The nucleus of an atom consists of neutrons, protons and other particles.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 原子核由中子、质子和其他粒子构成。</font><br>中心, 核心<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These young people formed the nucleus of the club.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些年轻人成了俱乐部的核心。</font><br>\n
nuisance	<h3>nuisance</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>讨厌的东西[人, 行为]<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The dog is a terrible nuisance.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这只狗真令人讨厌。</font><br>\n
number	<h3>number</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>数, 数字; 号码<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Three is my lucky number.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 三是我的幸运数字。</font><br>数目, 数量<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is nothing over the number we need.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在我们需要的数目外没有超过。</font><br>一群人, 一帮人<br>一期, 册<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is a story about her in the current number.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 最近一期上有关于她的故事。</font><br>一首乐曲<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She sang several numbers from her latest album.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她唱了几首她近期唱片中的歌曲。</font><br>喜爱的物品; 衣物<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was wearing a snappy little red number.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她身着一款时髦的红色衣服。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>数; 算<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let's number them from 1 to 20 row by row.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 让我们每行从1数到20。</font><br>给…编号<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They forgot to number the pages.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们忘了编页码。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>link v.</i></font><br>总共<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The students of our department numbered in the hundreds.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们系的学生总共有几百人。</font><br>\n
numerous	<h3>numerous</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>很多的, 许多的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There are numerous people in the square.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有许多人在广场上。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His money is very numerous.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的钱非常多。</font><br>\n
nurse	<h3>nurse</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>护士<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The nurse wore a pleated cap on her head.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 护士头上戴着打褶的小帽。</font><br>保育员; 保姆<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>护理, 照料<br>喂, 吃奶<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The baby is nursing at its mother's breasts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那孩子正在吃妈妈的奶。</font><br>\n
nursery	<h3>nursery</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>托儿所, 育儿室<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The two nurseries have 200 children.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这两家托儿所有200个孩子。</font><br>苗圃<br>\n
nut	<h3>nut</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>干果, 坚果<br>螺母, 螺帽<br>头<br>\n
nylon	<h3>nylon</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>尼龙<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He dresses a nylon shirt.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他穿着一件尼龙衬衫。</font><br>女长袜<br>\n
oak	<h3>oak</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>栎树, 橡树<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Oaks may fall when reeds stand the storm.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 芦苇耐风暴, 橡树却会倒。</font><br>栎木, 橡木<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The chair is of solid oak.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这把椅子是纯橡木的。</font><br>\n
obey	<h3>obey</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>服从; 听从<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The boy won't obey.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这孩子不听话。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All I had to do now was to obey him in silence.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这时, 我要做的只是默默地服从他。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>遵守; 遵循<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Everyone must obey the law.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 人人都必须遵守法律。</font><br>\n
object	<h3>object</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>物体<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What are those strange objects?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那些奇异物体是什么?</font><br>对象; 客体<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The building is the main object of his interest.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他最感兴趣的是这栋建筑物。</font><br>目标; 意向; 目的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our object is to get at the truth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们的目的是弄清事实真相。</font><br>可笑的人[事物]<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What an object you look in that old hat!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你戴着那顶旧帽子, 样子可真怪!</font><br>宾语<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Verbs that do not take object are called intransitive verbs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不带宾语的动词称为不及物动词。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>不赞成, 反对; 抗议<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He did not object.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他没有反对。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>以…为理由反对<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They objected that the plan was risky.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们反对说, 这项计划是冒险的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It may be objected that not enough manpower is available.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有人可能会提出反对, 认为没有足够的人力可用。</font><br>\n
objection	<h3>objection</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>反对, 异议; 厌恶<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They made an objection to the imperial system with resolution.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们坚决反对帝制。</font><br>反对的理由<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please present your objection to the plan.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请提出反对这个计划的理由。</font><br>\n
objective	<h3>objective</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>目标; 目的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They failed to carry out their objectives.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们没有实现自己的目标。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>客观的; 不带偏见的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He tried to take an objective view of the situation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他试图对形势有个客观的看法。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She gives an objective report of what has happened.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她就发生的事情进行客观的报告。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A scientist must be objective.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 科学家必须客观。</font><br>\n
obligation	<h3>obligation</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>义务; 责任<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His social obligation compels him to make a round of visits.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的社会职责使得他不得不进行一系列访问。</font><br>\n
oblige	<h3>oblige</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>迫使做; 使负义务<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We'd be happy to oblige.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们乐于效劳。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Poverty obliged her to live a hard life.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 贫困迫使她过艰苦的生活。</font><br>满足请求; 施惠<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Sorry, I can't oblige you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 很抱歉, 我不能帮你的忙。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>感激<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I should be obliged if you wouldn't say so.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你如果不这样说, 我就感谢你了。</font><br>\n
observation	<h3>observation</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>注意; 观察<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The new breed is under observation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 新品种正在观察中。</font><br>观察力<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is a student of keen observation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她是一个观察力敏锐的学生。</font><br>言论, 评论, 意见<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He made valuable observations on the prices.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他对物价问题提出了宝贵的意见。</font><br>观察资料, 观察数据<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He's just published observations on Japanese bird life.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他刚刚发表了关于日本鸟类生活的观察资料。</font><br>\n
observe	<h3>observe</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>观察; 研究<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He observes carefully but says little.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他总是仔细观察, 很少说话。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>看到; 注意到<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Didn't you observe the difference?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 难道你没有看出差别?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We observed that it had turned cloudy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们注意到天已经变阴了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We have never observed him do otherwise.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们从未看到他有不同的做法。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Thousands of people observed the ship leaving the harbour.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 数以千计的人观看了轮船离港下水的情形。</font><br>遵守; 遵循<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They faithfully observed the rules.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们忠实地遵守规则。</font><br>评论[述]; 讲<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He observed that the house seemed to be too small.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他说那房子似乎小了一点儿。</font><br>\n
observer	<h3>observer</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>观察者, 观察员; 遵守者<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The old man was sent along as an observer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个老人被派作观察员。</font><br>\n
obstacle	<h3>obstacle</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>障碍(物), 妨碍<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She felt that her family was an obstacle to her work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她感到她的家庭妨碍她的工作。</font><br>\n
obtain	<h3>obtain</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>获得, 得到; 买到<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Where can I obtain the book?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我在哪里能买到这本书?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This obtained him respect.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这使他受到尊敬。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>通行; 流行<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The custom still obtains in some districts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种风俗在某些地方仍然流行。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Different laws obtain in different places.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不同的法律适用在不同的地方。</font><br>\n
obvious	<h3>obvious</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>明显的; 显而易见的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You shouldn't tell such obvious lies.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你不该说如此明显的谎话。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is obvious that he is wrong.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 显然他错了。</font><br>\n
occasion	<h3>occasion</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>时刻, 时候<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is a gala occasion.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是一个欢乐的时刻。</font><br>机会, 时机<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I want to take this occasion to thank you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想借此机会向你表示感谢。</font><br>特殊场合; 庆典<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I only wear a tie on special occasions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我只有在特殊的场合才系领带。</font><br>原因, 理由<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There was no occasion to do so.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 没有理由这样做。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>惹起, 引起<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Who occasioned his anger?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 谁惹他生气?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The thing has occasioned us a lot of trouble.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这件事给我们带来很大麻烦。</font><br>\n
occasional	<h3>occasional</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>偶尔的, 不经常的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This thing isn't occasional.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这件事不是偶然的。</font><br>\n
occupation	<h3>occupation</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>工作; 职业<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He carried on several occupations at a time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他同时从事几种职业。</font><br>消遣<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Reading is a useful occupation to us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 阅读对我们是一种有益的消遣。</font><br>占领<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was born in France during German occupation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在德国占领期间生于法国。</font><br>\n
occupy	<h3>occupy</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>占领; 占有<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Enemy troops occupied the country.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 敌军占领了这个国家。</font><br>使从事; 使忙于<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mr.White occupies an important position in the Ministry of Education.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 怀特先生在教育部里担任要职。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He occupied himself in collecting stamps.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他忙于集邮。</font><br>\n
occur	<h3>occur</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>发生; 举行; 存在<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I hope this won't occur again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我希望不要再发生这种事情。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Silver occurs natural.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 银是天然存在的。</font><br>被发现; 想到[起]<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The word “gratitude” did not occur in his words.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “感激”两字在他的话中是见不到的。</font><br>\n
occurrence	<h3>occurrence</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>发生, 出现<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The occurrence of storms delayed our trip.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 暴风雨延误了我们的旅行。</font><br>事件; 发生的事<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Newspapers record the chief occurrences of the day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 报纸报道了当天发生的大事。</font><br>\n
ocean	<h3>ocean</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>洋, 海洋, 大海<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp One afternoon, she went for a swim in the ocean.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一天下午她到海里去游泳。</font><br>(地球上划分出的)洋<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp As we've seen, oceans cover more than 70％ of the earth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 据我们所知, 海洋占地球面积的70％以上。</font><br>\n
o'clock	<h3>o'clock</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>…点钟<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can't get there before four o'clock.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 四点前我到不了那里。</font><br>\n
October	<h3>October</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>十月<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp September and October are the months of the year during which most English people take their holidays.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一年中９、10两个月是大多数英国人休假的月份。</font><br>\n
odd	<h3>odd</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>奇怪的; 古怪的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I had rather an odd experience the other day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 前几天我有过非常奇怪的经历。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was odd of her to do that.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她那样做太奇怪了。</font><br>单的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I threw away the odd glove.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我丢弃了那只不成对的手套。</font><br>奇数的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Three is an odd number.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 三是个奇数。</font><br>临时的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He makes a living by doing odd job.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他通过做临时的工作来谋生。</font><br>余下的; 零头的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Here are two odd volumes of an encyclopedia.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这儿有两卷零散的百科全书。</font><br>\n
odds	<h3>odds</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>可能性, 机会<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The odds are 5 to 1 that she will win.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她获胜的机会是五比一。</font><br>\n
of	<h3>of</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>prep.</i></font><br>(表示时间)在…的, 在…之前; 在…期间<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was born at the turn of the century.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他出生于世纪之交。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What do you do of a Saturday?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 星期六你干什么?</font><br>(表示方式)根据<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She did it of her own will.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她是自愿这么做的。</font><br>(表示对象)对于, 就…而言<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He felt quite certain of success.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他对成功很有把握。</font><br>(表示原因)由于, 因为<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was sick of their fun and games.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们的嬉闹让我厌烦。</font><br>(表示方位)在; 位于<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp New York is east of Washington.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 纽约在华盛顿以东。</font><br>(表示范围)在…之中<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Tom is the eldest of the family.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汤姆是家里年龄最大的。</font><br>(表示结果)在…方面<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The place is easy of access.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这地方容易进入。</font><br>(表示目的)用于…的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is a house of prayer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是一座教堂。</font><br>(表示否定)缺乏, 没有<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They were destitute of necessaries of life.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们缺少生活必需品。</font><br>\n
off	<h3>off</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>prep.</i></font><br>(表示位置)在…的外面, 在…的沿海<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The boat anchored off the fort.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那艘船停在堡垒外面。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The ship sank off the south coast of the island.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那艘船在岛的南岸沿海沉没。</font><br>(表示时间)在…之前<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is a few minutes off three o'clock.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 还有几分钟就三点了。</font><br>(表示方向)从…, 通向, 偏离, 从…离开<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He fell off the ladder.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他从梯子上掉下来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The kitchen's off the dining room.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 厨房通向餐厅。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We are going off the subject.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们正偏离正题。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was off his seat.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他离开他的位子。</font><br>(表示比较)低于, 不及<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They are selling the bikes off the market price.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们按低于市价卖出自行车。</font><br>(表示否定)不想, 不做<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is off tea.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他不想喝茶。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She's off work with a bad cold.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她因患重感冒而不上班。</font><br>(表示来源)从…<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He borrowed a pound off me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他借我一英镑。</font><br>(表示依附)依靠<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This bear feeds off the leaves of the tree.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这只熊依靠这棵树的树叶生存。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>离开<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They drove off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们开车离开了。</font><br>脱落<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He's had his beard shaved off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把胡子剃掉了。</font><br>断开<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The radio is off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 录音机是关着的。</font><br>光, 完<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His money was off yesterday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 昨天他的钱用完了。</font><br>休息<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We are off one day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们休息一天。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>休息的; 闲散的; 安静的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The winter is an off season.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 冬天是淡季。</font><br>不新鲜的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This fish has gone off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这条鱼已不新鲜。</font><br>\n
offend	<h3>offend</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>触怒; 冒犯<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I think I never offend you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想我从没有触犯过你。</font><br>使反感<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That sound offends my ear.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那声音使我感到刺耳。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>犯规, 触犯<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The driver offended against the traffic regulations.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个司机违反了交通规则。</font><br>\n
offense	<h3>offense</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>进攻<br>\n
offensive	<h3>offensive</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>讨厌的; 令人不快的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She said some offensive remarks.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她说了一些令人不快的话。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I found him very offensive.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我觉得他非常讨厌。</font><br>攻击的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He took up offensive words.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他发出攻击性的言论。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>进攻, 攻势<br>\n
offer	<h3>offer</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>主动提供; 主动提出; 出价<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The museum offers extensive facilities for study.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个博物馆提供了许多供研究的设备。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She offered to help me to learn English.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她提出要帮我学英语。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He offered me some tickets.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他给了我几张票。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He offered himself as a candidate.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他自告奋勇要当候选人。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>表示愿意等<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don't need any help, but it was kind of you to offer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不需要任何帮助, 但是你愿意提供帮助, 我很感激。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They offered to go where there were difficulties.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们表示愿意到艰苦的地方去。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>出现, 显现<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>提议, 提供<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If he makes you a good offer, don't refuse it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果他向你提出一个好建议, 你不要拒绝。</font><br>供应; 报价<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I am open to an offer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我愿考虑买主的出价。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Your offer is a bit too high.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你出的价太高了。</font><br>\n
office	<h3>office</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>办公室, 办公处; 事务所<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our office is open from Monday to Friday inclusive.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们办公室从星期一到星期五办公。</font><br>(政府部门的)部, 局, 厅<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'd like to work in a government office.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想在政府机关工作。</font><br>有特定用途的房间[建筑物]; …处<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She came to the station and went to the booking office.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她来到车站, 去了订票处。</font><br>公职, 官职, 公务<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is my office to open the door.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的职责就是开门。</font><br>\n
officer	<h3>officer</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>军官<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He dreamed to be an officer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在梦中他成了一名军官。</font><br>(政府, 会社等的)高级官员[职员]<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her husband was a customs officer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的丈夫是一名海关官员。</font><br>\n
official	<h3>official</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>行政官员<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The President and the Secretary of State are government officials.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 总统和国务卿是政府官员。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>公务的, 公职的, 职权的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His official duties kept him busy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 公务使他繁忙不堪。</font><br>官方的, 正式的, 官方认可的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They have got some official figures.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们得到一些官方数字。</font><br>\n
often	<h3>often</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>常常; 经常; 时常<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I often go swimming in summer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 夏天我经常去游泳。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Often had I intended to speak of it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我常想说说这件事。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How often does this magazine come out?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这本杂志多长时间出一期?</font><br>在大多数情况下<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's often difficult to translate poems.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 翻译诗歌在许多情况下都是困难的。</font><br>\n
oil	<h3>oil</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>油<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Oil and water do not mix.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 油和水不能溶合。</font><br>石油<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Revenues from oil are the biggest single component part in the country's income.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 来自石油的收益是这个国家收入中最高的一项。</font><br>油画; 油画颜料<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This oil painting is very valuable.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这幅油画很有价值。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>给…加油<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You must oil the tractor every day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你必须每天给拖拉机加油。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>化成油<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Butter oils when heated.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 奶油加热就化了。</font><br>\n
oily	<h3>oily</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>涂有油的; 油腻的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He always wears the oily old pair of jeans.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他总是穿着那条沾满油污的旧牛仔裤。</font><br>过于奉承的, 油滑的, 谄媚的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don't like oily shop assistants.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不喜欢过分殷勤的店员。</font><br>\n
okay	<h3>okay</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>好的; 不错的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was an okay battery commander.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是炮兵连一个很不错的指挥官。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We had an okay time till we went to bed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 睡觉前我们玩得很好。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He made an okay decision.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他作出同意的决定。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The play is okay, but I still prefer the book.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 戏还可以, 可我仍愿读原著。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Is my hair okay?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的头发不错吧?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I hope the children are okay.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 希望孩子们都好。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Everything is okay.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一切进展顺利。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I guess it's okay with me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想这对我是合适的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Is it okay with you if I borrow this book?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我借这本书你不在意吧?</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>好; 不错<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Did he sleep okay?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他睡得好吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You're doing okay without it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你没有它也很好嘛。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She got on okay with Lawrence.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她跟劳伦斯相处得很好。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The new machine is running okay.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这台新机器运转很正常。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I think I did OK in the exam.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我认为我考得不错。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We'll go to the cinema tomorrow, OK?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 咱们明天去看电影好吗?</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>int.</i></font><br>行; 好的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Okay, doctor, I'll let you know.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 好吧, 大夫, 我告诉你。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Okay, children, we'll clear up the room now.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 好啦, 孩子们, 咱们现在打扫房间吧。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Okay, you can go.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 好, 你去吧。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp So I told you about that, okay, so the next thing was he jumped the fence.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那件事我已对你说过了, 对吧, 接下来他跳过了篱笆。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>同意; 允许<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't come out of your hiding-place until I give you the okay.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 得到我的同意你才能从躲藏的地方出来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp As soon as those in authority give us the okay, we can go ahead with the project.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 只要负责人一签字认可, 我们就能继续进行这项工程。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I heard his faint okay.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我听见他轻声同意。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We've got the OK from the council at last.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们终于获得了委员会的同意。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>同意; 认可<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They finally okayed our plan.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 最后他们赞同了我们的计划。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They okayed the proposal yesterday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 昨天他们批准了这项提案。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Has the bank okayed your request for a loan?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 银行批准你的贷款要求了吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I had to get the secretary to okay the scheme.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我只得请书记批准这个方案。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His ear okayed the sounds as the engine warmed up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的耳朵听出发动机预热时发出的声音是正常的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Smith's report was not officially okayed by the War Department for Release until July 9.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 史密斯的报告于7月9日才获得释放战俘处正式批准。</font><br>\n
old	<h3>old</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>老的; 年老的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He gets tax relief because he supports his old mother.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他因赡养年迈的母亲而得以减税。</font><br>古老的; 古代的, 陈旧的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's just an old rag I had in the closet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这只不过是我挂在壁橱里的旧衣服罢了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He posed as an expert on old coins.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他假装是个古钱币专家。</font><br>…年龄的; …岁的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This pine is a hundred years old.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这棵松树的年龄是100岁。</font><br>早已认识的; 熟悉的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I met with an old friend at a dinner party.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我在一次宴会上偶然遇到一位老朋友。</font><br>以前的; 从前的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She got her old job back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她恢复了过去的工作。</font><br>有经验的, 老练的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That child seems old beyond his years.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个孩子看上去比他的实际年龄老成。</font><br>\n
omit	<h3>omit</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>省略, 遗漏; 删掉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In writing this report I have omitted all unnecessary details.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在写这份报告时, 我把一切不必要的细节全都删除了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She omitted the good chance.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她失去了这个好机会。</font><br>忘记做<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please don't omit to lock the door when you leave.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 离开时不要忘了锁门。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She omitted telling the teacher about it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她忘了把那件事告诉老师。</font><br>\n
on	<h3>on</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>prep.</i></font><br>(表示位置)在…上, 在…旁, 在…身边<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That book on the desk is an atlas.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 桌上的那本书是地图册。</font><br>(表示时间)在…之时<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It occurred on the morning of the fifteenth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 事情发生在15号的上午。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp On arriving home, I was met by my daughter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 到家时我的女儿出来迎接我。</font><br>(表示方向)向, 往, 朝; 沿着, 顺着<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They marched on the enemy's fortress.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们向敌人的要塞进军。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We were driving on a California freeway.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们正沿着加利福尼亚的一条快车道驾车行驶。</font><br>(表示状态)系于, 悬于; 附于<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A picture hangs on the wall.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 墙上挂着一幅画。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He carried a coat on his arm.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他手臂上搭着一件外衣。</font><br>(表示方式)乘, 坐, 骑<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She will leave on an early train.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她将乘早班火车离开。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We went to the factory on foot.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们步行到工厂去。</font><br>(表示对象)对, 对于, 碰在, 对…造成困难<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is much to be said on both sides.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 公说公有理, 婆说婆有理。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The car broke down on us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汽车抛锚给我们造成了麻烦。</font><br>(表示原因)由于, 因为<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The old worker retired on account of age.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 老工人因年老而退休。</font><br>(表示比较)与…相比<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Today's weather is an improvement on yesterday's.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 今天的天气比昨天的好。</font><br>(表示方位)在…方位<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The town stands on the left bank of the river.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 该镇坐落在河的左岸。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The post office is on the right.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 邮局在右边。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>(放, 穿, 连接)上<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has new shoes on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他穿上新鞋。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She put the tablecloth on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她铺上了台布。</font><br>向前, (继续)下去<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She worked on quietly all night.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她整个晚上默默地继续工作。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They walked on a little way without speaking.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们默默无语地向前走了一段路。</font><br>\n
once	<h3>once</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>一次<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I have been there once.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我到过那儿一次。</font><br>曾经, 昔时<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I once went around the world.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 过去我周游过全球。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>conj.</i></font><br>一旦…就…<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Once you begin, you must continue.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一旦开了头, 你就应当继续下去。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>〈口〉一次, 一回<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She's only done it the once, so don't be too angry.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她只做过这一次, 不要太生气。</font><br>\n
one	<h3>one</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>num.</i></font><br>(数字)一<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A person has one head and one neck.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 人有一个头和一条脖子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please turn to Chapter One.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请翻到第一章。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>一个人, 任何人, 人们<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp One can't be too careful in matters like this.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在这种问题上再怎么小心都不为过。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was very young, not more than twenty-three or four, as indeed one could see at a glance.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他非常年轻, 不会超过23、24岁, 任何人一眼就会看出来。</font><br>(表示与别的对照)某一例[类]<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>pron.</i></font><br>用于代替表示单个的事或人的名词或名词短语<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There are only hard chocolates left, we've eaten all the soft ones.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 只剩下巧克力硬糖, 我们把软糖全吃光了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My house is the first one on the left.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的房子是左边第一家。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>某一个<br>某一<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I met her one afternoon in June.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 六月的一天下午我遇到了她。</font><br>同一个<br>惟一的<br>\n
oneself	<h3>oneself</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>pron.</i></font><br>(one的反身代词)自己<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is not good to think only of oneself.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 只为自己着想是不好的。</font><br>(用于加强语气)亲自<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If one wants to learn it, one must do it oneself.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 要想学会它就得亲自去做。</font><br>\n
ongoing	<h3>ongoing</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>继续进行的; 不断前进[发展]中的<br>\n
onion	<h3>onion</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>洋葱(头)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We grow onions in the garden.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们在园子里种洋葱。</font><br>(食物)洋葱, 葱头<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is too much onion in the salad.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 色拉中洋葱太多。</font><br>\n
online	<h3>online</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>(计算机)联机的, (与计算机)联线的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We planned to build an online database.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们计划建一个联机数据库。</font><br>\n
only	<h3>only</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>惟一的, 仅有的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The only French city she enjoyed was Paris.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 巴黎是她惟一喜欢的法国城市。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They were the only two men at that time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当时就只有他们两人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Practice is the only way to learn a language well.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 学好一门语言的惟一途径就是实践。</font><br>最好的, 独一无二的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She's the only woman for the job.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她是最适合做这一工作的人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Only children are sometimes spoilt.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 独生子女有时被宠坏了。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>只有, 才<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Only the lawyer can understand this agreement.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 只有那律师才懂得这份协议。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They reached the company out of breath only to be told they were fired.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们上气不接下气地赶到公司, 不料却被告知他们被开除了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I rushed to the door, only to discover that it was locked and barred.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我冲到门边, 却发现门已被锁死了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Sap passes right through the aphides' bodies, only getting a little thicker and sweeter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汁液直接流过蚜虫的身体, 结果只是变得更稠、更甜。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Only in this way can we wipe out the enemy troops.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 只有这样我们才能消灭敌军。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you give her money, she'll only waste it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果你把这笔钱给她, 她只会把它浪费掉。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You'll only tell Father, won't you?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你只会把这件事告诉爸爸, 不是吗?</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>conj.</i></font><br>〈非正〉 只是, 但是<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You may use these tools, only you must replace it after use.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些工具你可以使用, 不过你用完之后得重新放好。</font><br>\n
onto	<h3>onto</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>prep.</i></font><br>(表示方向) 到[向]…之上<br>(表示对象)推卸到, 转嫁给; 发觉; 转向, 转移到<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They tried to put the blame onto me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们试图将责任推卸到我身上。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm onto his schemes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我觉察到了他的阴谋诡计。</font><br>(表示过程)正处在…的过程中<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I think we're onto something big.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想我们正在干一番大事业。</font><br>\n
open	<h3>open</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>开着的; 开放的, 公开的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The outer door was wide open but the inner one was locked.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 外面的门大开着而里面的门锁着。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They decided to declare Paris an open city.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们决定宣布巴黎为不设防城市。</font><br>空旷的; 开阔的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp An open sea appeared before us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们前面呈现出广阔的大海。</font><br>坦率的, 无偏见的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is a very friendly, open person.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她是个非常友好、坦率的人。</font><br>开始营业的; 活动的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The bank isn't open yet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那家银行还没有开门营业。</font><br>(职位等)空缺的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Is the teaching vacancy still open?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 教员职位还有空缺吗?</font><br>尚未决定的, 悬而未决的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is an open question at the moment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 此刻这还是个悬而未决的问题。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(打)开<br>开始; 开设<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The meeting will open the day after tomorrow.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个会议将于后天开幕。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The chairman opened the Parliament.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 主席宣布议会开始。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Negotiations would probably be opened again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 谈判可能又要开始。</font><br>\n
