pierce	<h3>pierce</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>刺入; 刺穿; 穿透<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The knife did not pierce very deeply.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 刀扎得不很深。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He pierced the skin of cooking sausages with a fork.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他用叉子在要烹调的香肠上扎了孔。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her ears were pierced.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她扎了耳环孔。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The cold pierced his clothes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 寒气穿透他的衣服。</font><br>\n

pilot	<h3>pilot</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>飞行员, 宇航员<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The pilot crashed the airplane in landing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 飞机驾驶员在降落时使飞机坠毁。</font><br>引航员; 舵手<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A steamer takes on a pilot before coming into a strange harbour.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 轮船进入陌生的港口前要雇用引航员。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>驾驶<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He pilots his car.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他驾驶他的汽车。</font><br>带领, 指引, 引导<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Tom didn't like to pilot the boat.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汤姆不愿为这只船领航。</font><br>试验, 试用<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Schools are piloting the new maths course.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 学校正试用新的数学教程。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>试验性的; 引导的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is a pilot edition of a new language course.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是一种新语言教程的试用版。</font><br>\n
pin	<h3>pin</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>大头针, 别针<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The dressmaker used a pin to fasten the pattern to the cloth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 裁缝用大头针把纸样别在布料上。</font><br>饰针<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Did you see the diamond pin she got for Christmas?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你看到她为圣诞节买的钻石饰针了吗?</font><br>锁, 钉, 插头, 闩<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The doctor put a steel pin in his wrist.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 医生在他的腕关节植入一根钢钉。</font><br>腿<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He's a bit unsteady on his pins.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的两腿还有点站不稳。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>把…别住, 把…钉住<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She had pinned a wild rose in her hair.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她头上别了一朵野玫瑰。</font><br>压住, 使不能动<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The policeman pinned his arms behind him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警察把他的双臂按在背后。</font><br>\n
pinch	<h3>pinch</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>盗窃, 偷<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The thief pinched her purse and ran away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 小偷偷了她的皮夹子跑了。</font><br>逮捕, 拘留<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The police pinched him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警察逮捕了他。</font><br>夹痛, 扎痛<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These shoes pinch my feet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这双鞋把我的脚夹痛了。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>捏, 掐, 夹, 拧<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These shoes must be too small because they pinch.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 因为这双鞋夹脚, 所以他们一定是太小了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The child was crying because somebody had pinched her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那孩子哭了, 因为有人掐她。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The mother pinched her baby black and blue.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这位母亲将她的孩子掐得青一块紫一块的。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>捏, 掐, 夹, 拧<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She gave him a pinch to wake him up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她拧了他一下以弄醒他。</font><br>一撮, 微量<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He put a pinch of salt on his food.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在自己的食物上撒了一撮盐。</font><br>困苦, 穷苦<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's six months since he lost his job, so he's beginning to feel the pinch.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他失业已有六个月了, 所以开始感到相当困难。</font><br>\n
pine	<h3>pine</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>松树<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is an old pine tree in front of the house.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 房子前面有一株老松树。</font><br>松木<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is a pine table.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是一张松木桌子。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>消瘦, 憔悴; 痛苦<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She certainly hasn't been pining while you were away!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你不在的时候她可并不难受。</font><br>渴望<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is pining to travel abroad.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她渴望去国外旅行。</font><br>\n
pink	<h3>pink</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>粉红色的, 淡红色的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Many types of roses are pink.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 好多种玫瑰是粉红色的。</font><br>略带左翼政治观点的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The pink parties won seat in Parliament.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 左翼党派赢得了议会席位。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His opinion is pink.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的观点有点左倾。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>粉红色<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was dressed in a lively pink.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她身穿一件粉红色的衣服。</font><br>典范, 模范<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is the pink of politeness.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是礼貌待人的典范。</font><br>\n

pipe	<h3>pipe</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>管子, 管道<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Water is brought into our houses through pipes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 水通过水管送到我们的屋子里。</font><br>烟斗<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My pipe has gone out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我烟斗的火熄灭了。</font><br>管乐器, 笛子<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is playing a tune on his pipe.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在用笛子吹奏一支曲子。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>以管输送<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They piped oil yesterday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 昨天他们用管道输送油。</font><br>传送<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Nearly all the shops have piped music.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 差不多所有的商店都连续播放有线广播的音乐。</font><br>吹哨子下令(表示欢迎)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The admiral was piped aboard.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 海军上将在欢迎他的哨子声中登舰。</font><br>滚边, 镶花边<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He piped “Happy Birthday” on the cake.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在蛋糕上镶上了“生日快乐”的字样。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>用笛子吹奏; 鸣啭, 唱<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He piped so that we could dance.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他吹笛子伴奏好让我们跳舞。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The piper will pipe a tune.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 演奏者将用笛子吹奏一支曲子。</font><br>\n

pit	<h3>pit</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>坑<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They dug a pit to bury the rubbish.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们挖了一个坑把垃圾埋掉。</font><br>煤矿, 矿坑<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He worked all his life down the pit.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他一辈子在矿井下工作。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>使有麻子; 使有凹陷<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Earthquake pitted the surface of the earth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 地震使地面出现了凹陷。</font><br>\n
pitch	<h3>pitch</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>球场<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The crowd invaded the pitch at the end of the match.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 比赛结束时人群涌入球场。</font><br>音调, 音高<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her voice has a very high pitch.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她说话声调很高。</font><br>程度; 强度; 高度<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Disagreement reached such a pitch that we thought a fight would break out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 意见分歧达到我们以为会争吵起来的程度。</font><br>沥青<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They used pitch to cover roofs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们用沥青涂盖屋顶。</font><br>颠簸<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The pitch of the ship threw the passengers off balance.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 轮船上下颠簸, 使乘客失去了平衡。</font><br>斜度, 坡度<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The roof has a sharp pitch.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这屋顶很陡。</font><br>商贩摊位, 艺人表演场地<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has a pitch on the High Street where he sells souvenirs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在大街上有个卖纪念品的摆摊处。</font><br>推销商品的话<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has a very clever sales pitch.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他推销商品的口才很好。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>投, 掷, 扔<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was pitching the ball.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他正在投球。</font><br>为…定音调<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This song is pitched too high for my voice.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 对我的嗓子来说, 这首歌的音定得太高了。</font><br>用人们易懂的方式表述<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He pitched his speech so that even the children could understand.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他带着一种特殊的表情讲话, 以便孩子们能听懂。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>搭(帐篷), 扎(营)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They pitched at the foot of the mountain.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们在山脚下扎营。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They pitched a camp in the mountain.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们在山中扎营。</font><br>(使)突然向前倒下<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His foot caught in a rock and he pitched forwards.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的脚被岩石绊了一下, 身子就朝前倒下。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>颠簸<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The ship pitched and rolled and many passengers were sick.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那轮船颠簸摇晃, 很多乘客头晕恶心。</font><br>向下倾斜<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The roof of this house pitches sharply.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这房子的屋顶倾斜度很大。</font><br>\n
pity	<h3>pity</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>怜悯, 同情<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The beggar's story excited my pity.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这乞丐的经历激起我的怜悯。</font><br>可惜的事; 憾事<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's a pity to be kept in the house in so fine weather.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这样好的天气待在家里实在太可惜了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's a pity that he can't come.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 很遗憾他不能来。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>同情; 怜悯<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He shook his head sorrowfully, pitying himself for what had been done to him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他悲伤地摇摇头, 为自己的遭遇而自怜。</font><br>觉得…可鄙<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I pity you if you can't answer such a simple question!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你要是回答不了这样一个简单的问题, 我真为你感到可鄙！</font><br>\n
place	<h3>place</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>地方, 场所, 所在地<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is the place where the storm hit.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这就是暴风雨袭击的地方。</font><br>城, 村, 镇<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Moscow is a very cold place in winter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 冬季莫斯科非常寒冷。</font><br>建筑物, 场所<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He likes to go to places of amusement.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他喜欢去娱乐场所。</font><br>某点; 某处; 某段落<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is something about nationalism in this book, but I can't find the place.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这本书里谈到民族主义, 可是我找不到在哪里。</font><br>座位, 位置<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was asked to put it back to its place.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 要我把它放回原来的地方。</font><br>等级, 地位, 身份<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In the Middle Ages, a lord and a serf had very different places in life.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 中世纪, 农奴主和农奴在生活中是两个截然不同的阶级。</font><br>职位, 职务; 学习的机会<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mary likes her new place in the lawyer's office.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 玛丽喜欢律师事务所里的新工作。</font><br>自然或恰当的位置[地方]<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Sports never had an important place in his life.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 运动在他的生活中从未占有重要位置。</font><br>位<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Correct the result to 5 decimal places.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把结果精确到小数点后五位数。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>放置, 安排<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The agency placed about 200 secretaries per annum.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 该代理机构每年大约安排200份秘书工作。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Place the girl as a typist.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 让这个女孩做打字员吧。</font><br>使…处于某处境[环境]<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Place the book back where you found it when you have finished reading it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 看完后把书放回原处。</font><br>定名次<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My horse wasn't even placed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的马未获名次。</font><br>辨认<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The man seemed familiar, but I could not quite place him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这人很面熟, 但是我记不起来。</font><br>评价, 分类<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My son's income can probably be placed as ￡5000 a year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我儿子的年收入估计达5000英镑。</font><br>发订单; 打赌<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Place your bets now—the race begins in half an hour!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 现在可以下赌注——赛事于半小时后开始。</font><br>\n
plague	<h3>plague</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>瘟疫<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Plague was once very common here.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 以前, 瘟疫在这里时有发生。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>使染瘟疫<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has been plaguing me with silly questions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他老是拿些愚蠢的问题来烦我。</font><br>\n
plain	<h3>plain</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>平原<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Animals range over the hills and plains.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 动物在山丘和平原上出没。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>清晰的; 明白的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The plain truth is that he doesn't like you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 说白了, 他不喜欢你。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The figures in the picture are quite plain.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 照片上的人像很清楚。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's plain to see you haven't done this before.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 显然你以前没做过这种事情。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is quite plain that he is mistaken.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 看来显然是他错了。</font><br>朴素的; 简单的; 平常的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She's in plain clothes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的穿着很朴素。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The food was plain but well prepared.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这饭菜很普通, 但烧得很好。</font><br>坦白的, 坦率的, 真诚的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'll tell you everything in plain words.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我将坦白地把一切事情告诉你。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was plain about this.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 关于这一点他说得很坦率。</font><br>完全的; 十足的; 彻底的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He's a plain fool.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是个十足的笨蛋。</font><br>\n
plan	<h3>plan</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>计划, 打算, 方案<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Your plan sounds fine in theory, but will it work?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你的计划在理论上听起来不错, 但行得通吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They devised a plan to rob a bank.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们策划抢劫银行。</font><br>平面图, 示意图<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The plans of the new development are on show at the town hall.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 镇公所大厅展示了新开发的平面图。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>计划, 打算, 设计<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's better to plan if you want arrangements to be really efficient.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果你希望有个紧凑的安排, 最好事先做个计划。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I have planned the whole thing to the smallest detail.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我已经把整个事情连最小的细节都计划好了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What do you plan to do during the holidays?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你打算在假期里做什么?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I planned going myself.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我打算亲自去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He began to plan what he would do with his Sundays.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他开始计划星期天的活动。</font><br>\n
plane	<h3>plane</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>飞机<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They painted the underside of their planes with a black varnish.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们在飞机的底部涂上了一层黑漆。</font><br>水平, 程度; 标准<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Keep your work on a high plane.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把你的工作保持在高水平上。</font><br>平面<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Parallel lines are, by definition, lines on the same plane that never join.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 按照定义说, 平行线是在同一平面上永不相交的线。</font><br>\n

plant	<h3>plant</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>植物<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Hot climate and plentiful rainfall favour the growth of plants.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 炎热的气候和充足的雨水有助于植物生长。</font><br>工厂<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They've decided on building a power plant there.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们已决定在那里修建一座发电厂。</font><br>重型机械, 机械设备<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They have made a huge investment in new plant.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们投入巨资购置新设备。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>种植, 栽种<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Farmers plant seeds.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 农民们播种。</font><br>放置; 安插<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They must have planted many explosives there.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们一定在这里埋了很多炸药。</font><br>\n
plantation	<h3>plantation</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>种植园, 大农场<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His father-in-law is a plantation manager.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他岳父是个种植园经营者。</font><br>\n
plastic	<h3>plastic</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>塑料; 塑料制品<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These spoons are made of plastic.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些汤匙是塑料制的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Plastics are used in many modern articles instead of metal, wood, etc.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 塑料在许多现代用品中被用来代替金属、木材等。</font><br>〈口〉信用卡<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Nowadays we can use plastic instead of cash in many places buying things.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如今在许多场所都可以用信用卡代替现金来购买物品。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>(指物品)塑料的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These plastic bowls are very light.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些塑料碗很轻。</font><br>(指材料或物质)可塑的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Clay and wax are plastic substances.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 黏土和蜡是可塑性物质。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The mind of a young child is quite plastic.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 儿童的思想颇具可塑性。</font><br>\n
plate	<h3>plate</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>盘子, 碟<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our host was very generous, heaping a plate of food to us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 主人十分慷慨, 给我们装了一盘食物。</font><br>金属牌<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I read her name on the polished brass plate.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我在擦亮的黄铜门牌上看到了她的名字。</font><br>平板, 薄片<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We have succeeded in bending the thick steel plates.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们终于把这些厚钢板弄弯了。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>镀, 电镀<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He plated the old silver container again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他给这个旧的银器皿重新镀银。</font><br>\n
platform	<h3>platform</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>台, 平台, 讲台, 舞台, 戏台<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They built a platform in the trees from which they could watch the animals unobserved.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们在树上搭了个高台, 从那里可以观察动物而不被察觉。</font><br>站台, 月台<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Your train is waiting at Platform 5.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你要坐的那列火车在第五号站台。</font><br>纲领; 政纲; 宣言<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is running for mayor on a platform of low taxation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他以低税收为纲领竞选市长。</font><br>\n
plausible	<h3>plausible</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>(声明、争论等)似乎是真的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His story sounded plausible.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他说的那番话似乎是真实的。</font><br>花言巧语的, 能说会道的<br>\n
play	<h3>play</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>游戏, 玩耍; 娱乐<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All work and no play isn't a good thing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 只工作不玩耍不是件好事。</font><br>比赛, 竞赛, 运动<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There was some excellent play in yesterday's match.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 昨天的比赛有些出色的表现。</font><br>戏剧; 剧本<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The college drama society is going to put on a play.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大学戏剧协会正准备上演一个剧目。</font><br>自由活动<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We need more play on the rope.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 绳子要松些。</font><br>赌博<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He won 1000 pounds in last night's play.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他昨天晚上赌博赢了1000英镑。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>玩, 玩耍<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let's go out and play.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们出去玩吧。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He played truant.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他逃学。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The children don't know how to play the game.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们不会玩这个游戏。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'll play you a game of cards.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我和你打一场牌。</font><br>参加比赛<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our best defender is injured and won't be able to play today.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们最佳的防守员受伤了, 今天不能参加比赛。</font><br>演奏; 播放<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The band is playing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 乐队正在演奏。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He plays the piano surprisingly well.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他钢琴弹得好极了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Play us something happy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 为我们演奏一些快乐的乐曲。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He'd written a tune, and played it to us on the piano.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他写了一段曲子, 并在钢琴上弹给我们听。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He played his favourite record for me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他为我放他最喜爱的唱片。</font><br>演出, 扮演<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The second actor plays well.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 第二个演员演得好。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The dog played dead.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这狗装死。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>开某人玩笑, 嘲弄<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't play jokes on the poor girl.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别再开这可怜的女孩玩笑了。</font><br>\n
playground	<h3>playground</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>操场; 游乐场, 娱乐场<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The city has several playgrounds for children.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这座城市有好几个儿童游乐场。</font><br>\n
pleasant	<h3>pleasant</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>令人愉快的, 舒适的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We spend a very pleasant evening.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们度过了一个愉快的晚上。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The walk was very pleasant.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这次散步非常愉快。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is pleasant for us to meet you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 遇见你我们感到很高兴。</font><br>可爱的; 友善的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What a pleasant girl!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 多可爱的姑娘啊！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Even when he was being pleasant, his eyes never smiled.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 即使在他有意显得很和气的时候, 他的目光也从不露笑意。</font><br>晴朗的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The weather is pleasant today.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 今天天气晴朗。</font><br>\n
please	<h3>please</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>int.</i></font><br>请<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A cup of tea, please.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请来一杯茶。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使…)高兴; (使…)满意<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The aim of poetry is to please.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 诗的目的在于使人愉悦。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That will please you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那将会合你的意。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It pleases me that he should want to talk with me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我很高兴他想同我谈谈。</font><br>想要; 喜欢<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Will you please to come at once?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请马上来, 好吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It pleased him to remain.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 留下来正合他的心意。</font><br>\n
pleasure	<h3>pleasure</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>愉快, 快乐, 满足<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His grandchildren afforded him his greatest pleasure in his old age.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的孙子和孙女们在晚年的时候给了他最大的欢乐。</font><br>娱乐, 消遣<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Has he gone to Paris on business or for pleasure?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他到巴黎是办公事还是游玩去了?</font><br>快乐的事物, 乐事<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is one of my greatest pleasures.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是我最高兴的事之一。</font><br>方便而乐意做的事<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He finds pleasure in reading.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他从阅读中得到乐趣。</font><br>愿望, 意愿<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp May I have the pleasure of the next dance with you?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你肯赏光跟我跳下一个舞吗?</font><br>\n
pledge	<h3>pledge</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>保证; 誓言<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government should fulfil its pledge.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府应该履行其诺言。</font><br>信物<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Take this ring as a pledge of our friendship.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 收下这枚戒指当作我们友谊的信物。</font><br>抵押品<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She left her gold bracelet as a pledge.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她留下她的金手镯作抵押品。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>保证, 许诺; 发誓<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The old man is willing to pledge for him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那位老人愿意为他担保。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They have pledged that they will always remain faithful to each other.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们发誓他们将永远忠诚于对方。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I pledge you my words.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我向你保证说话算数。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>典当<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I pledged my watch.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我以手表作抵押。</font><br>\n
plentiful	<h3>plentiful</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>丰富的, 大量的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Their family has a plentiful harvest this year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们家今年又丰收了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Fruit is plentiful this year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 今年水果很多。</font><br>\n
plenty	<h3>plenty</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>充裕, 大量, 富庶<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They would have plenty to eat.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们将会有充足的食物。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>相当地, 充分地<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm plenty hungry, you guys.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大伙听着, 我饿得很呀。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We've got plenty more in the shop.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们店里还有很多。</font><br>十分; 非常<br>\n
plot	<h3>plot</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>故事情节<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is a novel with a complicated plot.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这本小说情节复杂。</font><br>(秘密)计划, 密谋<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The police exposed a criminal plot to assassinate the President.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警察破了一个行刺总统的阴谋。</font><br>小块地皮<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His land is split up into several widely scattered plots.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的土地被分割成相当分散的几小块。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>把…分成小块; 划分<br>绘制; 标出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He plotted the position Mary should go.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他给玛丽标出她应去的地方。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>密谋<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He plotted the ruin of his enemy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他阴谋倾覆他的敌人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They plotted to kill the politician.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们图谋要杀掉那位政治家。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They were plotting how to obtain the necessary information.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们正在策划如何获取必要的情报。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They were plotting how they would assassinate the President.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们正秘密策划如何暗杀总统。</font><br>\n
plough	<h3>plough</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>犁<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Ploughs are pulled by tractors, or in some countries by oxen.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 犁由拖拉机牵引, 在一些国家则用牛来拉。</font><br>耕地<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We possess ten acres of plough.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们拥有十英亩耕地。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>用犁耕田; 耕<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Farmers plough in autumn or spring.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 农民在秋天或春天犁田。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The peasants were ploughing the field.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 农民们在耕田。</font><br>开路; 破浪前进; 艰苦前进<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The great ship ploughed across the ocean.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 巨轮在大洋中破浪前进。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our gunboats are ploughing the waves.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我军炮艇正在破浪前进。</font><br>\n
plow	<h3>plow</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>犁<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>v.</i></font><br>耕,犁,犁耕,费力穿过,艰苦前进,在考试中淘汰<br>\n
plug	<h3>plug</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>插头, 插座<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They used electricity from a plug in the garage.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们通过车库插座取电。</font><br>塞子, 栓<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She pulled out the plug of the bathtub.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她拔下浴缸的塞子。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>插上插头<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The girl let her mother plug in the TV set.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 女孩叫母亲插上电视机的插头。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>以(塞子)塞住<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Use this wad of cloth to plug the barrel.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 用这软布把桶塞上。</font><br>\n
plunge	<h3>plunge</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>颠簸<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The little boat plunged about in the storm.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 小船在暴风雨中颠簸得很厉害。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使)陷入<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That man plunged in the river but not to save the child.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个人在河中沉浮, 但是救不了那个孩子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The sudden stopping of the car plunged him forwards.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汽车急刹车, 使得他猛地向前倾去。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>投身入水<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp John felt refreshed after a quick plunge in the lake.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在湖中游了一会儿泳后, 约翰感到精神振奋。</font><br>猛跌, 骤降<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The sky diver had a plunge of more than 10, 000 feet before his parachute opened.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个跳伞运动员坠落了一万多英尺, 他的降落伞才打开。</font><br>\n
plural	<h3>plural</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>复数, 复数形式<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “Boy” is singular, and “boys” is plural.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp boy是单数, boys是复数。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>复数的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Here you should use plural pronoun.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这里你应该用复数代词。</font><br>不止一个<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A plural marriage is forbidden by many countries.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一夫多妻, 一妻多夫制被许多国家禁止。</font><br>\n
plus	<h3>plus</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>prep.</i></font><br>(表示包容)外加; 另有<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Work out the full weekly rent, plus your rates.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 算出一周的房租外加房地产税。</font><br>(表示运算)加, 加上<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What's seventeen plus nine?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 17加9等于多少?</font><br>(表示数目)在零(度)以上, 正<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If the input voltage is plus three, it comes out as minus six.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果输入的电压是+3伏, 那么输出的电压便是-6伏。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>加号, 正号<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He seems to have mistaken a minus for a plus.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他似乎把负号误作正号了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He calculated his gains and losses of money and the result was a plus.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把所得与所亏钱数计算了一下, 结果是盈余。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>正的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Three is a plus quantity.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 三是一个正数。</font><br>比所示数量多的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All the children here are 12 plus.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这里的孩子都是12岁以上的。</font><br>附加的, 称心的, 有利的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her previous experience in social work is a plus factor.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她先前在社会工作方面的经验是一个有利因素。</font><br>\n
pocket	<h3>pocket</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>袋, 口袋<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His pockets bulged with apples and candy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的口袋鼓鼓地装满了苹果和糖。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>把…装入袋内<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He pocketed his wallet and car keys.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把钱包和汽车钥匙放进衣袋里。</font><br>侵吞, 盗用<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He pocketed a hundred dollars on the transaction.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在这笔交易中他侵吞了100美元。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>袖珍的; 小型的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He bought a pocket dictionary.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他买了一本袖珍词典。</font><br>\n
poem	<h3>poem</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>诗, 韵文<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He wrote some poems in English.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他用英语写了几首诗。</font><br>\n
poet	<h3>poet</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>诗人<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is a lyric poet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是个抒情诗人。</font><br>\n
poetic	<h3>poetic</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>诗歌的<br>\n
poetry	<h3>poetry</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>诗篇, 诗歌, 诗集<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Poetry is a difficult art.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 诗歌是很难写的艺术体裁。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He wrote a very beautiful poetry.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他所写的是一种非常优美的诗。</font><br>作诗法, 诗歌艺术<br>诗情, 诗意, 诗一般的美<br>\n
point	<h3>point</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>要点, 论点, 观点<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Some of these points will have to be further elaborated as we go along.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些要点中, 有些我们在往下讨论时还得作进一步的详细阐述。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His remarks lack point.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的言词缺乏要点。</font><br>尖端; 尖儿<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When you buy new pens, get one with a sharper point.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 买新钢笔时要买尖儿比较尖的。</font><br>点; 小数点<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When we read out 4.23, we say “four point two three”.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们把4.23读作四点二三。</font><br>(某一)时刻; (某一)地点<br>分数, 得分<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He conceded ten points to his opponent.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他让给自己的对手十分。</font><br>目的, 意图<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you have a definite purpose in mind, get to the point promptly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果你心里有明确的意图, 就干脆说出来。</font><br>条款; 细目<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is another point to be borne in mind.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 另外一项条款是应当记住的。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>削尖<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Point this pencil for me, please.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请把铅笔给我削尖。</font><br>增强<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He told a story to point his advice.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他讲了一个故事, 以增强他的忠告的力量。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>指; 指向<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's rude to point.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 用手指人是不礼貌的。</font><br>\n
poison	<h3>poison</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>毒药, 毒物<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was deadly poison and if he drank it he'd probably die.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是致命的毒药, 他要是喝下去很可能会丧命。</font><br>酒<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What's your poison?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你们喝点什么酒?</font><br>极糟的食物<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm not eating that poison!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我可不吃那种猪食！</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>毒死, 毒杀<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The explosion of the chemical plant has poisoned many local residents.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那座化工厂的爆炸毒死了许多当地居民。</font><br>放毒于<br>污染<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Exhaust fumes from cars are poisoning the air of our cities.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汽车排出的废气使我们城市中的空气遭受污染。</font><br>对…有不良影响, 毒化<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't trust the words which poison the friendship of ours.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要相信那些破坏我们友谊的话。</font><br>\n
poisonous	<h3>poisonous</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>有毒的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was bitten by a poisonous snake.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他被毒蛇咬了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This medicine is poisonous.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这药有毒性。</font><br>引起中毒的, 有害的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This medicine is poisonous if taken in large quantities.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种药如服过量是会中毒的。</font><br>讨厌的, 恶意的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He gave her a poisonous look.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他恶意地看了她一眼。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The weather was positively poisonous.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这天气着实讨厌。</font><br>\n
pole	<h3>pole</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>柱, 杆<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We leaned the poles back against the wall.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们把这些竿子斜倚在墙上。</font><br>地极; 磁极, 电极<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The South and North Pole are the two points at opposite ends of the earth, about which it revolves.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 南北极是地球绕之自转的两个相对的点。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The N pole and S pole of two magnets will attract each other.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 两个磁体的N极和S极互相吸引。</font><br>截然相反的两极之一, 极端<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our opinions on this subject are at opposite poles.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们对这一问题的看法截然相反。</font><br>\n

policy	<h3>policy</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>政策, 方针<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government must make new policies to reduce unemployment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府必须制定减少失业的新政策。</font><br>策略, 精明的行为, 上策<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp As they say, honesty is the best policy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 常言道, 诚实是最佳策略。</font><br>保险单<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is advisable to read the small print on your policy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 读一下保险单上的附属细则是明智的。</font><br>\n

polish	<h3>polish</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使)光滑, 擦亮<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The wood won't polish.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种木材无法磨光。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They polished the car.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们擦亮了汽车。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He polished the floor smooth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把地板磨得光滑。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>文饰<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Would you please polish my article right now?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 您现在把我的文章润色一下好吗?</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>光泽剂, 上光蜡, 亮漆<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The polish is rubbed off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 上光蜡被擦掉了。</font><br>光亮, 光滑<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A hot plate will spoil the table's polish.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 热盘子会弄坏桌面的光泽。</font><br>擦亮, 磨光<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Use brown polish on these shoes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 用棕色的鞋油擦这双鞋。</font><br>优美, 高雅, 完善<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His writing has potential but lacks polish.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的写作很有潜力, 但是不够优美。</font><br>\n
polite	<h3>polite</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>有礼貌的, 客气的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I've never seen such a polite clerk.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我从未见过这样有礼貌的店员。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Even though you dislike us, still and all you should be polite.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 尽管你不喜欢我们, 但你仍然应该有礼貌。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is polite that she accepts his invitation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她接受他的邀请, 这显得她很有礼貌。</font><br>有教养的; 文雅的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is a polite girl.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她是一个文雅的姑娘。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't answer back; it's not polite.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要顶嘴, 这样显得你没教养。</font><br>\n
political	<h3>political</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>政治的; 政治上的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Henry was forced to leave his motherland for political reasons.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 由于政治原因, 亨利被迫离开了他的祖国。</font><br>政党的, 党派的<br>对政治有兴趣的, 政治上活跃的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The students in this university are very political.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这大学里的学生对政治很感兴趣。</font><br>\n
politician	<h3>politician</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>政治家<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The mayor is a skilled politician.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 市长是一位老练的政治家。</font><br>政客, 玩弄权术者<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You need to be a bit of a politician to succeed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你要获得成功, 就需要有一点政客的手腕。</font><br>\n
politics	<h3>politics</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>政治活动<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Politics has[have] never interested me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我从未对政治活动感兴趣。</font><br>政治学<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I am studying politics at university.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我在大学里学习政治学。</font><br>政论, 政见; 党派倾向<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What are your politics?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你的政见如何?</font><br>权术; 派别之争<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They're not concerned with welfare;  it's all politics!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们并非关心福利问题, 完全是党派之争。</font><br>\n
poll	<h3>poll</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>民意调查, 民意调查的结果<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The latest poll gives the Republicans a 5％ lead.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 最近的民意调查结果表明共和党领先了五个百分点。</font><br>投票选举<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The result of the poll won't be known until midnight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 选举结果要到午夜才能揭晓。</font><br>投票数<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They expected a heavy poll.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们期望会有很高的投票数。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>获得…张票数<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She polled 98 votes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她获得了98张选票。</font><br>对…进行调查<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They polled the President.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们对总统进行民意测验。</font><br>切短<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They polled the cattle.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们把这头牛的角切短了。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>投票<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They went there to poll.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们去那里投选票。</font><br>\n

pool	<h3>pool</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>水池<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The pool is dangerous and should be fenced off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个水池很危险, 应该用栅栏围起来。</font><br>(液体等的)一滩, 一片<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The body was lying in a pool of blood.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 尸体躺在血泊中。</font><br>共同储金; 共用物; 共用人员<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is disappointed with the pool car.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他对这部公用汽车感到失望。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>集中…共同使用; 共用<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp None of us can afford it separately, so let's pool our resources.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们之中谁也不能单独买得起这东西, 所以我们就集资购买吧。</font><br>\n
poor	<h3>poor</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>贫困的, 贫穷的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Many poor people gathered at the gate.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 许多穷苦人聚集在门口。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The village used to be poor.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个村庄过去很穷。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is too poor to satisfy her family's material needs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她太穷了, 无法满足家人的物质需要。</font><br>贫乏的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The farm is a very poor one.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个农场贫瘠得很。</font><br>低劣的; 次等的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp An actor who mouths his lines is a poor actor.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 装腔作势背台词的演员不是好演员。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My handwriting is poorer than hers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的字还不如她的。</font><br>(身体)衰弱的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He's still in poor health after his illness.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 病好后他的身体仍很弱。</font><br>可怜的; 不幸的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The poor old man had lost both his sons in the war.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这位不幸的老人在战争中失去了两个儿子。</font><br>\n

portion	<h3>portion</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>一部分, 一份<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Three thousand dollars is no more than a portion.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 3000美元只不过是一部分。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You are paid your portion not later than a week.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不会晚于一周你就可以得到你那一部分报酬。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She ordered a portion of fried eggs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她点了一份煎蛋。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>把…分成份额, 分配<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They portioned the food out to the poor.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们将食物分发给穷人。</font><br>\n
portrait	<h3>portrait</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>肖像, 画像<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These portraits are great pieces of paint.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这肖像画都是艺术精品。</font><br>生动的描写<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The article gives a detailed portrait of a great soldier.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这篇文章详细地描写了一位伟大的战士。</font><br>\n
pose	<h3>pose</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>使摆姿势; 以…身份出现<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The model was posing carefully.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这位模特儿在认真地摆着姿势。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The artist posed his model carefully.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 画家细心地指导模特儿摆好姿势。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>提出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You've posed an awkward question.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你已经提出了一个难题。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>姿势, 姿态<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He sat in a relaxed pose.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他轻松自如地坐着。</font><br>装腔作势, 伪装<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The President's visit to the slums was a mere pose.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 总统到贫民区去访问只不过是做做样子罢了。</font><br>\n
position	<h3>position</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>方位, 位置<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you find our position on this map?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你能在这幅地图上找到我们的位置吗?</font><br>地位, 身份<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has a lofty position in the firm.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在公司里地位很高。</font><br>职位, 职务<br>姿势, 姿态<br>状态, 状况, 境况, 形势<br>态度, 立场<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Both sides made their positions clear.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 双方立场鲜明。</font><br>阵地<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We will attack the enemy's positions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们将进攻敌人的阵地。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>将(某物)放在(某一)位置上<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The nails are positioned as desired.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 钉子被钉在适当的位置。</font><br>\n
positive	<h3>positive</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>确实的, 明确的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I am positive.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我确信。</font><br>积极的; 肯定的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I am positive that I saw him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我敢肯定我见过他。</font><br>表现得有信心和有希望的, 确信的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is positive to believe in the being of God.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他对上帝的存在深信不疑。</font><br>〈数〉〈电〉正的, 阳性的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The positive pole carries a positive charge while the negative pole does a negative charge.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 正极带正电荷, 负极带负电荷。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The test proved positive.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 试验结果呈阳性。</font><br>完全的; 纯粹的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is a positive idiot.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她完全是个白痴。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>〈语〉原级形容词<br>确实; 正量, 正数<br>正片<br>\n
possess	<h3>possess</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>具有<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The country possesses rich mineral deposits.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个国家拥有丰富的矿藏。</font><br>占据<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He possessed his soul in patience.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他耐心等待。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is possessed with rage.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在盛怒之中。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The desire to be rich possessed him to act so.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 发财的欲望使他做出如此之事来。</font><br>\n
possession	<h3>possession</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>占有, 持有, 拥有<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The Egyptians strove with the Romans for the possession of the Nile Valley.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 埃及人为占有尼罗河谷而与罗马人斗争。</font><br>个人财产, 私人财物<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She forsook her worldly possessions to devote herself to the church.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她抛弃世上的财物而献身教会。</font><br>领地, 属地, 殖民地<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp India was Britain's former overseas possession.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 印度是英国过去的海外领地。</font><br>\n
possibility	<h3>possibility</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>可能性<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Is there any possibility that you'll be back by the weekend?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 周末以前你有可能回来吗?</font><br>可能的事<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is one possibility of changing jobs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 换工作是有可能的事。</font><br>可以利用和改善的余地; 潜力<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The house is very dilapidated but it has possibilities.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这房子已破旧不堪, 但还可有利用的价值。</font><br>\n
possible	<h3>possible</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>可能的, 可能存在[发生, 做到]的; 潜在的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He will get the great possible assistance.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他将获得尽可能大的帮助。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's possible to break with old habits.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 改掉老习惯是可能的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He thought it was possible that she would[might] come back that day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他认为她那天有可能回来。</font><br>也许(会发生)的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They are ready against the possible invasion.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们防备可能的入侵。</font><br>可接受的, 合适的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is the only possible man for the position.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是担任该职务的惟一合适人选。</font><br>\n
possibly	<h3>possibly</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>可能地<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Nobody can possibly suspect what he says.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 谁都不可能怀疑他所说的话。</font><br>也许, 或许<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is possibly the most selfish man in the town.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他也许是镇上最自私的人。</font><br>\n
post	<h3>post</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>柱, 杆, 桩<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The post is stalled fast in the ground.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那根柱子牢牢地竖在地上。</font><br>终点标志<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The horses galloped towards the post.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 马飞快地冲向终点。</font><br>邮政<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There was no end to the letters pouring into the post office.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有大量的信投进了邮局。</font><br>邮件<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A letter has come for you in the second post.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 今天的第二批邮件中有一封你的信。</font><br>邮局, 邮筒<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I've just taken her birthday card down to the post.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我刚把她的生日贺卡拿去邮局寄。</font><br>职位<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Ask him whether he would accept the post.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 问问他是否愿意就任该职。</font><br>岗位, 哨位<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don't think I should be suitable for the post.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我认为这个岗位对我不合适。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>张贴; 贴在…上<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Post this notice on the wall.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把这个通知贴在墙上。</font><br>宣布; 公告<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They have posted the ship (as) missing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们已宣布那艘船失踪。</font><br>邮寄<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He posted the letter this morning.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他今天上午把信寄出去了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I posted him a letter yesterday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 昨天我给他邮去一封信。</font><br>设岗<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This place was not very safe, so they wanted to post guard.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个地方不太安全, 因此他们想设岗于此。</font><br>委派<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We posted a guard to keep watch.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们派了一名卫兵站岗。</font><br>\n
postage	<h3>postage</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>邮费, 邮资<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The bill was 10, plus 1 for postage.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 账款是十美元, 再加上一美元邮费。</font><br>\n

postman	<h3>postman</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>邮递员, 邮差<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The postman is carrying a heavy parcel.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 邮递员提着一个沉重的包裹。</font><br>\n
postpone	<h3>postpone</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>延期; 推迟<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The mother postponed all other business to the task of smoothing her crying child.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 母亲放下一切别的事情, 先去抚慰哭叫着的孩子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They postponed leaving because of the weather.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们因天气原因而延期离开。</font><br>\n
pot	<h3>pot</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>罐, 锅, 壶<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He debated heating up the pot first before his friends came.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他考虑在朋友们到来之前先把火锅烧热。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A full tea set like this consists of a pot and eight cups.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 像这样的全套茶具由一个壶和八个杯子组成。</font><br>\n
potato	<h3>potato</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>马铃薯, 土豆<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My brother likes potatoes very much, but I don't care for them.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我弟弟很喜欢吃土豆, 可我不喜欢。</font><br>小人物<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They are small potatoes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们是些微不足道的人。</font><br>\n
potential	<h3>potential</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>潜在的, 有可能的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's important to draw out a child's potential capacities.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 发掘孩子的潜在能力是很重要的。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>潜力, 潜势, 可能性<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This new invention has an enormous sales potential.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这项新发明有巨大的销售潜力。</font><br>\n
pound	<h3>pound</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>磅<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These cost ten pence a pound.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些东西10便士一磅。</font><br>英镑<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I advanced 100 pounds more on these books.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些书我又多预付了100英镑。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>连续重击<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His heart pounded with excitement.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的心兴奋得怦怦直跳。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The boxer pounded his opponent.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那拳击运动员猛击对手。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The waves were pounding on the shore.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 惊涛拍岸。</font><br>\n
pour	<h3>pour</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>涌出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After the meeting the people poured out in crowds.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 散会后人们成群地涌出来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The chimney was pouring out black smoke.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 烟囱里冒出滚滚黑烟。</font><br>倾; 倒<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was pouring all night.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 整夜下着倾盆大雨。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She poured a glass of water.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她倒了一杯水。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He poured me a cup of tea.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他给我倒了一杯茶。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Andy poured the glass full and lifted it to Bobby.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 安迪把杯子倒满举着送给鲍比。</font><br>\n
poverty	<h3>poverty</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>贫穷, 贫困<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They lived in poverty.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们生活在贫困之中。</font><br>缺少; 贫乏<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He showed his poverty in his knowledge of agriculture.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他表现出缺乏对农业知识的了解。</font><br>低劣; 劣质<br>\n
powder	<h3>powder</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>粉, 粉末<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The machine pounds the stones into powder.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这台机器把石头碾成粉末。</font><br>粉状物质<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is putting on powder, ready to perform on the stage.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在搽粉, 准备登台演出。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>在…搽粉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She powdered her face before going to dinner.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她去参加晚宴前往脸上搽了粉。</font><br>\n
power	<h3>power</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>权力, 势力; 影响力<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This country extends its power and influence into neighbouring countries.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个国家将其势力与影响扩大至邻国。</font><br>政权<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The new government will come into power next month.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 新政府将在下月开始执政。</font><br>职权<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The powers of a judge are defined by law.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 法官的权限是由法律规定的。</font><br>能力, 天赋; 体力, 力量<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We shall gladly lend every effort in our power toward its realization.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们很乐意在力所能及的范围内促使其实现。</font><br>功力, 动力, 功率<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The engine is being specially adapted to increase its power.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 正在对这台引擎进行改装以增加它的功率。</font><br>强国, 有权势的人[团体等]<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The future of the island is bound up with the fortunes of the ruling power.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个岛的前景与其掌权者的命运息息相关。</font><br>幂, 乘方<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How much is the sixth power of nine?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 九的六次幂是多少?</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>向…提供动力<br>\n
powerful	<h3>powerful</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>强健的, 强而有力的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Teacher is powerful in a child's eyes forever.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 老师在孩子们的心中永远是强者。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has powerful arms and legs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他四肢强健有力。</font><br>强大的, 作用大的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Electric current is often powerful enough to kill a man.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 电流常强得足以致命。</font><br>权力大的, 有势力的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Who is more powerful in your family?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在你家里谁权力更大?</font><br>\n
practical	<h3>practical</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>实际的, 实践的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He lacks practical experience.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他缺乏实践经验。</font><br>实用的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is studying practical English.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在学实用英语。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Your invention is clever, but not practical.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你的发明很巧, 但不实用。</font><br>注重实际的; 有实际工作能力的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is a practical person.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是位很讲实际的人。</font><br>\n
practically	<h3>practically</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>几乎; 简直<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She's practically always late for school.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她上学几乎总是迟到。</font><br>实际地, 实事求是地<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He solved the problem very practically.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他很实事求是地解决了这个问题。</font><br>\n
practice	<h3>practice</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>练习, 实习<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We have three football practices a week.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们每周练习三次足球。</font><br>实践, 实际<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In this way they can better apply theory to practice.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这样他们就能更好地把理论运用到实践中去。</font><br>(医生或律师的)业务; 诊所; 律师事务所<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has a large practice in London.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在伦敦的医务所有很多病人。</font><br>惯例, 常规<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can see that they are not ready to depart from traditional practice.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想他们不是真的背离传统习惯。</font><br>\n
practise	<h3>practise</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>练习; 实习<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You don't practise enough.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你练得不够。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He practises tennis every day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他每天练习打网球。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The girls are practising singing the new song in the next room.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 姑娘们正在隔壁练习唱新歌。</font><br>积极从事<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The man is just beginning to practise law.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 此人刚刚开始操律师业。</font><br>\n
praise	<h3>praise</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>称赞, 赞赏<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They have been praising you all the time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们总在夸奖你。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Critics praised the works as highly original.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 评论家称赞该作品独树一帜。</font><br>赞美; 颂扬; 崇拜<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was praised for his neat and careful work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他因工作认真、利索而受到赞扬。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>称赞, 赞美; 赞扬, 表扬<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let us give praise to God.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 让我们来赞美上帝吧。</font><br>崇拜; 荣耀<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He despised people who were lavish with their praises.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他看不起那些阿谀奉承的人。</font><br>赞美的话<br>\n
pray	<h3>pray</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>祈祷, 祷告<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They knelt down and prayed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们跪下祈祷。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We pray God's forgiveness.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们祈求上帝的宽恕。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He prayed to be forgiven.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他祈求宽恕。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We prayed that she would recover.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们为她尽快康复而祈祷。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>〈文或旧〉请求, 恳求<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Take great care, I pray you!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 要倍加小心, 我求你了！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We pray you to set the child free.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们恳求你放了这个孩子。</font><br>\n
prayer	<h3>prayer</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>祈祷, 祈祷文<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He says his prayers every night before he goes to bed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他每晚睡觉前都做晚祷。</font><br>祈祷(习惯)<br>\n
precaution	<h3>precaution</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>预防措施<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I took the precaution of locking money in the safe.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我把所有的钱都锁在保险箱里以防万一。</font><br>\n
preceding	<h3>preceding</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>(时间或地点上)在先的, 在前的, 前面的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The plots of this novel in the preceding chapters are so complicated that I couldn't follow them.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这本小说前几章的情节如此复杂, 以至于我都看不懂。</font><br>\n
precious	<h3>precious</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>宝贵的, 珍贵的, 贵重的, 珍爱的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has sent me most precious gifts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他送给我极其珍贵的礼物。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Each life is precious.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 生命都是宝贵的。</font><br>矫揉造作的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was a precious, old-fashioned lady in her 90's.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她是一个90多岁的、过分讲究的旧式老太太。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>〈口〉很, 非常<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Precious few people can afford prices like that.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 没有什么人出得起那个价钱。</font><br>\n
precise	<h3>precise</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>精确的, 准确的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A scientist must be precise in making tests.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 科学家做试验必须精确。</font><br>恰好的; 正是的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp At the precise moment that I put my foot on the step, the bus started.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 恰好就在我登上公共汽车台阶的时候, 车开动了。</font><br>周密的, 细密的, 精细的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A lawyer needs a precise mind.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 律师需要有周密的头脑。</font><br>\n
precision	<h3>precision</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>精确度, 准确(性)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Precision instruments are used to help pilots in guiding their aircraft.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 精密仪器用来帮助飞行员操作飞机。</font><br>\n
predict	<h3>predict</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>预言; 预测; 预示<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They predicted great things for the boy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们预言这孩子有出息。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I predicted their getting into trouble.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我料到他们会倒霉。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I cannot predict when to meet her again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我无法预测什么时候会再见到她。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She predicted that he would marry a doctor.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她预言他会同一位医生结婚。</font><br>\n
preface	<h3>preface</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>序言, 前言<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has written a fine preface to the play.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他为这个剧本写了一篇精彩的序言。</font><br>开端, 前奏<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>作为…的序言, 作为…的开端<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A short documentary prefaced the feature movie.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 故事片开始前放映了一部短纪录片。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Several pages of closely reasoned argument preface her account of the war.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她那部关于战争的著述之前有几页论证严谨的序言。</font><br>\n
