sandwich	<h3>sandwich</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>三明治<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp To make a ham sandwich you put a slice of ham between two slices of bread.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把一片火腿夹在两片面包之间就做成了火腿三明治。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>把…夹在…之间<br>挤在…中间<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was sandwiched between two very fat women on the bus.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在公共汽车上, 他被挤在两个胖女人中间。</font><br>\n
satellite	<h3>satellite</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>卫星<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The moon is a satellite of the earth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 月球是地球的一颗卫星。</font><br>人造卫星<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This space rocket carries two satellites.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这枚宇宙火箭搭载了两颗卫星。</font><br>卫星国, 附庸国, 卫星都市<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Economic activities of the satellite are closely geared to those of the central city.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 卫星城市的经济活动与中心城市息息相关。</font><br>\n
satisfaction	<h3>satisfaction</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>满意, 满足, 实现<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She laughed her satisfaction.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她以笑表示满意。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Swimming was one of her greatest satisfactions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 游泳是她最大的乐趣之一。</font><br>赔偿物, 补偿<br>\n
satisfactory	<h3>satisfactory</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>令人满意的, 符合要求的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Sales are very satisfactory this month.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 本月销售情况令人十分满意。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I hope this arrangement will be satisfactory to you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我希望这种安排会使你满意。</font><br>\n
satisfied	<h3>satisfied</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>满意的; 满足的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When she had finished her meal, she gave a satisfied smile.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当她吃完饭后, 她露出了满意的笑容。</font><br>\n
satisfy	<h3>satisfy</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>使满意; 满足<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Nothing can always satisfy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 没有任何东西能永远使人满足。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her father tried his best to satisfy her demands.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的父亲想尽一切办法来满足她的要求。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>使确信<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I satisfied them that there was no danger.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我使他们相信没有危险。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She satisfied herself that all doors were locked.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她确信门都锁上了。</font><br>符合, 达到(要求、规定、标准等)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can't vote until you have satisfied all the formal conditions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你要符合所有的正式条件后才能参加选举。</font><br>\n
Saturday	<h3>Saturday</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>星期六<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I hope to go shopping on Saturday next.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我希望在下星期六去购物。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He went abroad last Saturday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他上星期六到国外去了。</font><br>\n
sauce	<h3>sauce</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>调味汁, 酱汁<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The sauce tastes too sweet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这果酱味道太甜。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They've put vodka in her fruit juice to get her in the sauce.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们把伏特加酒倒进她的果汁以把她灌醉。</font><br>无礼的话, 顶撞的话<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I won't take any more of your sauce from now on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 从现在开始，我不会再忍受你那些无礼顶撞的话了。</font><br>\n
saucer	<h3>saucer</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>(放茶杯的)浅碟, 茶托; 茶碟<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A teacup should stand in a saucer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 茶杯应放在茶托上。</font><br>\n
sausage	<h3>sausage</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>香肠<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A kilogram of garlic sausage, please.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请给我一千克蒜肠。</font><br>\n
save	<h3>save</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>拯救, 挽救<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He saved her life ever.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他曾经救过她的命。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They could think of no way to save the situation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们想不出什么办法来挽救局势。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>储蓄, 贮存<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has never saved.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他从来不储蓄。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I saved part of my salary each month.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我每月把工资存起一部分。</font><br>节省<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I am going to take the bus to save money.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 为了省钱, 我打算乘公共汽车去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He had repaired my kettle, and it saved my buying a new one.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把我的水壶修好了, 省得我再买一个新的了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'll telephone and that will save me writing a letter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我会打电话，就不用写信了。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>(足球等)阻碍对方得分的动作, 救球<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>prep.&conj.</i></font><br>除了<br>\n
saving	<h3>saving</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>节约, 节俭<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It will be a saving to take a short cut.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 走捷径能节省时间。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We can make big savings on fuel through greater efficiency.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们可通过提高效率大量节省燃料。</font><br>储蓄金, 存款<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Bob took his savings out of the bank to buy a bicycle.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 鲍勃从银行取出存款去买自行车。</font><br>挽救, 搭救<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They have thought out the effective saving.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们已想出挽救的办法。</font><br>\n
saw	<h3>saw</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>锯<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A carpenter's tools include saws, hammers, and screw-drivers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 木工的工具包括锯子、锤子和旋凿。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>锯<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp John is sawing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 约翰正在锯东西。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Would you like to saw a tree for me?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你能为我锯棵树吗?</font><br>往复移动<br>\n
say	<h3>say</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>说; 讲<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You may well say so.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你完全可以这么说。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He glared angrily at her but did not say a word.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他怒视着她, 却一言不发。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He said that he had never been to Tokyo.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他说他从来没去过东京。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>说明; 表明; 宣称<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What do these figures say?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些数字说明了什么?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I will say how to use it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我将说明如何使用它。</font><br>比方说; 假定说<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is said that there has been a big flood.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 据说, 那里遭受了一场大洪水的袭击。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>决定权, 发言权<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He wasn't allowed much say in choosing his holiday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在选择假期的问题上不让他有很多发言权。</font><br>\n
saying	<h3>saying</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>说话<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Saying and doing are two things.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 说和做是两码事。</font><br>话; 言语; 言论<br>谚语; 格言, 名言<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “There's no smoke without fire”, as the saying goes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 常言道：“无风不起浪。”</font><br>\n
scale	<h3>scale</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>鱼鳞, 鳞片<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Scales of skin peel off after scarlet fever.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 猩红热病愈后皮肤上的鳞屑就会脱落。</font><br>鳞状物; 障眼物<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The doctor removed the scale from his eyes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 医生除去了他眼中的障眼物。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His explanations removed the scale from my eyes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的解释使我看清了真相。</font><br>水垢, 水锈<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A scale of rust covered the steel plate.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一层铁锈覆盖了钢板。</font><br>刻度, 度数<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This ruler has only one scale in centimeters.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这把尺只有厘米刻度。</font><br>比例(尺)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The scale of this map is an inch to a mile.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这张地图的比例尺是一英寸代表一英里。</font><br>规模; 程度; 范围<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He's in business on a small scale.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他做的是小本生意。</font><br>等级; 级别<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp For every year you've worked here you go up another step on the salary scale.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你在这儿每工作一年, 工资就会长一级。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His rapid ascent in the social scale was surprising.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的社会地位提高之迅速令人吃惊。</font><br>天平, 磅秤<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The butcher weighed the meat on the scales.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 肉贩用盘秤称肉。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>刮去…的鳞片[鳞状物]<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You have to scale the fish before cooking it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你在烧鱼之前得刮去鳞片。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The plaster is scaling off the wall.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 灰泥从墙上剥落。</font><br>称…的重量<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The fish scales 2 pounds.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这条鱼重两磅。</font><br>攀登, 爬<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The boys soon scaled the wall.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 男孩很快就爬上了墙头。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They are determined to spare no efforts to scale the peaks in science and technology.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们决心全力攀登科技高峰。</font><br>\n
scan	<h3>scan</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>细查, 审视, 观测, 严密监视<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The detective scanned every bit of evidence.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 侦探仔细检查了每一样证据。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She scanned his face to see if he was telling the truth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她审视着他的脸, 看他讲的是否是真话。</font><br>浏览<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I scanned the newspaper for the information I needed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我浏览报纸寻找自己需要的信息。</font><br>〈计〉扫描<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This apparatus scans patients' brains for tumours.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这台仪器扫描检查病人的脑瘤。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>扫描<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The first scan was bad, so I had to do it again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 第一次扫描不好, 所以我得重做。</font><br>\n
scandal	<h3>scandal</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>丑事, 丑闻<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's a scandal for a city official to take tax money for his own use.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一个市政官员将税款挪为己用是一则丑闻。</font><br>流言蜚语; 闲话; 诽谤<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I heard a bit of scandal about your friend.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我听到一点儿关于你朋友的流言。</font><br>公愤; 反感<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His theft from the shop caused scandal in the village.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他因偷商店的东西引起全村的公愤。</font><br>\n
scanner	<h3>scanner</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>检测装置; 扫描设备; 扫描器<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Using a scanner, we can look at the unborn foetus.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们用扫描器可以观察未出生的胎儿。</font><br>\n
scarce	<h3>scarce</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>缺乏的, 罕见的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The food was scarce during the war.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 战争期间食物短缺。</font><br>\n
scarcely	<h3>scarcely</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>仅仅; 几乎不<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We scarcely have time for breakfast.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们几乎没有吃早饭的时间。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Scarcely do I know him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我同他不那么熟。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We've scarcely any money left.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们几乎一点钱不剩。</font><br>决不<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can scarcely expect me to believe that.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别以为我相信那件事。</font><br>\n
scare	<h3>scare</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>恐吓; 使惊恐<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't let the noise scare you; it's only the wind.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别让那声音把你吓住, 那不过是风声罢了。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>受惊吓, 感到害怕<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>惊恐, 惊吓<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The sound of the explosion gave me quite a scare.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 爆炸声把我吓了一跳。</font><br>(社会上的)大恐慌<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There's been quite a scare about the possible side effects of this new drug.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种新药可能产生的副作用造成了相当大的恐慌。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>吓人的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I like reading scare stories.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我喜欢读恐怖故事。</font><br>\n

scene	<h3>scene</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>(戏剧的)一场, (电影、电视的)一个镜头, (小说的)一节<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They have added a new scene at the beginning.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在开头他们又增加了一场戏。</font><br>背景, 现场<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has designed all the scenes and costumes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他设计了全部布景和服装。</font><br>地点<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The murder suspect couldn't explain away his fingerprints at the scene.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个杀人嫌疑犯解释不清为什么在杀人现场会留有他的指纹。</font><br>景色, 景象<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We climbed higher so that we might see the scenes better.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们又往高处爬以便能更好地观看这景色。</font><br>发脾气, 吵闹<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She doesn't like to make a scene before strangers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当着生人的面, 她不愿大吵大闹。</font><br>\n
scenery	<h3>scenery</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>风景, 景色<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The grassland scenery of Tibet is unrivalled.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 西藏的草原风景是无与伦比的。</font><br>舞台布景<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The scenery for the play must have cost too much.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那出戏的舞台布景一定很费钱。</font><br>\n
schedule	<h3>schedule</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>排定, 安排<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The secretary is trying to schedule the month's appointments.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 秘书正在设法安排这个月的约会。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>时间表, 日程安排表<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Have you made the examination schedule?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你已经安排了考试日程吗?</font><br>清单, 明细表<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Retailers have several price schedules.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 零售商们有几份价格明细表。</font><br>\n
scheme	<h3>scheme</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>策划; 图谋<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They schemed out a new method of bridge building.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们设计了一种新的造桥方法。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The enemies are scheming her downfall.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 敌人正在策划使她垮台。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They were scheming to rob the bank.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们在密谋抢劫银行。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>阴谋, 诡计<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She has a lot of schemes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她有很多诡计。</font><br>计划, 方案<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When you began to work, you might work out a practical scheme.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当你开始工作之前, 你可以先制定出一个可行的计划。</font><br>\n
scholar	<h3>scholar</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>奖学金获得者<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was a British Council scholar.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她是英国文化协会奖学金的获得者。</font><br>学者<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He will certainly make a scholar.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他肯定会成为一个学者。</font><br>\n
scholarship	<h3>scholarship</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>学问, 学识<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is a book that displays the considerable scholarship of its author.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是一本表现作者重大学术成就的书。</font><br>奖学金<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She won a scholarship to go to university.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她获得了上大学的奖学金。</font><br>\n
school	<h3>school</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>学校<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The students in middle schools should build up a solid foundation in English.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 中学生学习英语时应打下牢固的基础。</font><br>上学; 学业; 上课(时间)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He finished school.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他完成了学业。</font><br>(大学里的)学院<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He went to the school of law for three years.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在法学院读了三年。</font><br>学派, 流派<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There are different schools of thought on the best method of growing tomatoes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 关于种植西红柿的最佳方法有几派不同的意见。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>训练; 磨炼<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This politician has shown that he has been well schooled in foreign languages.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这位政治家表现出了他受过良好的外语训练。</font><br>控制某人[动物]<br>\n

science	<h3>science</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>科学, 科学研究<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This discovery is highly appreciated in the circle of science.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个发现在科学界得到很高的评价。</font><br>学科<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm beyond my depth when it comes to natural sciences.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 谈到自然学科我就茫然。</font><br>\n
scientific	<h3>scientific</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>科学的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His whole life is dedicated to scientific research.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他毕生致力于科学研究。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This study is not scientific.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种研究不科学。</font><br>\n
scientist	<h3>scientist</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>科学家<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He approached the question as a scientist.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他以一个科学家的眼光去处理这个问题。</font><br>\n
scissors	<h3>scissors</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>剪刀<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He took a pair of scissors and cut her hair.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他拿起一把剪刀给她剪发。</font><br>\n
scold	<h3>scold</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>责骂, 斥责<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is always scolding.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她总是骂个不停。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't scold the child.It's not his fault.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别责怪那孩子, 那不是他的过错。</font><br>\n
scope	<h3>scope</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>余地, 机会<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is little scope for initiative in this job.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这工作几乎没有发挥主动性的余地。</font><br>(处理、研究事务的)范围<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Such subjects are not within the scope of this book.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这样的问题不在本书的讨论范围之内。</font><br>\n
score	<h3>score</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>二十<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I walked a score of miles.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我走了二十英里。</font><br>画线, 刻痕<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There were scores all over the kitchen table.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 厨房的桌子上到处都是刻痕。</font><br>得分, 分数<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His goal leveled the scores of the two teams.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的进球把两队的得分拉平了。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>得分<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The home team didn't score.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 主队没得分。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We scored a point.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们赢了一分。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The Japanese judge scored him 15.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那位日本裁判判给他15分。</font><br>获胜; 成功<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We had a bad play, but we scored.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们踢得不好, 但却获胜了。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>记分<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Will you score?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你来记分好吗?</font><br>\n
scout	<h3>scout</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>侦察员[机, 舰]<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The scouts are watching out for enemy patrols.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 侦察员提防着敌人的巡逻队。</font><br>童子军<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is a Boy Scout.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是男童子军成员。</font><br>搜索, 侦察<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They stopped scout in the mountainous area.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们停止了在那山区的侦察活动。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>寻找; 侦察<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A party was sent ahead to scout.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一个小组被派去侦察。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jet fighters scout the skies.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 喷气式战斗机在空中侦察巡逻。</font><br>\n
scrape	<h3>scrape</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>刮, 擦<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was so windy that the branches were scraping against the window panes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 风很大, 树枝在玻璃窗上拂来拂去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He scraped his boots clean before coming into the house.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 进屋前他先把靴子擦干净。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>擦伤<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The car scraped its side against the wall.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汽车的车身在墙上擦坏了。</font><br>设法得到<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We managed to scrape an audience of fifty people.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们设法争取到了五十名观众。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>刮, 擦, 刮擦声<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He pushed back his chair with a loud scrape.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “嘎”的一声, 他把椅子推回了原位。</font><br>擦痕, 擦伤<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How did you get a few scrapes on your knee?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你膝盖上的几处擦伤是怎么弄的?</font><br>困境, 麻烦<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She gets into these silly scrapes because she doesn't think before she acts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在行动之前总不思考, 所以才会陷入这种荒唐的窘境。</font><br>\n
scratch	<h3>scratch</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>抓, 搔<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The dog is always scratching.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那只狗老是搔痒。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has a curious habit of scratching his ear while he speaks.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他有一种奇怪的习惯, 一讲话就搔耳朵。</font><br>刮伤<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The brambles scratched my legs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 荆棘刺伤了我的双腿。</font><br>勾掉, 删掉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I hope you are not going to scratch me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我希望你不会把我的名字从比赛中划去。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>抓; 搔痒<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His dog just gives a scratch at the door when it wants to come in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的狗想进来时就用爪子抓门。</font><br>抓痕, 抓伤<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her face was covered with scratches.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她脸上有很多划痕。</font><br>刮擦声<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I heard the scratches on the old records.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我听到旧唱片的沙沙声。</font><br>\n
scream	<h3>scream</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>发出尖叫声<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She screamed when she saw the robber.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她看到强盗时尖叫了起来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He screamed to go with you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他大声嚷着要跟你一起去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A newsboy was screaming an extra.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一个报童正在尖声叫卖号外。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She screamed that there was a snake under the bed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她大声喊叫床下有蛇。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The child screamed himself red in the face.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个孩子尖叫得脸都红了。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>尖叫, 尖叫声<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her loud screams could be heard all over the house.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 整个屋子都能听到她那高声的尖叫。</font><br>极其可笑的人[事物]<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He's an absolute scream in our friends.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在我的朋友中他是个滑稽透顶的人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She thought it was an absolute scream when I fell off my chair.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她认为我从椅子上摔下来是一件极其滑稽可笑的事情。</font><br>\n
screen	<h3>screen</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>屏风, 帘, 纱窗<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The picture on this screen is a good artistic work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这屏风上的画是件很好的艺术品。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Close the screen or the flies will get into the house.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把纱门关起来, 不然苍蝇会飞进屋来。</font><br>掩护物<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They hid behind the screen of bushes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们躲在灌木丛后。</font><br>屏幕<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can see him on the TV screen quite often.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你可以经常从电视屏幕上见到他。</font><br>银幕; 荧光屏<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She first appeared on the screen ten years ago.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 十年前, 她第一次出现在银幕上。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>遮蔽, 掩护<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A floppy hat screened her face.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一顶有边的软帽遮住了她的脸。</font><br>放映(电影), 播放(电视节目)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The film has been screened in the cinema.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这部电影已在电影院放映。</font><br>审查, 甄选<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Unsuitable candidates were screened out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那些不合格的候选人被筛选掉了。</font><br>\n
screw	<h3>screw</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>螺丝钉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The handle of this door is kept by two screws.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这扇门的把手用两枚螺丝钉固定。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>用螺丝拧紧<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Squeaking floorboards should be screwed down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 踏上去咯咯作响的地板应用螺钉钉住。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The table legs are screwed to the floor.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 桌子腿用螺钉固定在地板上。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>旋, 扭; 拧<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The two pieces screw together easily.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这两个部件很容易拧紧。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let's screw the two pipes together end to end.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 咱们把这两根管子接起来拧紧。</font><br>\n
script	<h3>script</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>剧本, 脚本, 讲稿<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The script was delivered to the director ahead of schedule.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 剧本被提前送到了导演手中。</font><br>笔迹<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's easy to identify his script.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的笔迹容易辨认。</font><br>文字<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is a letter in Cyrillic script.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是西里尔文字。</font><br>\n

search	<h3>search</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>搜索, 寻找, 探查<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The lost book came to light after a long search.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 经过一段长时间的寻找, 那本遗失的书被找到了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The soldiers were carrying out house-to-house searches.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 士兵们正在挨门逐户地搜查。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>找寻<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We searched here and there, but could not find her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们到处找她, 但还是找不到。</font><br>搜查; 搜索; 探查<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What right have you to break in here and search?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你们有什么权利闯进来搜查?</font><br>\n
seashell	<h3>seashell</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>海中软体动物的壳, 贝壳<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My children love collecting seashells.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的孩子们喜欢收集贝壳。</font><br>\n
seaside	<h3>seaside</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>海滨, 海边<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let's go to the seaside at the weekend!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 让我们到海滨去度周末吧！</font><br>\n
season	<h3>season</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>季(节)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The seasons change, independent of anyone's wishes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 四季变化不受任何人约束。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The spring-sowing season has set in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 春耕季节到来了。</font><br>时期; 活动期, 季<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When does the basketball season end?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 篮球赛季什么时候结束?</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>使适应; 使适用<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The soldiers were not yet seasoned to the rigorous climate.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 士兵们尚未能适应此种严寒的气候。</font><br>调味<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He likes to eat mutton which was seasoned with garlic.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他喜欢吃用大蒜调味的羊肉。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使)变干燥<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Timber seasons quickly in the wind.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 木材在风里干得很快。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The carpenter taught us how to season wood.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这位木匠教我们怎样对木材进行干燥处理。</font><br>\n
seat	<h3>seat</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>坐席, 座位<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We were using crates as seats.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们用大木箱作为座位。</font><br>所在地, 场所; 中心<br>席位, 职位<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She won a seat in Parliament at the election.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在选举中赢得了议会中的席位。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>使就座<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The usher seated us in the front row.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 引座员让我们在前排就座。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She seated herself on the table.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她坐在桌子上。</font><br>使就职<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The Queen of that country was seated last year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个国家的女王是去年登基的。</font><br>可容纳若干座位<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The theatre seats 2000 persons.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 剧院能容纳两千人。</font><br>\n

second	<h3>second</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>第二名; 第二类<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our team gets a second.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们队得了第二名。</font><br>第二份食物<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He quickly ate everything on his plate and asked for seconds.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他很快地把他盘里的东西吃光, 然后又要第二份。</font><br>助手, 助理<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is needless to add that you are in want of a second.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你需要一个助手, 那是不必说的。</font><br>秒<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The average flow of the river is 200 cubic metres per second.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这条河平均流量为每秒二百立方米。</font><br>瞬间, 一会儿<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He said he will be back in a few seconds.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他说他一会儿就回来。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>pron.</i></font><br>第二(个人或事物)<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>num.</i></font><br>第二<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Osaka is the second largest city in Japan.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大阪是日本第二大城市。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>次等的, 次要的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We never use second quality ingredients to build building.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们决不使用次等材料用于建筑。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>其次, 以第二位<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I liked the deluxe edition, but I could afford only a second best.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我喜欢精装版, 但我只买得起一本稍差一点的。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>支持<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Will you second me if I ask him?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 要是我求他, 你会帮我讲话吗?</font><br>赞成某提案<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I seconded the nomination.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我赞成这一任命。</font><br>\n
secondary	<h3>secondary</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>次要的, 次等的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's a question of secondary importance.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是个次要的问题。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All other considerations are secondary to his safety.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 现在首先要考虑的是他的安全, 其他事均是次要的。</font><br>中级的, 第二的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Secondary school means junior school and high school.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 中学是指初中和高中。</font><br>\n

secretary	<h3>secretary</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>秘书<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It takes a new secretary one month to break in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 新来的秘书要一个月的时间熟悉工作。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is secretary to the minister.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她是部长的秘书。</font><br>书记<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The General Secretary of the Party noted down the details of the plan.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 党的总书记把这个方案的细节都记下来了。</font><br>部长, 大臣<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The President confirmed him as the Secretary of State.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 总统任命他为国务卿。</font><br>\n
section	<h3>section</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>章节<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The chapter falls into three sections.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这一章共分三节。</font><br>部分<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A Reading Practice section is added to each unit in Book Two.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在第二册书里每个单元都加上了阅读练习部分。</font><br>部门, 科<br>截面, 剖面<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This illustration shows a vertical section through the locust.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 本图所示为蝗虫的纵剖面。</font><br>地区, 区<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I will go to the shopping sections of the city.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我要去城市的商业区。</font><br>\n
sector	<h3>sector</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>部门; 领域<br>防御地区, 防卫区域<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The enemy have attacked the British sector.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 敌人已进攻英国防区。</font><br>扇形, 扇形面<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The sector dam broke and its water drowned the entire valley.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 扇形水坝倒塌了, 水淹没了整个山谷。</font><br>\n
secure	<h3>secure</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>牢固的; 可靠的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That is a secure foothold.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那是一可靠的落脚点。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Foreign tourists feel happily secure while visiting the city.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 外国游客访问这个城市时都很有安全感。</font><br>有把握的; 确切的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Your future in the company is secure.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你在公司的前途有保证。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>握紧; 关牢<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Secure the prisoner so that he won't escape again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 严密监禁那个囚犯以免他再逃掉。</font><br>使安全<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The regiment secured its position while awaiting the enemy attack.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 该团在等待敌人进攻之时, 加强了防御工事。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He will secure that there will be no difficulty.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他将保证不再出现任何困难。</font><br>(使)获得; 把…弄到手<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We have secured a first-class cook.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们已经请到了一位第一流的厨师。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you secure me two good seats for the concert?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你能为我弄到两张音乐会好座位的票吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please secure a ticket for me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请替我弄张票。</font><br>\n
security	<h3>security</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>安全<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They lulled her into a false sense of security.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们哄骗她, 使她产生一种虚假的安全感。</font><br>抵押品<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He gave the house as a security.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他以房子作抵押。</font><br>有价证券<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When Mr. Green mentioned government securities, they came alive.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 格林先生一提到政府证券, 他们的精神就为之一振。</font><br>\n
see	<h3>see</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>看见; 观看, 参见<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's so dark; I can't see.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这么黑, 我看不见。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I looked but saw nobody.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我看了一下, 但没有看见任何人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They saw the job had been done.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们看到工作已经做了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I am delighted to see all so happy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 看见大家这么快乐我很高兴。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I saw her face go pale.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我看见她的脸变苍白了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I saw her lying there.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我看见她躺在那儿。</font><br>领会, 理解<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I see, you are on leave.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我明白了, 你是在休假。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you see my point?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你能明白我的观点吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We don't see where to get assistance.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们不知道到何处求助。</font><br>考虑; 想想<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let me see, what date are they leaving?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 让我想想, 他们是什么时候动身的?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I saw the box as empty.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想这盒子是空的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don't see (it) good to tell you all my plans.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我认为把我的计划都告诉你是不合适的。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>访问; 会见, 遇见<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm glad to see you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 遇到你很高兴。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I will come and see if it is true.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我要来了解一下, 是否真有其事。</font><br>务必做到; 保证<br>发生; 经历; 经受<br>陪伴, 护送<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let's go and see a good picture.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 让我们去看部好电影。</font><br>\n
seed	<h3>seed</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>种子<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The farmers are scattering seed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 农夫们在播种。</font><br>种子选手<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The younger Williams is the top seed at Wimbledon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 小威廉姆斯是温布尔登网球公开赛的头号种子选手。</font><br>子孙, 后裔<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>播种<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They seeded the field with wheat.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们在这块地里种下了小麦。</font><br>除去…之种子<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Seed the cherries before you put them in the pie.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 樱桃去籽之后才能做馅饼。</font><br>抽出种子选手<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm afraid he hasn't been seeded.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 恐怕他没有被选为种子选手吧。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>结籽<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Some plants will not seed in a cold climate.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有些植物在寒冷的气候条件下不能结果实。</font><br>\n
seek	<h3>seek</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>寻找; 探寻<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We sought long and hard but found no answer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们作了长期的艰苦探索, 但没有找到答案。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The police are still seeking the men involved in last week's robbery.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警察仍在寻找跟上星期的抢劫案有牵连的人。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>企图; 试图<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I sought to change her mind.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我试图改变她的心意。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>请求, 征求; 求教<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He went to seek his lawyer's advice.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他去请教律师。</font><br>\n
seem	<h3>seem</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>link v.</i></font><br>好像; 仿佛<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He certainly didn't seem to be a fool.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他当然不像是个傻瓜。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She seems a clever girl.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她好像是个聪明的姑娘。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The baby seems to be asleep.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那婴孩好像是睡着了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He seemed disappointed when the man refused his request.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当那个人拒绝了他的要求时他看起来很失望。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He seems to think so.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他似乎认为如此。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The main streets seemed shining in the sun.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在阳光照射下, 大街似乎闪闪发光。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It seems that you are lying.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 看来你在撒谎。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It seems to me that Peter has seen nothing of life.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在我看来, 彼得还不懂人情世故。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It seems as if you are the first one here.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 看起来你是第一个来这儿的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It seemed a pity to refuse.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 拒绝似乎是可惜的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There seems no need to go now.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 好像没有必要现在就去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There seems to be a misunderstanding between us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们之间好像有些误解。</font><br>\n
seemingly	<h3>seemingly</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>看来似乎, 表面上看<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Seemingly, we can do nothing to prevent this from happening.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们似乎没有什么办法阻止这件事发生。</font><br>\n
segment	<h3>segment</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>部分, 片段<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The company dominates this segment of the market.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这家公司控制着这一部分市场。</font><br>瓣<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is eating oranges in segments.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他正在一瓣瓣地吃橘子。</font><br>\n
seize	<h3>seize</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>抓住, 捉住<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Gill seized my hand and shook it heartily.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 吉尔突然抓住我的手, 热情地和我握手。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>夺取; 占领<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The following day mobs seized the Parliament building.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 第二天暴徒占领了议会大厦。</font><br>\n
seldom	<h3>seldom</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>很少, 罕见, 难得<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp On Sundays, he seldom stays in the house.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 星期天他很少待在房子里。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Seldom have I heard such beautiful singing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我很少听到过如此美妙的歌声。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is seldom that it rains in such a time in winter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在冬天这个时候很少下雨。</font><br>\n
select	<h3>select</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>选择; 挑选<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They selected a diamond engagement ring.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们挑选了一枚钻石订婚戒指。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Which place in the world would you select as your perfect home?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你选择世界上的什么地方作为你最理想的安家之地呢?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We selected her to represent us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们选她作为我们的代表。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>精选的, 挑选出来的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The captain needs a select crew for this dangerous voyage.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 船长需要一批精选的水手来作此危险的航行。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The book is a select collection of poetry from various authors.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这本书是各家诗作的集锦。</font><br>限制性的, 选择严格的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That school is very select.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那所学校招生非常严格。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was very select in people she invites.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她邀请的客人都要经过严格挑选。</font><br>\n
selection	<h3>selection</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>选择, 挑选<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We left the selection of the team to the captain.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们把挑选队员的工作交给了队长。</font><br>被挑选的人[事物]; 选萃, 选集<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These are selections from ten thousand.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些是从一万个里挑选出来的。</font><br>可供选择的东西<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The shop has a fine selection of cheeses.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那家商店有各种精美乳酪可供选购。</font><br>\n
self	<h3>self</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>自己, 自我, 自身<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He put his whole self into the job, working night and day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他夜以继日地把全部身心都投入那项工作中。</font><br>本性, 本质; 个人的健康状况<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We call the good and bad sides of our personality our better and worse selves.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们把人格的好坏两面称为人性中善良和邪恶的一面。</font><br>私利, 私心<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They have no thought of selves.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们没有私心。</font><br>本人; 签票人<br>\n
selfish	<h3>selfish</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>自私的, 利己的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is a selfish person.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她是一个自私自利的人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You must learn to share and not be so selfish.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你一定要学会与他人分享, 不要那么自私。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He's too selfish to think of lending me his car.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是一个自私的人, 不想把汽车借给我。</font><br>\n
sell	<h3>sell</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>卖; 售; 销<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Merchants buy and sell.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 商人买进卖出。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>经销; 推销<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He sells vacuum cleaners.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他经销真空吸尘器。</font><br>出卖, 背叛<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He would rather die than sell his companies.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他宁死也不愿出卖自己的同伴。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>卖, 销售<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Would you like a career in sell?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你愿意干销售这一行吗?</font><br>欺骗; 失望<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can't you see it is a sell?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 难道你看不出这是欺骗吗?</font><br>\n
semester	<h3>semester</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>(尤指美国的大专院校的)学期<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A student will probably attend four or five courses during each semester.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 每个学生一学期可能要修四五门课程。</font><br>\n
semiconductor	<h3>semiconductor</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>〈物〉半导体<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is a semiconductor integrated circuit.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是一个半导体集成电路。</font><br>\n
seminar	<h3>seminar</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>研讨班, 研讨小组<br>\n
senator	<h3>senator</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>参议员<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is one of the senators who signed last week's resolution.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是签署上周决议的参议员之一。</font><br>\n
send	<h3>send</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>送, 寄; 派遣<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I have thought about it; I'll send you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我考虑过了, 我将派你去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was asked to send a telegram.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他被叫去送一封电报了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He sent word that he would not be able to come.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他给我捎信说, 他不能来了。</font><br>使…猛然[迅速]移动<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>用无线电波发送; 发出信息<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Just before I left Singapore, I sent them a telegram.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在离开新加坡前我给他们发了一封电报。</font><br>\n
senior	<h3>senior</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>年长的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is a senior patient.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她是一位高龄患者。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Smith is senior to me by three years.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 史密斯比我大三岁。</font><br>资深的; 地位高的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is a senior member of the committee.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是一名资深的委员。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is senior to me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是我的上司。</font><br>〈美〉最高年级的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They are senior students.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们是高年级学生。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>较年长者<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He's my senior by three years.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他比我大三岁。</font><br>高年级学生<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was my senior at school.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是我上一届的学生。</font><br>〈美〉毕业班学生<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The seniors are planning to have a gathering.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些毕业班学生计划聚会一次。</font><br>\n
sense	<h3>sense</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>官能, 感官<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm afraid I haven't got a very good sense of direction, so I easily get lost.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 恐怕我的方向感很差, 因此我容易迷路。</font><br>辨别, 领悟, 感觉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has a sense that somone is standing behind him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他有一种有人站在他后面的那种感觉。</font><br>识别力; 常识; 见识<br>健全的心智; 思维能力; 理性<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He had the good sense to realize that the plan would never work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他很明智, 知道这项计划绝对行不通。</font><br>道理; 目的<br>意义, 意思<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This word can be used in several senses.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个词可以有几种解释。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>感觉到; 意识到; 发觉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He sensed her disapproval.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他察觉到她不赞成。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I sense that you would rather not go.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我觉得你最好还是别走。</font><br>\n
sensible	<h3>sensible</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>明智的, 合情理的, 切合实际的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That seems to be a sensible idea.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那似乎是个明智的主意。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was very sensible of you to bring your umbrella.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你带雨伞很明智。</font><br>可感觉到的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There's been a sensible rise in temperature recently.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 最近温度明显上升了。</font><br>觉察到某事物<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Are you sensible of the dangers of your position?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你觉察到你处境中的危险了吗?</font><br>\n
sensitive	<h3>sensitive</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>易受伤害的, 易损坏的; 易受影响的; 敏感的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The cost is not sensitive to the batch size.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 价格不因整批尺寸的变化而发生波动。</font><br>易生气的; 感情容易冲动的; 神经质的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't be so sensitive—I wasn't criticizing you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别这么神经质——我不是在批评你。</font><br>〈褒〉有细腻感情的; 同情理解的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is a sensitive friend of mine.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是我的一个体贴人的朋友。</font><br>(指仪器等)灵敏的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This experiment needs a more sensitive thermometer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个试验需要一个灵敏度较高的温度计。</font><br>需要小心处理(以免引起麻烦或冒犯)的, 敏感的, 微妙的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is such a sensitive issue that perhaps the press should not be told.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是个十分敏感的问题, 恐怕不该让新闻界得知。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He's very sensitive about his ugly appearance.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他对自己丑陋的外貌很敏感。</font><br>\n
sentence	<h3>sentence</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>句子<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We can sum up the main point of the lesson in three sentences.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们可以用三句话来概括本课要点。</font><br>宣判, 判决<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The judge imposed a stiff sentence.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 法官做出了严厉的判决。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>宣判; 判决<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The judge sentenced him to do hard labour.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 法官判他服劳役。</font><br>\n
separate	<h3>separate</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>分开, 隔离<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When did they separate last night?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 昨晚他们什么时候分开的?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The war separated many families.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 战争使许多家庭离散。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>不同的, 个别的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He sold his birds separately to separate buyers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把他的鸟儿分别卖给不同的买主。</font><br>单独的, 各自的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They sit in separate seats.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们都坐在各自的座位上。</font><br>分开的, 不相连的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Are they joined together or separate?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 它们是合在一起还是分开的?</font><br>\n
September	<h3>September</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>九月<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our school will begin on Sept.3.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们学校将在九月三日开学。</font><br>\n
sequence	<h3>sequence</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>有关联的一组事物, 一连串<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He had to attend a sequence of meetings.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他得参加一系列会议。</font><br>先后次序, 顺序, 连续<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The paintings are exhibited in chronological sequence.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些画是按创作的时间顺序展出的。</font><br>\n
series	<h3>series</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>连续的同类事物, 系列<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She attended all the lectures in the series.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这一系列的演讲她全听了。</font><br>串联<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is called series circuits in physics.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 它在物理学上被称为串联电路。</font><br>\n
serious	<h3>serious</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>严重的, 非同小可<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her daughter was mute after a serious illness.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的女儿在一场重病之后失去了说话能力。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The company is in serious financial difficulties.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这家公司陷入严重的财政困难。</font><br>认真的; 真诚的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Buying a house is a serious matter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 买房是一件需要认真考虑的事。</font><br>严肃的, 庄重的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I want to have a serious talk with you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想要与你郑重其事地谈一谈。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You look very serious today, is anything wrong?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你今天看上去挺严肃的, 有什么事吗?</font><br>\n
servant	<h3>servant</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>仆人, 佣人<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The master left his money with a trusty servant.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 主人把他的钱交给一个可靠的仆人保管。</font><br>雇员, 公务人员<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is a trusted servant of the company.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是公司里可靠的雇员。</font><br>\n
serve	<h3>serve</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(为…)服务; 任(职)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The manager of the restaurant has trained the waitress to serve correctly at table.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 饭馆的经理训练过那位女服务员如何正确地招待顾客。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Computers have also begun serving agriculture.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 计算机也开始为农业服务了。</font><br>提供, 端上<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The company will serve a meal at noon to all staff workers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 该公司将为所有职员提供午餐。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>向…供应<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The restaurant serves nice food.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这家饭馆供应的饭菜不错。</font><br>度过(某段时间)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She served two years in prison for theft.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她因偷窃服了两年刑。</font><br>\n
service	<h3>service</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>服务, 接待<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We flatter ourselves that we provide the best service in town.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们相信我们提供的服务在本市最好。</font><br>公共机构, 政府部门; 业务<br>服役; 任职<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is the obligation of citizens to perform military service.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 服兵役是每个公民的义务。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>检修<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The mechanic serviced our automobile.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 机械师把我们的汽车修好了。</font><br>向…提供服务<br>支付…的利息<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Some of these countries are no longer able to service their massive loans.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些国家中有些不再有能力支付巨额贷款的利息。</font><br>\n
session	<h3>session</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>(尤指法庭、议会等)开庭, 开会<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They will go into secret session.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们将召开秘密会议。</font><br>学年<br>学期<br>(进行某活动连续的)一段时间<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is a recording session.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是一段录音的时间。</font><br>长老会的管理机构<br>\n
set	<h3>set</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>放, 搁置<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He set a cup on the table.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把一个杯子放在桌上。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She set the food and drink before the guests.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把食物和饮料放在客人面前。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>(日、月等)落, 下沉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp As the sun set, the shadows lengthened.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 随着太阳的下山, 影子变长了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It will be cooler when the sun has set.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 太阳落山之后会凉快一点。</font><br>(植物)结子, 结果<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>(一)套, (一)副<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This set of the furniture is very good.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这套家具非常好。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These sets of machines were out of date.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这几套机器过时了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I want one more stamp to complete my set.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我再有一枚邮票就凑成一套了。</font><br>收音机; 电视机<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Do you want to buy a television set?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你想买电视机吗?</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>固定的; 指定的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Are you all set for the journey?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你们都为旅行准备好了吗?</font><br>不变的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is set in his opinions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他固执己见。</font><br>\n
setting	<h3>setting</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>镶嵌; 镶嵌底座<br>环境<br>(某事、戏剧、小说等的)背景<br>装置、机器等定的速度, 高度, 温度等<br>(为诗等谱写的)乐曲<br>(日、月等)下落<br>\n
settle	<h3>settle</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>安排; 安放; 安家, 定居<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Their ancestry settled the land in 1856.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们的祖辈1856年在这块土地上定居下来。</font><br>(使)安定<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The city settled when the rebels left.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 叛乱分子离开后, 这个城市平静下来了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The music will settle my disordered brain.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 音乐会使我纷乱的思绪得到安定。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The nurse settled her patient for the night.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那位护士使她的病人安静过夜。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>解决; 决定; 调停<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She has decided how she should settle the matter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她已做出决定如何来了解这件事。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp And a word from him would settle everything.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 只要他说一句话, 一切问题就解决了。</font><br>支付, 结算<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The account is not yet settled.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这笔账尚未付清。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We have to settle the gas bill.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们得付煤气费。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>(鸟等)栖息<br>\n
settlement	<h3>settlement</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>解决, 和解, 协议<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The terms of settlement seem just.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 和解的条件似乎是公道的。</font><br>移民<br>移居地, 新住宅区<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He took up his settlement in a new house.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在新屋居住下来。</font><br>〈律〉金钱或财产的转让(契约); 转让的金钱或财产<br>结算, 清偿<br>\n
