stake	<h3>stake</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>桩, 柱<br>刑柱<br>股份, 利害关系<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>用桩支撑<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He staked newly planted trees.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他用木桩子撑住新栽的树。</font><br>以…下注[打赌]<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I staked ten pence upon a horse, and it won.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我在一匹马身上押了十便士, 而它居然赢了。</font><br>用桩区分, 界分<br>\n
stale	<h3>stale</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>不新鲜的; 味道变坏的<br>无趣味的; 老掉牙的<br>没有生气的<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>变陈旧; 走味<br>\n
stamp	<h3>stamp</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>邮票, 印花<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Will you oblige me with a stamp?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 给我一张邮票好吗?</font><br>印, 图章<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp None is genuine without our stamp.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 未盖我们的戳记的都不是真货。</font><br>标志, 印记<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This event left the stamp on his heart.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这件事在他心中留下印记。</font><br>跺脚, 顿足<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He gave a stamp of impatience.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他不耐烦地跺脚。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>贴邮票于; 在…盖章<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We are stamping the letter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们在给这封信贴邮票。</font><br>踏平<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They stamped the soil flat.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们把地踏平了。</font><br>标出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Such generous actions stamp him as a man of honour.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如此慷慨的举动说明他是一位君子。</font><br>铭记<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What he did will always be stamped.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他所做的一切人们将永远铭记。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>顿足<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He stamped his feet in anger.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他怒气冲冲地跺脚。</font><br>\n
stand	<h3>stand</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>立脚点; 站立<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He made a sudden stand.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他突然站住了。</font><br>台, 座<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There was a hamburger stand at the entrance to the station.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 车站入口处有一个卖汉堡的小摊。</font><br>售货处; 摊<br>看台, 观众席<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The stands were packed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 看台上座无虚席。</font><br>主张, 立场; 态度<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His stand toward the matter has not changed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他对这个问题的立场没有改变。</font><br>中止, 停顿<br>抵抗, 抵御<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In February 1916 the French Army made a stand at Verdun.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 1916年2月法国军队在凡尔登进行抵抗。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>坐落, 位于<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The house stands on a hill.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 房屋坐落于小山上。</font><br>维持原状; 保持效力<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The rule still stands.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 本规则依然有效。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You stand to make a lot of money this time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你这次一定能赚很多钱。</font><br>停着<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We stood waiting by the roadside.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们站在路旁等着。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>竖放<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You should stand the box on end.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你应该把箱子竖着放。</font><br>忍耐; 忍受; 经得起, 受得起<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I cannot stand that man; he talks too much.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我忍受不了那个人了, 他话太多。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I couldn't stand to watch them slaughter the cattle.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不忍看他们宰牛。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He can't stand traveling in the rush hour.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他受不了在交通最繁忙时出游。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you come, I'll stand you lunch.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你如果来, 我就请你吃午饭。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'll stand a dinner for you if I'm wrong.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我要是错了就请你吃饭。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>站立, (使)直立, 站着<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The baby cannot stand yet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这婴孩还不能站立。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi. & link v.</i></font><br>处于某种状态<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The classroom stands empty during the holiday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在假期中教室都空着。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>link v.</i></font><br>高度为…<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He stood 4 feet 9 inches.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他身高4英尺9英寸。</font><br>\n
standard	<h3>standard</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>标准, 水准, 规范<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The standard of length in France is the metre.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 法国的标准长度是米。</font><br>平均质量; 业务水平<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The people of the US have a high standard of living.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 美国人民的生活水平很高。</font><br>旗帜, 标杆<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Two men carried the standard in the royal parade.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在盛大的游行队伍中, 两个男子打着旗子。</font><br>支柱, 基座<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The deck will need six standards to make it secure.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这座平台要用六根支柱才能稳固。</font><br>\n
standpoint	<h3>standpoint</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>立场; 观点<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp From my standpoint, this thing is just ridiculous.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 依我看来, 这件事简直荒唐。</font><br>\n
star	<h3>star</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>星, 恒星<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The innumerable stars in the sky are too far from us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 天上无数的星星离我们太远了。</font><br>明星, 名角<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The movie star is always natural with other people.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个影星对其他人总是很自然。</font><br>〈正〉功名; 机遇; 运气<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her star seems very much in the ascendant.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她看来吉星高照。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>标示; 点缀<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>主演<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She has starred in this new film.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在这部新影片中担任主角。</font><br>\n
stare	<h3>stare</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>凝视; 瞪视<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was staring, thinking.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他一直在凝视着, 思考着。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The child stared the stranger up and down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那孩子上下打量着这个陌生人。</font><br>\n
start	<h3>start</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>开始; 开端; 出发<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The new system was confronted with great difficulties at the start.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这项新制度刚开始就遇到了很大的困难。</font><br>起点, 出发点<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The runners lined up at the start.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 赛跑选手在起跑线排成一行。</font><br>抢先之量; 先走[跑]之时[距离]<br>吃惊, 惊起<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>开始<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When the rain started the crowd swarmed back into the hotel.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 雨一开始下, 人群就蜂拥回了旅社。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you want to be a champion swimmer you've got to start young.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果你想成为一名游泳冠军, 必须从小就开始训练。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We started our work at eight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们八点钟开始工作。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When the sun started to go down, he stopped and set up his tent.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 太阳开始下山了, 他停下来搭起帐篷。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp As soon as we got there, it started raining.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们一到那儿, 天就下起雨来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His criticism started me thinking seriously.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的批评引起我认真思考。</font><br>出发; 启程<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We're just about to start.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们正要出发。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They started their journey home.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们启程回家了。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>开办; 创办<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He decided to start a newspaper.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他决定创办一份报纸。</font><br>\n
startle	<h3>startle</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>使惊跳; 使大吃一惊<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I yelled in my dream, which startled my roommate out of his sleep.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我梦中的喊叫声惊醒了同屋伙伴。</font><br>\n
starve	<h3>starve</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使)挨饿, 饥饿<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Because there is no food, the people are starving.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 由于没有食品, 所以人们在挨饿。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She's starving herself, trying to lose weight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在饿肚子减肥。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm starved very much now because I have had nothing at all today.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我现在饿极了, 因为我今天什么也没吃。</font><br>\n
state	<h3>state</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>状态, 状况<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Air whether in the gaseous or liquid state is a fluid.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 空气, 无论是气态的或是液态的, 都是一种流体。</font><br>国家, 政府<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We must pay taxes to the State.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们必须向国家纳税。</font><br>州; 邦<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In America, the law varies from state to state.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 美国各州的法律都不同。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>陈述; 敘述<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He stated his problem clearly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把问题叙述得很清楚。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He stated that he had never seen the accused man.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他说他从未见过被告。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is stated that the fire started in a cottage.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 据说火是从一间小屋里烧起来的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please state exactly what you did.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请准确地说明你都干了些什么。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They stated themselves to be members of a secret society.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们宣称自己是一个秘密社团中的成员。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They stated the diamond to have been stolen.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们宣称钻石已被偷了。</font><br>规定, 指定, 排定<br>\n
statement	<h3>statement</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>声明, 陈述<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government issued a statement urging the public to cooperate in this inquiry.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府发表声明要公众对这项调查给予合作。</font><br>结算单, 报表<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The company prepared a statement of its profits and losses.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 该公司做了一份损益清单。</font><br>\n

stay	<h3>stay</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>停留; 停止<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm in a hurry; I've no time to stay.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我很忙, 没有时间待了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He stayed the work and had the machinery removed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把工作停下来, 让人把机器搬掉。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.&link v.</i></font><br>继续处于某种状态<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Do you think this fine weather has come to stay?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你认为这种好天气能持久稳定下来吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She stayed to take care of her mother.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她留下来照料她母亲。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She stayed a reporter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她继续当记者。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The weather stayed fine for a week.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个星期天气一直很好。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please stay seated.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请继续坐着。</font><br>\n

steam	<h3>steam</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>蒸汽<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The steam sang as it escaped from the pipe.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 蒸汽从管子逸出时呜呜作响。</font><br>蒸汽动力<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Who invented the steam engine?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 谁发明了蒸汽机?</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>冒蒸汽<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The kettle was steaming.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 水壶冒热气了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The hot tea steamed my glasses.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 热茶使我的眼镜蒙上了一层水气。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She held the letter over the kettle to steam it open.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把信放在水壶上, 用蒸汽开启信封。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>(靠蒸汽)行驶<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The ship steamed into the harbour.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 船驶进了港湾。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>蒸煮<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is steaming fish for supper.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在蒸鱼准备吃晚饭。</font><br>\n

steep	<h3>steep</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>陡的, 急剧升降的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A car is climbing the steep hill slowly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一辆汽车正在陡峭的山坡上缓缓爬行。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The slope is too steep for us to climb.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这斜坡太陡, 我们爬不上去。</font><br>〈非正〉(要求或价格)过分; 过高<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There was a steep rise in prices.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 价格暴涨。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's a bit steep that I should pay for all of you!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 要我为你们大家付账, 有点太过分了。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>浸, 泡<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The clothes are steeping.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 衣服正泡着呢。</font><br>\n
steer	<h3>steer</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>驾驶, 掌舵<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This car steers easily.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这部车子易于驾驶。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She steered the car skilfully through the narrow streets.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她熟练地驾驶着汽车穿过狭窄的街道。</font><br>\n
stem	<h3>stem</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>(花草的)茎, (树木的)干<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The stem of the mushroom is broken.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这只蘑菇的梗折断了。</font><br>词干<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “uni-” is the stem of “unity”.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp uni-是unity的词干。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>遏制[阻止](液体的流动等)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You must stem the flow of blood from the wound.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你必须止住伤口流血。</font><br>\n
step	<h3>step</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>脚步, 步<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I won't venture a step farther.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不敢再往前走一步。</font><br>一步的距离, 短距离<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He stood within five steps of me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他站在离我不到五步远的地方。</font><br>楼梯, 台阶<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was standing on the church steps.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她正站在教堂门前的台阶上。</font><br>级别, 等级; 阶段<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A colonel is three steps above a captain.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 上校比上尉的级别高三级。</font><br>步骤, 措施<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He will approve such steps.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他会同意这些措施的。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>举步, 行走, 跨步<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He stepped backward and fell over the cliff.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他向后退了一步就从悬崖上掉下去了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He steps the pavements.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在人行道上行走。</font><br>\n
stereotype	<h3>stereotype</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>老套, 模式化的见解, 有老一套固定想法的人<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>把…模式化, 使成陈规<br>\n
stick	<h3>stick</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>粘贴, 张贴<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What's wrong with this stamp?It won't stick.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这邮票怎么回事?粘不住了。</font><br>插入, 刺入, 卡住<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The key sticks in the lock.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 钥匙卡在锁里了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She stuck fork into the meat.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把叉子插到肉里。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>容忍; 忍受<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can't stick her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不能忍受她了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can't stick waiting around.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我受不了久等。</font><br>产生作用, 生效, 起作用<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>枝条, 枯枝, 柴枝<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He picked up sticks to make a fire.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他拾些小树枝来生火。</font><br>棍, 棒<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The farmer saw the boys off with a heavy stick.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 农夫用一根粗棒赶走了那些男孩。</font><br>棒状物<br>\n
sticky	<h3>sticky</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>粘性的; 粘的<br>潮湿的; 湿热的<br>难对付的, 棘手的<br>\n
stiff	<h3>stiff</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>不易弯曲的, 硬的; 稠的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is a sheet of stiff cardboard in the drawer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在那个抽屉里有块硬纸板。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The clay is very stiff; we must make it thinner with water.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这粘土非常稠, 我们须用水使它变得稀一些。</font><br>僵硬的; 不灵活的; 一动就疼的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The old man's joints were stiff.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个老人的关节不灵活了。</font><br>拘谨的, 冷淡的, 不友善的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The lawyer nodded a stiff greeting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个律师不自然地点头示意。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Their manner was rather stiff.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们的态度很生硬。</font><br>强烈的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I need a stiff whisky.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想喝点烈性的威士忌。</font><br>严厉的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He suffered a stiff punishment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他遭受了严厉的惩罚。</font><br>难对付的, 艰难的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We passed a stiff examination.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们通过了一次艰难的考试。</font><br>很有决心的, 刚强的, 坚定的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The army encountered stiff resistance from rebels in the hills.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 部队在山里遭到叛乱者顽强的抵抗。</font><br>太贵的, 无法接受的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He asked a stiff price for his used car.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他给自己的旧车开了个高价。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The asking price is too stiff.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个要价太高。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>〈口〉极度地; 非常<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The play bored me stiff.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这出戏剧使我非常腻烦。</font><br>\n
still	<h3>still</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>不动的; 静止的, 无声的, 寂静的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Keep still while I fasten shoe.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 站着别动, 我给你系鞋带。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp On Sunday the great flywheels of the power station are still.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 每到星期天发电厂巨大的转轮便停止工作了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was so still you could have heard a pin drop.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是那样的寂静, 连一根针落地的声音你都可以听到。</font><br>无风的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was a hot still airless day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那是无风、闷热的一天。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>(电影片中某一镜头的)剧照; 定格画面<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please help me to stick the stills from a new film.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请帮我把这部新影片的剧照贴上。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使某物)平静下来或静止<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The wind stilled.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 风平静下来了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I stilled my anxiety.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我消除了内心的不安。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>仍然, 依旧, 还是<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The fish is still alive.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这条鱼还活着。</font><br>更, 还要<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is cold now, but it'll be still colder tonight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 现在很冷, 但今晚更冷。</font><br>尽管那样; 然而; 不过, 虽然如此<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Although she felt ill, she still went to work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她虽然觉得身体不舒服, 但仍然去上班了。</font><br>\n
stimulate	<h3>stimulate</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>刺激; 激励<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The art course stimulated me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 艺术课激发了我的灵感。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They stimulated me to make greater efforts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们鼓励我要做出更大的努力。</font><br>\n
sting	<h3>sting</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>螫伤; 刺伤<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Most flies do not sting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大多数苍蝇不叮人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A hornet stung me on the cheek.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一只大黄蜂叮了我的脸颊。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>感到剧痛<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My tooth stings.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我牙痛得厉害。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>(某些昆虫的)毒刺, 螫针<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Does a bee die when it loses its sting?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 蜜蜂失去蛰针会死吗?</font><br>螫伤处; 蜇伤处<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Rub ointment onto the wasp sting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在黄蜂刺伤处涂些药膏。</font><br>\n
stir	<h3>stir</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>搅拌<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This paste stirs easily.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种糨糊易于搅拌。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mary put the sugar in her coffee, and stirred it with a spoon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 玛丽在她的咖啡里放了些糖, 然后用勺子搅动着。</font><br>(使)移动; (使)激动<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He did not stir, not look up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他没有动, 也没有抬头。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The book stirred my interest.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这本书激起了我的兴趣。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>搅动; 搅和; 搅拌<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Give the soup a stir.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把汤搅拌一下。</font><br>激动; 纷乱; 骚乱<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His resignation caused quite a stir.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的辞职引起了相当大的轰动。</font><br>\n
stock	<h3>stock</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>储备品, 供应物<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Stocks of coal are running low.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 储备的煤越来越少了。</font><br>(商店的)现货, 存货<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This store keeps a large stock of toys.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这家商店备有大量玩具。</font><br>公债; 股份; 股票<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He bought a lot of government stock.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他买了许多公债。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She invested most of her savings in stocks and shares.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把大部分存款投资在公债和股票上。</font><br>原汤, 汤料<br>家系, 家世, 血统<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He descended from Jewish stock.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是犹太人的后裔。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>储备, 保持…的供应<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This store stocks all types of toys.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这家商店储备各种类型的玩具。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>通常备有现货的; 常备的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Toothpaste is stock merchandise in a drugstore.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 牙膏是杂货店里的常备商品。</font><br>常用的; 陈腐的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The weather is a stock subject of conversation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 天气是聊天的习惯话题。</font><br>\n

store	<h3>store</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>贮存, 贮备<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This animal makes a store of nuts for the winter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种动物为冬天储备了大量坚果。</font><br>商店, 店铺<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There's a small general stores in the village where you can get anything from stamps to potatoes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个村子里有家小杂货店, 在那里你可以买到从邮票到马铃薯等的所有东西。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>储藏; 存放<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Some food won't store.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有些食物不能贮存。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They used the house to store the building materials.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们用那座房子来储藏建筑材料。</font><br>\n

story	<h3>story</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>故事; 传说; 小说<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He likes to listen to fairy stories.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他喜欢听神话故事。</font><br>(新闻)报道; 新闻报道的题材<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That story has got into the newspaper.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那件事已见报了。</font><br>〈口〉谎话<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The teacher told him off for telling stories.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 老师责备他说谎。</font><br>情节<br>〈美〉楼层<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They live in three storys building.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们住在一幢三层楼的公寓里。</font><br>\n
stove	<h3>stove</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>炉, 火炉<br>\n
straight	<h3>straight</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>直的, 笔直的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is a straight line under the sentence.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 句子下面有一条直线。</font><br>连续的; 不间断的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The straight flow of the brook formed a ravine.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不间断的溪水形成了一个峡谷。</font><br>直率的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is straight in his dealings.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他待人接物正直老实。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>直接地; 径直地<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His hot pancakes are delicious, you buy them straight from the kitchen to eat in your hands.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他卖的热烙饼味道真好, 一做好你就可以直接买来用手拿着吃。</font><br>立即, 马上<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He went straight from school to university.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他中学一毕业就马上进了大学。</font><br>\n
strain	<h3>strain</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>拉紧<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They strained the wire between two posts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们拉紧了两根电线杆之间的电线。</font><br>尽量利用; 尽全力<br>过滤<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The liquid strained easily.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种液体容易过滤。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I boiled the potatoes and then strained them.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我把土豆煮熟后把水滤掉。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>拉紧; 绷紧; 张紧<br>拉力; 张力; 应变<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The strain on the rope made it broken.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 绳子因受力过大而断了。</font><br>(演出的)音乐片段, 乐曲<br>写作或说话的方式或风格; 笔调; 语调<br>\n
strange	<h3>strange</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>陌生的; 生疏的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He stood in a strange street.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他站在一条陌生的街道上。</font><br>奇异的; 奇怪的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's strange to see even a single fly in our city.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在我们城市里哪怕就看到一只苍蝇, 也是一件怪事。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's strange that she should have been arrested for stealing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 很奇怪, 她竟因偷盗而被逮捕。</font><br>\n
stranger	<h3>stranger</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>陌生人<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The stranger fastened on my arm.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个陌生人紧紧抓住我的胳膊。</font><br>外地人, 初到者<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's hard for a stranger to make friends in this town.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 外地人在这个城里很难交朋友。</font><br>\n
strap	<h3>strap</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>用皮带捆扎<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He strapped his trunk.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他用皮带捆皮箱。</font><br>用皮带抽打<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The boss strapped a workman.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 老板用皮带抽打一个工人。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>带子<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I need a new watch strap.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我需要一条新表带。</font><br>挎带, 肩带; 背带<br>\n
strategic	<h3>strategic</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>战略(上)的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The army moved for strategic reasons.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 军队作了战略转移。</font><br>有战略意义的; 至关重要的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The bridge is of strategic importance to us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这座桥对我们至关重要。</font><br>\n
strategy	<h3>strategy</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>战略学, 兵法<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I admired the general who was a master of strategy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我敬佩那位精通兵法的将军。</font><br>战略, 策略<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp By careful strategy she negotiated a substantial pay rise.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她精心策划后, 谈妥了大幅增加工资的事。</font><br>策略, 计谋<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It must be a strategy to make me let him go on holiday alone.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这一定是他用的计, 好叫我让他独自一个人去度假。</font><br>\n
straw	<h3>straw</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>稻草, 麦秆<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There are a lot of straws in the shed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 棚子里有许多稻草。</font><br>吸管<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp May I have a straw for my drink?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 给我一根喝饮料的吸管好吗?</font><br>毫无价值的东西, 无意义的事情<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don't care a straw for your opinions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我一点都不在乎你有什么看法。</font><br>\n
streak	<h3>streak</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>(与周围有所不同的)条纹<br>(通常指不好的)特征(倾向)<br>(不断经历成功或失败的)一段时期<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>快速移动<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>使布满条纹<br>\n
stream	<h3>stream</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>小河, 溪流<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you jump across the stream?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你能跳过这条小溪吗?</font><br>流, 一股, 一串<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A stream of people was going into the cinema.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一股人流走进影院。</font><br>水流方向, 潮流<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He hasn't the courage to go against the stream of public opinion.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他没有勇气逆舆论潮流行事。</font><br>(按能力分的)班级<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is in the A stream.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在A班。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>流; 流动<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Blood streamed from the wound.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 血从伤口流出。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her eyes were streaming tears.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她两眼正流着泪水。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>飘扬; 招展<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The flag was streaming in the wind.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 旗帜在风中飘动。</font><br>\n
street	<h3>street</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>大街, 街道<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The street runs through the town.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 街道横穿这个镇。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The whole street cheered as she rode past.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当她骑着马走过时, 整条街上的人向她欢呼。</font><br>\n
strength	<h3>strength</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>力, 力量; 体力, 力气<br>强度; 浓度<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The alcoholic strength of brandy far exceeds that of wine.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 白兰地的酒精浓度远远超过葡萄酒。</font><br>优点, 长处<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Tolerance is one of his strengths.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 宽容是他的一个优点。</font><br>人力[数]; 兵力<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What is the total strength of the enemy army?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 敌军人数总共有多少?</font><br>\n
strengthen	<h3>strengthen</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>加强, 巩固<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The wind strengthened during the night.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 夜里风刮得更大了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They strengthened the city walls.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们加固了城墙。</font><br>\n
stress	<h3>stress</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>压力, 紧张<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The roof couldn't bear the stress of the snow.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 屋顶受不了积雪的压力。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Some students are completely struck down by the stresses of examinations.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有些学生被考试的压力完全压垮了。</font><br>强调, 重要性<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My parents lay great stress on honesty.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的父母十分注重诚实。</font><br>重力<br>重音<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The stress is on the last syllable.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 重音在最后一个音节上。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>重读<br>强调<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That article stressed the same problem.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那篇文章强调了同一个问题。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He stressed that we should always be honest.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他强调我们应该永远诚实。</font><br>\n
stretch	<h3>stretch</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>伸展; 拉紧<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Rubber stretches easily.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 橡胶的延展性很好。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He rose and stretched himself.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他站起身, 伸了伸懒腰。</font><br>延伸<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The road stretches uphill at a steep slope.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这条路以陡峭的坡度向山上延伸。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The bird stretched its wings.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 鸟展开了翅膀。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>伸展, 延伸, 延续<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He had a good stretch on the bed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在床上痛快地伸了个懒腰。</font><br>一段时间, 一段路程, 一段水域<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I see nothing but a small stretch of road immediately ahead.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 除了近在眼前的一小段路之外什么也看不见。</font><br>\n
strict	<h3>strict</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>严格的, 严厉的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is a strict teacher.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她是个严格的教师。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Discipline at school is very strict.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 学校的纪律很严。</font><br>严谨的, 精确的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The work requires strict measurement.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这项工作需要精确的测量。</font><br>绝对的, 完全的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The church demands strict loyalty.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 教会要求绝对的忠诚。</font><br>\n
stride	<h3>stride</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>大踏步走; 跨过<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She strode purposefully up to the door and knocked loudly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她故意地大步走到门前, 并大声敲门。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The fence is so low that even a ten-year-old boy can stride it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 篱笆太矮, 连十几岁的孩子都能跨过去。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>大步<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He walked with long strides.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他迈着大步走去。</font><br>步法; 步态<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The child could not keep up with his father's strides.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个孩子跟不上他父亲的步子。</font><br>\n
strike	<h3>strike</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>打, 击<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Strike while the iron is hot.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 趁热打铁。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He struck the table angrily.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他气愤地敲了敲桌子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She struck her opponent a tremendous blow on the jaw.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她猛击对手的下巴。</font><br>敲响; 报时<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I didn't hear the clock strike.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我没有听到报时钟声。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The huge clock of the Customs House strikes the hours.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 海关的大钟每小时都报时。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>攻击, 袭击; 侵袭<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A hurricane struck the city.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 飓风袭击了该城市。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A bullet struck him dead.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一颗子弹把他击毙了。</font><br>突然发现(矿藏等)<br>(突然)出现于(某人的)脑海中<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp As I watched them, an idea struck me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我看着他们时, 产生了一个想法。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It suddenly struck me that we ought to make a new plan.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我突然想到, 我们应该制订一个新的方案。</font><br>给…以(深刻)印象<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His enthusiasm for study struck his teacher favourably.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他勤奋学习的热情给老师留下了良好的印象。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He struck me as being a fool.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他给我的印象是一个傻子。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>罢工<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The dockers are striking.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 码头工人正在罢工。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>罢工[课, 市]<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A strike has shut down several car factories.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 罢工使好几家汽车厂停工。</font><br>袭击, 攻击<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They made an air strike on the enemy's position.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们对敌军阵地进行空袭。</font><br>突然发现; 走运<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There was a gold strike here many years ago.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 许多年以前, 这里突然发现了金矿。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They made a lucky strike.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们走运了。</font><br>\n
striking	<h3>striking</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>显著的, 突出的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is a striking difference between Jane and Mary.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 简和玛丽之间有显著的差异。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The difference was very striking.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 差别非常显著。</font><br>引人注目的; 容貌出众的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is a very striking young woman.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她是一位非常引人注目的年轻女子。</font><br>\n
string	<h3>string</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>线, 细绳<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The books were tied with string.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些书是用细绳捆起来的。</font><br>(乐器上的)弦<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His fingers swept the strings of the guitar.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的手指轻拂着吉他的弦。</font><br>一串, 一行<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The youngsters set off string after string of firecrackers to mark Spring Festival.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们放了一串又一串的鞭炮, 以欢庆春节。</font><br>一连串, 一系列<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He obtained a string of wins.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他获得了一连串的胜利。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>装弦于, 上弦<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She can string a violin.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她会给小提琴上弦。</font><br>用线串<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They strung these pearls tightly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们把这些珍珠串得太紧了。</font><br>\n
strip	<h3>strip</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>脱光衣服<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He stripped for a bath.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他脱衣洗浴。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>剥去, 脱去<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She stripped the children and put them in the bath.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她脱光孩子们的衣服把他们放进浴缸。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They stripped themselves naked.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们脱光了衣服。</font><br>剥夺, 夺走<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The house was stripped bare.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 屋子被洗劫一空。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>脱衣; 脱衣舞表演<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The dancer did a strip.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 跳舞者表演了脱衣舞。</font><br>狭长的一块(材料、土地等)<br>(足球队员的)运动服<br>\n
stripe	<h3>stripe</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>(与底色不同的)条纹<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Each white petal had a stripe of red.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 每一片白色的花瓣上都有一条红色的条纹。</font><br>\n
stroke	<h3>stroke</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>一击<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He broke the lock with one stroke of the hammer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他一锤就把锁砸坏了。</font><br>一画, 一笔<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was putting the finishing stroke to the portrait.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他给这幅画作最后的修饰。</font><br>(游泳或划船的)划, 划法; 游法<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you do back stroke?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你会仰泳吗?</font><br>钟的敲声<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She arrived on the stroke of six.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她六时整到达。</font><br>中风<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She had a stroke and was unable to walk again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她中风后再也不能走路了。</font><br>轻抚<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She gave the cat a stroke.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她抚摸了一下猫。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>轻抚, 抚摸<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The girl stroked the cat.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个姑娘抚摸着小猫。</font><br>\n
strong	<h3>strong</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>强壮的, 强有力的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is as strong as oxen.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他健壮得如牛一样。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The firm ran up against strong competition.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这家公司遇到了强有力的竞争。</font><br>牢固的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He wore strong shoes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他穿着结实的鞋。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The hedge of stones is much stronger than a wood hedge.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 石头围墙比竹篱笆结实多了。</font><br>坚强的; 坚定的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She has a very strong will.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她有着坚强的意志。</font><br>强烈的, 浓烈的, 深刻的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has a strong desire to meet you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他极想见你。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm strong against the proposal.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我坚决反对这项建议。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's a bit strong to punish her for such a small thing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 为那么点小事就惩罚她未免有些过分了。</font><br>擅长于…的; 对…很热心的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Making speeches is one of his strong points.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 演讲是他的强项之一。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is strong in English.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他精通英语。</font><br>\n
structure	<h3>structure</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>结构, 构造<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A flower has quite a complicated structure.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一朵花的结构相当复杂。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Geologists study the structure of the rocks.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 地质学家研究岩石结构。</font><br>有结构的事物; 复杂的整体; 建筑物<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The Eiffel Tower is one of the most famous structures in the world.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 艾菲尔铁塔是世界上最著名的建筑物之一。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>组织; 安排; 构造; 制定<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's often difficult to structure one's career.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 安排自己的职业通常很困难。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She hoped that more activities like this could be structured.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她希望能组织更多这类活动。</font><br>\n
struggle	<h3>struggle</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>搏斗; 奋斗; 努力<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The bandit struggled desperately.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那匪徒拼命挣扎。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Two boys are struggling together.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 两个男孩在打架。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The thief struggled to get free.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那贼挣扎着要逃脱。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We should struggle to learn advanced techniques.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们应当努力学习先进技术。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>打斗, 搏斗, 战斗, 斗争<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Three people were hurt in the struggle.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有三人在搏斗中受了伤。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In 1862 the American slaves won their struggle for freedom.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 1862年美国黑奴赢得了争取自由的斗争。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They joined the struggle against him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们参加了反对他的斗争。</font><br>努力, 奋斗<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was a hard struggle to get my work done in time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 为使工作按时完成, 我做了一番努力。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The cat made a struggle to get free.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这只猫挣扎着想跑掉。</font><br>\n
student	<h3>student</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>学生, 大学生<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The students put up a poster on the bulletin board.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 学生们在布告牌上贴了一张海报。</font><br>研究者<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is a close student of birds.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是一位鸟类学研究者。</font><br>\n
studio	<h3>studio</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>播音室; 录音室<br>画室; 摄影室; 电影摄影棚; 制片厂<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They are building a modern studio.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们正在修建一座现代化的摄影室。</font><br>\n
study	<h3>study</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>学习; 研究<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He had studied diligently at college.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在大学里勤奋学习。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was studying to be a doctor.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在读医科。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is studying German.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在学习德语。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They studied the document line by line.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们逐行逐句地研究那份文件。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They are studying what to do next Sunday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们在研究下星期日做什么。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I must study why he killed himself.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我必须研究一下他为什么自杀。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They study themselves a little silly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们觉得自己有点傻。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>学习, 读书<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My brother is fond of study.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我兄弟喜欢学习。</font><br>研究<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How are your medical studies progressing?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你的医学研究进展如何?</font><br>书房<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The dictionary is in the study.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 词典在书房里。</font><br>\n
stuff	<h3>stuff</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>以…填进, 塞满<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She stuffed her clothes in the wardrobe.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把衣服塞进衣櫥。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Why should you stuff yourself?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你为什么要吃得那么多呢?</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>材料; 东西<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What is this stuff?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是什么东西?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is not the stuff.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他不是这个材料。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We must as well buy our own stuff.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们不妨自己去买原料。</font><br>\n
stupid	<h3>stupid</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>笨的; 头脑迟钝的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A stupid fellow is difficult to teach.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 笨人难教。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is rather stupid.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他很笨。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is stupid for a child of his age.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 与同龄的孩子比, 他很笨。</font><br>蠢的; 傻的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They were stupid not to follow your advice.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们不听你的劝告真傻。</font><br>没趣的; 无聊的<br>\n
style	<h3>style</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>风格, 格调; 文体<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is a very popular writer but I don't like his style.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是个很受欢迎的作家, 但我不喜欢他的文风。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The letter is written in a formal style.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这封信是用正式文体写的。</font><br>行为方式, 作风<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Flattery is not his style.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他从不对人阿谀奉承。</font><br>种类, 类型; 流行式样; 款式<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What style of furniture do you like?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你喜欢什么式样的家具?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They sell shoes in all styles.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们出售各种最新款式的鞋。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her dress is out of style.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的穿着不时髦。</font><br>风度; 格调; 气派<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has great style.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他很有风度。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When they got married they decided to do it in style, and gave a big party.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们结婚时决定讲究气派摆一番排场, 于是搞了一个大型婚宴。</font><br>\n
subdivide	<h3>subdivide</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>再分, 细分<br>\n
subject	<h3>subject</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>主题; 题目; 问题<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is a book on the subject of love.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是一部以爱情为主题的书。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He squeezed 10 pages out of a small subject.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他就一个小论题硬写出10页文章来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We didn't get to the core of the subject.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们没触及问题的核心。</font><br>话题, 考虑的问题<br>学科, 科目; 课程<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She's taking three subjects in her exams.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她参加三门课程的考试。</font><br>主语, 主词<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>常有[常患, 常遭受]…的; 倾向于…的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is subject to fever.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他易发烧。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This area is subject to earthquakes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 该地区常发生地震。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The plans are subject to change at short notice.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些计划一有通知就可能马上改变。</font><br>须服从…的; 受…支配的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We are subject to our country's laws.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们必须遵守国家的法律。</font><br>受约束[管辖]的, 不独立的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is a subject tribe.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是个受他人统治的部落。</font><br>取决于…的, 有待于…的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The plan is subject to the manager's approval.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 该计划须经经理批准。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Subject to your consent, I will try again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你要是同意, 我再试一试。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>使服从, 征服, 制伏<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He tried to subject the whole family to his will.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他试图使全家人服从他的意愿。</font><br>\n
submerge	<h3>submerge</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使)潜入水中, 淹没<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The submarine can submerge very quickly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 潜艇能非常迅速地潜入水中。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The river overflowed and submerged the farmland.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 河水泛滥, 淹没了农田。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>完全掩盖, 遮掩<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His talent was submerged by his shyness.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的腼腆埋没了他的才华。</font><br>\n
submit	<h3>submit</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>屈服, 认输<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Joe refuses to submit.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 乔决不屈服。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>提交, 呈递<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I submitted my resignation yesterday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我昨天递交了辞呈。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The developers submitted building plans to the council for approval.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 开发商把施工方案提交议会以求批准。</font><br>〈正〉建议, 主张, 申辩<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Counsel submitted that there was no case against his client.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 辩护人辩称没有什么可加罪于他的当事人。</font><br>\n
subsequent	<h3>subsequent</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>随后的, 继…之后的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The story will be continued in subsequent issues of the magazine.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 小说将继续在以后几期杂志上连载。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The day subsequent to your visit he died.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你探望后的第二天, 他便去世了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His illness was subsequent to his wife's death.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在妻子死后就病倒了。</font><br>\n
substance	<h3>substance</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>物质<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Soil consists of various chemical substances.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 土壤由各种化学物质组成。</font><br>主旨, 要旨<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The substance of their talk is condensed into a paragraph.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们谈话的要旨被压缩成一段话。</font><br>实质, 本体<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Is there any substance to their claim?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们的要求有实质内容吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There isn't anything of real substance in her book.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的书中没有任何真正实质性的内容。</font><br>\n
substantial	<h3>substantial</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>坚固的; 结实的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Those workers have built many substantial buildings in the recent years.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 近几年那些工人建造了许多坚固的建筑。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The walls were substantial and did not fall.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 墙很坚固, 没有倒塌。</font><br>大量的, 可观的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The country bought a substantial number of weapons.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个国家购买了大量武器。</font><br>重大的, 重要的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They made substantial changes to the arrangements.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们在安排上作了重大变动。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The matter is substantial.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这件事很重要。</font><br>实质的, 基本的, 大体上的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The two stories were in substantial agreement.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这两则故事大体上一致。</font><br>\n
substitute	<h3>substitute</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>代替, 替换, 代用<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was dancing while someone substituted at the piano.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在跳舞, 别人代她弹钢琴。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you cannot go yourself, please find someone to substitute you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你如果不能亲自去, 请找人代替你。</font><br>\n
subtle	<h3>subtle</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>微妙的; 难以捉摸的; 细微的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her whole attitude had undergone a subtle change.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的整个态度发生了微妙的变化。</font><br>狡猾的, 狡诈的<br>敏感的, 敏锐的, 有辨别力的<br>\n
subtract	<h3>subtract</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>减, 扣除, 做减法<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In their first year at school, most children learn to add and subtract.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 入学第一年, 多数孩子都学加减法。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please subtract a quarter of the money for your own use.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请从你的零用钱中扣除四分之一。</font><br>\n
suburb	<h3>suburb</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>郊区, 城郊<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Blackheath is a suburb of London.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 布莱克西斯是伦敦的一个郊区。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They decided to move out to the suburbs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们决定搬到郊外去。</font><br>\n
subway	<h3>subway</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>地下人行道<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Cross by the subway please.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请走地下人行通道。</font><br>〈美〉地铁<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The new subway is now being laid.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 新的地铁正在铺设中。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He goes to work on the subway.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他坐地铁上班。</font><br>\n
succeed	<h3>succeed</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>成功<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The experiment has succeeded.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 试验已成功。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She succeeded.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她成功了。</font><br>完成<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our plan succeed-ed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们的计划顺利完成了。</font><br>发迹; 成就<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She's the type of person who succeeds anywhere.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她是不论到什么地方都会飞黄腾达的那种人。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>继承, 继任, 继位<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If he has no children, who will succeed?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果他没有孩子, 谁将继位?</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>随…之后; 继续<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His speech was succeeded by a silence.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他讲演后紧接着是一片沉默。</font><br>\n
success	<h3>success</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>成功; 成就<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Success at last!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 终于成功了！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I wished Jill success with her studies.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我祝吉尔在学习上成功。</font><br>成功者, 成功的事迹<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is a success as an actress.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她是一名成功的演员。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The army has had quite a few successes recently.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 最近军队打了好几次胜仗。</font><br>\n
successful	<h3>successful</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>成功的; 如愿以偿的; 达到目的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is a successful businesswoman.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她是一位很成功的女实业家。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The meeting was successful.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 会议开得很成功。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was successful in his studies.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在学业上很成功。</font><br>\n
succession	<h3>succession</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>连续<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His words came out in quick succession.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的话连珠炮似地说了出来。</font><br>连续不断的人[事物]<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The endless succession of parties wore us out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 接连不断的聚会把我们累垮了。</font><br>继承, 继任; 继承权<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His succession as headmaster was not in any doubt.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他继任校长是确定无疑的。</font><br>\n
successive	<h3>successive</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>连续的, 相继的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He won three successive matches.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他连胜三场比赛。</font><br>\n
such	<h3>such</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>这样的; 如此的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He spent all his money, he is such a fool.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他这样傻, 花光了所有的钱。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Everyone was indoors on such a night.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在这样的晚上谁都会待在室内。</font><br>这么大的; 非常的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He's such a kind man.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他十分和蔼可亲。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The garage did such a bad repair.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 修车厂的活干得如此之差。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>pron.</i></font><br>这样的事物[人]<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He claimed to be a scholar but was not such.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他自称是个学者, 但实际上并非如此。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Such is life!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 人生就是这样。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Such are the most powerful voices of our times!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些就是我们时代的最有力的声音！</font><br>\n
suck	<h3>suck</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>吸; 吮<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He sucked hard for air to keep breathing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他拼命吸气以维持呼吸。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The baby was sucking its mother's breast.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 婴儿正在吮吸母乳。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>舐; 吮吸<br>\n
sudden	<h3>sudden</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>突然的, 忽然的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The sudden arrival of guests forced her to change her plans.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 客人们的突然到来迫使她改变了计划。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Your marriage was sudden.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你结婚结得太突然了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was sudden in his actions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他行动迅速。</font><br>\n
