telegraph	<h3>telegraph</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>打电报<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I will tell the result by telegraph.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我打电报告诉你结果。</font><br>电报机<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Send the message on the telegraph.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个消息用电报机发出。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>打电报传达(消息)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I telegraphed to him to come.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我已发电报要他来。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>打电报向(某人)发指令<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They telegraphed us to leave immediately.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们拍电报叫我们立即离开。</font><br>\n
telephone	<h3>telephone</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>电话<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The doctor was in touch by telephone with his patients.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 医生通过电话与病人保持联系。</font><br>电话机<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There are three telephones on his desk.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他桌子上有三部电话。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>以电话传送(消息), 给(某人)打电话<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She has telephoned for the doctor.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她已经打了电话给医生。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't telephone me when I am busy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在我忙的时候不要打电话给我。</font><br>\n
telescope	<h3>telescope</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>望远镜<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She resolved to make a telescope.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她决心做一架望远镜。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使某物)变短(叠缩在一起)<br>(使某物)叠缩, 嵌入<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>压缩某物使其少占空间或时间<br>\n
television	<h3>television</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>电视<br>电视播放的节目<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The Prime Minister set forth the aims of his government in a television broadcast.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 首相在一次电视讲话中阐明了政府的目标。</font><br>电视机<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Who invented television?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 是谁发明电视的?</font><br>电视台, 电视行业<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She works in television.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在电视台工作。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She's seeking fame in the world of television.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她想在电视界出名。</font><br>\n
tell	<h3>tell</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>讲, 告诉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I have something to tell you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我有件事要告诉你。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Tell me what I should do next.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 告诉我下一步该做什么。</font><br>吩咐, 命令<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Tell him to wait for us at the gate.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 让他在大门口等我们。</font><br>表明, 显示<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her face told her joy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她脸上流露出欢乐。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>分辨, 辨别<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was difficult to tell his exact age.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 很难判断他到底多大岁数。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>泄密<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You mustn't tell or we'll get into trouble.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你千万不可泄密, 否则我们会遇到麻烦。</font><br>\n
temper	<h3>temper</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>脾气, 性情, 心境<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She has a naturally sweet temper.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她生性和蔼可亲。</font><br>〈非正〉恶劣的心情, 烦躁<br>韧度<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The temper of the steel is right.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这钢的韧度正合适。</font><br>\n
temperature	<h3>temperature</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>温度, 气温<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The room had a temperature of 18℃.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 室内温度为十八摄氏度。</font><br>高烧, 发烧, 发热<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has a temperature for two days.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他发烧两天了。</font><br>\n
temple	<h3>temple</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>庙, 寺, 神殿<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Many temples were beautifully built.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 许多寺庙建得很美。</font><br>太阳穴<br>\n
temporary	<h3>temporary</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>临时的, 暂时的, 短时间的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They just reached a temporary agreement.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们只是达成一个临时协议。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The arrangement is only temporary.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种安排只是暂时的。</font><br>\n
temptation	<h3>temptation</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>诱惑, 引诱<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was surrounded by temptations.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他受到各种诱惑。</font><br>诱惑物<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The purse on the table was a strong temptation to the poor child.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 桌上的钱包对那个穷孩子是一个强烈的诱惑。</font><br>\n

tend	<h3>tend</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>照料, 照顾, 伺候<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She tended her husband carefully during his illness.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她丈夫生病期间, 她无微不至地照顾他。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>往, 朝向<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The river here tends eastward.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这条河从这里向东流。</font><br>易于; 倾向<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My grandmother tends to go to bed early every day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我祖母每天通常比较早睡。</font><br>\n
tendency	<h3>tendency</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>倾向, 趋势<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has a tendency to forget things.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他有忘事的倾向。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Prices continue to show an upward tendency.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 物价呈继续上升的趋势。</font><br>\n
tender	<h3>tender</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>提出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The minister tendered his resignation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 部长提出辞职。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He tendered the committee a referendum.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他向该委员会提交了一份备忘录。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>投标<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>脆弱的; 幼弱的; 嫩的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her skin is very tender, like a baby's.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的皮肤像婴儿一样的柔嫩。</font><br>温柔的; 亲切的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She spoke tender words to the child.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她对那孩子说了些亲切的话。</font><br>疼痛的, 一触即痛的; 敏感的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You should avoid the tender subject.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你们应当避开这个令人不快的话题。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My throat is still tender.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的嗓子还在痛。</font><br>\n
tennis	<h3>tennis</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>网球(运动)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She plays tennis gracefully.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她打网球姿势优美。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is a professional tennis player.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是一名职业网球运动员。</font><br>\n
tense	<h3>tense</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>拉紧的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Is the rope tense?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 绳子拉紧了吗?</font><br>肌肉绷紧的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I cannot play the piano like I used to—my fingers have gone tense from lack of practice.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不能像过去那样弹钢琴了——我的手指因缺乏练习变得生硬了。</font><br>神经紧张的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He read the letter with a tense anxiety.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他紧张焦虑地看那封信。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We were tense with expectancy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们因期待而神经紧张起来。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>(使某人或某物)变得紧张<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>〈语〉(动词的)时态<br>\n
tension	<h3>tension</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>紧张<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They suffered from nervous tension when the signal was shown on a radarscope.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当雷达显示器上出现信号时他们感到紧张。</font><br>紧张的状态<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The diplomat threw in a joke, and the tension was instantly relieved.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那位外交官插进一个笑话, 紧张的气氛顿时缓和下来。</font><br>张力, 拉力<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you increase the tension of that violin string it will break.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果你再拉紧小提琴的那根弦, 它就会绷断。</font><br>\n
tent	<h3>tent</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>帐篷<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The children had a midnight feast in their tents.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们半夜在帐篷里饱餐了一顿。</font><br>帐, 罩<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Put a tent over his legs to stop them being rubbed by the sheets.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 给他的腿盖上罩子, 以免被床单摩擦。</font><br>\n
term	<h3>term</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>任期; 期限<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp An American President's term of office is four years.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 美国总统的任期是四年。</font><br>措词; 术语, 专门用语<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “Hot” and “cold” are contrary terms.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “热”和“冷”是相反的词。</font><br>(学校的)学期<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The summer term runs from April to July.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 夏季学期从四月份到七月份。</font><br>条件, 条款<br>关系, 友谊<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I have kept terms with Tom for many years.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我和汤姆交朋友已有很多年了。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>把…称为, 把…叫做<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He termed the gas argon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把这种气体叫作氩气。</font><br>\n
terminal	<h3>terminal</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>末端的, 终点的, 极限的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The car has reached its terminal speed and can run faster no longer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这辆车的速度已达到了极限, 不能再跑更快了。</font><br>末期的, 晚期的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is in the terminal stage of cancer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他正处于癌症晚期。</font><br>\n
terrible	<h3>terrible</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>可怕的, 恐怖的; 令人震惊的, 极其令人讨厌的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The little boy is playing the terrible game.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那小男孩正在玩恐怖的游戏。</font><br>剧烈的, 严酷的, 严重的<br>〈非正〉很糟的; 极差的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What terrible weather!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 多糟的天气！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is terrible that she lost her wallet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 糟透了, 她丢失了钱包。</font><br>\n
territory	<h3>territory</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>领土, 版图<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This island was once French territory.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个岛一度是法国的领地。</font><br>管区, 营业地区<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp As the company's northern sales manager I'm responsible for quite a large territory.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 作为公司的北方销售经理, 我负责相当大的一片地区。</font><br>地盘, 领域, 范围<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mechanics is out of my territory.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不懂力学。</font><br>\n
terror	<h3>terror</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>恐怖; 恐怖活动<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government rules by terror.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个政府实行恐怖统治。</font><br>引起恐怖的人[事]<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Those rebels are a terror to the entire town.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那些反叛者使全城的人感到恐惧。</font><br>讨厌的人<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His son is a real terror.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的儿子实在讨厌。</font><br>\n
test	<h3>test</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>测验<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The candidate has passed all the tests.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个应试者已通过所有的考试。</font><br>化验<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You'd better not eat anything before a blood test.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在验血前你最好不要吃任何东西。</font><br>试验, 检验<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Tests have shown that these new tyres are significantly safer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 试验表明这些新的轮胎要安全得多。</font><br>考验<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Obviously they were putting him to a severe test.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 显然他们是在给他以严峻的考验。</font><br>试验品, 试金石; 试验的手段<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Employers will use this agreement as a test in dealing with future wage claims.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 雇主们将这份协议当作处理未来加薪要求的判断准绳。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>测验, 考查, 检查, 检验<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'll test my judgement.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我要考查一下自己的判断能力。</font><br>考验<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Your patience is tested by time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 时间将考验你的耐心。</font><br>勘探, 探测<br>\n
text	<h3>text</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>正文, 本文<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The text stands on page 23.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 课文正文在23页上。</font><br>原文, 全文<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our newspaper is printing the full text of the President's speech.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们的报纸刊登了总统讲话的全文。</font><br>教科书, 课本<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is reading a text in chemistry.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在看化学教科书。</font><br>\n

than	<h3>than</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>conj.</i></font><br>比(用于比较级)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She works better than I.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她工作做得比我好。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The roads here are much quieter here than in London.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这里的道路比伦敦的安静多了。</font><br>宁愿…而不愿<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'd rather play football than go swimming.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 与其去游泳我还不如去踢足球。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>prep.</i></font><br>与…相比<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is the person than whom I can imagine no one more courteous.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想不出一个比他更有礼貌的人。</font><br>\n
thank	<h3>thank</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>谢谢, 感谢<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Thank you very much!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 多谢你！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I thank you that you have done this for me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 谢谢你替我做完了这件事。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp To my shame, I never thanked him for his kindness.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我感到惭愧的是对他的好意我从未表示过感谢。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Thank heaven it only lasts an hour.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 谢天谢地, 这只持续了一小时。</font><br>责怪<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has only himself to thank that he has lost his job.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他被解雇了, 这只能怪他自己。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>感谢, 谢谢, 道谢的话<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The old man gave thanks to me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那老人向我致谢。</font><br>\n
that	<h3>that</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>那, 那个<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp At that time he was very busy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那段时间他很忙。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The owner made a dive for the rejected clothing and began to snatch it this way and that.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 店主冲向那堆挑剩的衣服, 开始翻来翻去。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>pron.</i></font><br>那, 那个<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What was that which he gave you?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他给你的是什么?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Everything that a computer does is dependent on the man who uses it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 计算机所做的一切都取决于使用计算机的人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was the largest map that I ever saw.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那是我所看见过的最大的地图。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Is this the pen (that) you were looking for?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你找的钢笔是这一支吗?</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>conj.</i></font><br>(用于引出各种从句)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's the best that you should work hard.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你最好还是努力工作。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm glad (that) he's got the job.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我很高兴他找到了这工作。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I strongly believe that he is innocent.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我坚信他是无辜的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Oh that I could fly!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我要是能飞就好了！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That I should see a child of mine arrested for selling drugs!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我竟然看到自己的孩子因贩毒而被捕！</font><br>\n
the	<h3>the</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>art.</i></font><br>(指已提到的人[物])<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's her room.The room is bright and clean.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是她的房间。这房间明亮整洁。</font><br>(指说话人与听者已知的人[物])<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Do you like the book?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你喜欢这本书吗?</font><br>(用于独一无二的事物前)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The sun is like a great ball of fire.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 太阳像个巨大的火球。</font><br>(与形容词最高级和序数词连用)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp September is the ninth month of the year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 九月是一年中的第九个月。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is the best book I have ever read.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是我看过的最好的一本书。</font><br>(在单数名词前表示一类人[物])<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The horse is a useful animal.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 马是有用的动物。</font><br>(用于江河、山脉等名称之前)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The Pacific Ocean is the biggest ocean in the earth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 太平洋是地球上最大的海洋。</font><br>(与乐器名称连用)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is good at the piano.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他擅长弹钢琴。</font><br>(表示数量)每; 每一<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The worker is paid by the hour.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个工人的工资按小时计算。</font><br>(用于形容词前表示一类人)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The old are apt to catch a cold.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 老人容易患感冒。</font><br>\n
theater	<h3>theater</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>剧场,戏院,电影院,阶梯教室,手术教室,手术室,全体观众,戏剧<br>\n
theatre	<h3>theatre</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>戏院; 剧院; 露天剧场;<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her mother never went to the theatre.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她母亲从不去戏院看戏。</font><br>戏剧; 戏剧界<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I am confident you would succeed in the theatre.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我相信你在戏剧界会成功的。</font><br>阶梯教室, 放映室, 礼堂<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We will have class in the theatre this afternoon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 今天下午我们将在阶梯教室上课。</font><br>场所, 战区<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The South Pacific was the theatre for much of the action in the Second World War.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 南太平洋是第二次世界大战中许多战斗的战场。</font><br>手术室<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The patient was sent to the theatre.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 病人被送到了手术室。</font><br>\n
theft	<h3>theft</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>偷盗, 偷窃<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was arrested for theft.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他因盗窃而被送进了监狱。</font><br>盗窃之物<br>失窃案例<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There have been several thefts in this area.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这一地区发生了几起盗窃案。</font><br>\n
their	<h3>their</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>pron.</i></font><br>他[她, 它]们的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Take a note of their names and addresses.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把他们的姓名和地址记下来。</font><br>\n
theirs	<h3>theirs</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>pron.</i></font><br>他[她, 它]们的(东西)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our house is white; theirs is brown.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们的房子是白色的, 他们的是棕色的。</font><br>\n
them	<h3>them</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>pron.</i></font><br>(they的宾格)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is a secret between them and me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是我和他们之间的秘密。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If anybody phones, tell them I'm busy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 要是有人打电话来, 告诉他我很忙。</font><br>\n
theme	<h3>theme</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>主题, 主旨, 题目<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Waterfalls are from very early times a favourite theme for the painter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 从很早时候起, 瀑布就是画家所喜爱的题材。</font><br>\n
themselves	<h3>themselves</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>pron.</i></font><br>他[她, 它]们自己<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You had better ask the students themselves.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你最好问问那些学生本人。</font><br>\n
then	<h3>then</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>当时, 那时<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was travelling in Europe then.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那时我正在欧洲旅行。</font><br>接着, 于是, 然后<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We had dinner together, and then went to the concert.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们一起进晚餐, 然后去参加音乐会。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Then came the day of his examination.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 接着到了他考试的日子。</font><br>还有, 而且<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Then there is Mr. Smith.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 还有史密斯先生。</font><br>那么; 因此<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You say you don't want to call a doctor.Then what do you want to do?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你说你不想请医生, 那么你想怎么办?</font><br>\n
theoretical	<h3>theoretical</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>理论的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's a theoretical matter as well as a practical one.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这不仅是个实践问题, 也是个理论问题。</font><br>推想的, 假设的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's only a theoretical possibility.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这只是一种假设的可能性。</font><br>\n
theory	<h3>theory</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>学说<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There are many theories about the origin of life.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 关于生命起源的学说有很多。</font><br>理论, 原理<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Your plan sounds fine in theory.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你的计划在理论上听起来不错。</font><br>意见, 看法<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She has a theory that drinking milk prevents colds.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她有一种说法, 认为喝牛奶能防止感冒。</font><br>\n
therapy	<h3>therapy</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>疗法<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The doctor said she should be given a physical therapy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 医生说她应该进行理疗。</font><br>\n
there	<h3>there</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>在那里, 往那里<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We like the restaurant so much that we're going to eat there next time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们很喜欢那家餐厅, 所以下次还要去那里。</font><br>那里, 那个<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The girls there can sing and dance.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那里的女孩子都能歌善舞。</font><br>在那一点上, 关于那一点<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There I have to disagree with you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在那一点上我不能同意你的意见。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>pron.</i></font><br>(用于表示某物或某人的存在或某事的发生, 常用作be, seem或appear的主语)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There are a wall and a tree behind the house.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 房子后面有一堵墙和一棵树。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There appears to be a mistake.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 好像有一个错误。</font><br>\n
thereby	<h3>thereby</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>由此; 因而<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He became a British citizen, thereby gaining the right to vote.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他成了英国公民, 因而得到了投票权。</font><br>\n
therefore	<h3>therefore</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>因此, 为此, 所以<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They therefore can do nothing good of themselves.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 所以他们靠自己是什么好事也做不成的。</font><br>故…; 由此得出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I think, therefore I am.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我思故我在。</font><br>\n
thermometer	<h3>thermometer</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>温度计, 体温表<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She put the thermometer in his mouth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把体温表放入他口中。</font><br>\n
these	<h3>these</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj., pron.</i></font><br>this的复数<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These are my books.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些是我的书。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These books are mine.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些书是我的。</font><br>\n
they	<h3>they</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>pron.</i></font><br>他[她, 它]们<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp John and Susan phoned.They're coming round this evening.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 约翰和苏珊来了电话, 他们今晚要来。</font><br>人们, 大家<br>政府, 当局<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They're putting up oil prices again soon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当局即将再次提高油价。</font><br>\n
thick	<h3>thick</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>厚的, 粗的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was still wearing her thick coat.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她还穿着那件厚外套。</font><br>稠密的, 密集的, 茂密的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Thick liquid pours much more slowly than thin liquid.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 稠的液体倒出来比稀的慢。</font><br>浓的; 黏稠的<br>很明显的, 重的; 不清楚的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Grandfather spoke with a thick Scottish brogue.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 祖父说话带有很重的苏格兰土腔。</font><br>充满的; 布满的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The train was thick with students.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 车上挤满了学生。</font><br>\n
thief	<h3>thief</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>小偷, 盗贼<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The thief was trapped by the police in an old house.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 小偷被警察困在一所旧房子里。</font><br>\n
thin	<h3>thin</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>薄的; 细的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She should wear a thinner shirt in summer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 夏天她应该穿薄一点的衬衫。</font><br>稀的, 稀疏的, 稀少的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I have thin hair.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我头发很稀。</font><br>瘦的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There were two girls there, a fat one and a thin one.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那儿有两个姑娘, 一个胖的, 一个瘦的。</font><br>弱的, 缺乏力量的, 浅薄的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His excuse for being late was very thin.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他迟到的借口是无法使人相信的。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使)变稀薄, (使)变稀少, (使)变细<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His hair is thinning.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的头发逐渐稀少了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He thinned the wine by adding water.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他往酒里加水把它稀释。</font><br>\n
thing	<h3>thing</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>物, 东西<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Pack your things.We're going to leave.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把你的东西收拾好, 我们就要走了。</font><br>人, 动物 ; 衣服<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He's been very ill, poor thing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他病得很厉害, 可怜的家伙。</font><br>需要之物, 想要之物<br>想法, 意见, 观念<br>行动, 行为, 事件<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That sort of thing is quite occasional and not regular.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那种事十分偶然, 没有规律。</font><br>题目; 事情<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is a miraculous thing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这真是奇怪的事。</font><br>所有物, 财产; 用品, 工具<br>情况; 形势<br>\n
think	<h3>think</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>想, 思索<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is so noisy here that I can't think.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这里太吵了, 我没法思考。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm trying to think how to get there.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我在苦苦思索如何赶到那儿。</font><br>以为; 认为<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She seems to think otherwise.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她好像不以为是这样。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm not sure, but I rather think so.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我没有什么把握, 但认为很可能如此。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>料想; 想像; 预料到<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Who'd have thought such a thing?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 谁能料到有这样的事呢?</font><br>\n
thinking	<h3>thinking</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>思想, 思考<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp An accident was averted by his quick thinking.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 由于他思路敏捷, 避免了一场事故的发生。</font><br>想法; 意见; 见解<br>\n
third	<h3>third</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>num.</i></font><br>第三<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I got the third prize in the race.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我在赛跑中得了三等奖。</font><br>\n
thirst	<h3>thirst</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>(口)渴; 渴感<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This kind of work gives me a thirst.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种工作使我感到口渴。</font><br>长期的干渴<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The soldiers died of thirst in the desert.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 士兵们在沙漠中因长期的干渴而死亡。</font><br>渴望; 渴求<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He had a great thirst for knowledge.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他渴求知识。</font><br>\n
thirsty	<h3>thirsty</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>口渴的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They watered the thirsty fields.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们给干旱的土地灌水。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He became thirsty with running.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他跑渴了。</font><br>渴望[求]…的<br>\n
thirteen	<h3>thirteen</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>num.</i></font><br>十三<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Many people think thirteen is an evil number.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 很多人认为十三是个不吉利的数字。</font><br>\n
thirty	<h3>thirty</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>num.</i></font><br>三十<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Thirty is an even number.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 三十是个偶数。</font><br>\n
this	<h3>this</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>(指已知的或即将提到的人、事物、主意)这, 这个, 此, 本<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mosquitoes are extremely abundant in this dark wet place.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个阴暗潮湿的地方蚊子非常多。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This book of Joe's is very amusing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 乔的这本书非常有趣。</font><br>(时间、地点、思想等)较近的一个, 这一个<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They have built three nuclear power stations this year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们今年建造了三座核电站。</font><br>〈非正〉某个<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This little daughter of his is very clever.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的这个小女儿真聪明。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>pron.</i></font><br>这个, 这事<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is the man you are going to see, isn't it?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这就是你要见的那个人, 对吗?</font><br>这<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I am one with you on this.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在这一点上, 我和你的意见是一致的。</font><br>这时; 这里<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I thought he'd have got back before this.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我以为他会在这之前回来的。</font><br>\n
thorough	<h3>thorough</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>彻底的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Give the room a thorough clean.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把房间彻底打扫一下。</font><br>十足的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is a thorough fool.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是个地地道道的傻瓜。</font><br>考虑周到的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She's very thorough.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她非常细心。</font><br>\n
those	<h3>those</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj., pron.</i></font><br>that的复数<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Who are those people?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那些人是谁?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Those who failed the exam take a makeup exam.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这次考试不及格的人必须参加补考。</font><br>\n
though	<h3>though</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>conj.</i></font><br>虽然; 尽管<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Though he's fool, I like him nonetheless.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 虽然他很笨, 我仍然喜欢他。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's quite pleasant today, though the wind is rather cool.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 尽管风有点凉, 今天天气还是很不错的。</font><br>然而; 但是<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She'll probably disagree, though it's worth trying.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她很可能不同意, 但不妨去试一下。</font><br>\n
thought	<h3>thought</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>思索, 思维能力; 思考的过程<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After some thought he hit on a plan to route the enemy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他经过一番思考, 想到了一个打垮敌人的办法。</font><br>思想, 思潮<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His thought is beyond the reach of my imagination.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的思想不是我所能想像得到的。</font><br>关心, 注意, 考虑<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The nurse is always full of thought for her patients.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这名护士对病人总是关心备至。</font><br>想法, 观点<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Why do you hide your thoughts from me?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你为什么对我隐瞒你的想法?</font><br>意向, 意图<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She had no thought of going.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她没有走的意向。</font><br>\n
thoughtful	<h3>thoughtful</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>沉思的, 思考的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He had a thoughtful look on his face.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他脸上露出深思的表情。</font><br>体贴的, 关心的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is thoughtful for her friends.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她很体贴她的朋友们。</font><br>\n
thousand	<h3>thousand</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>num.</i></font><br>一千<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There are thousands of people on the square.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 广场上有成千上万的人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has collected more than a thousand stamps.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他已收集了一千多张邮票。</font><br>\n
thread	<h3>thread</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>线; 细线<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My thread has knotted.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的线打结了。</font><br>线索, 思路<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is a consistent thread running through all these policies.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 所有这些政策中贯穿着一条始终如一的主线。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>将(针、线等)穿过…<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The child threaded the beads.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这孩子用线把珠子串起来。</font><br>将(影片)装入放映机<br>\n
threat	<h3>threat</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>威胁, 恐吓<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His threats are just talk.Don't worry!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的威胁只不过是虚张声势的空话而已, 不要担心！</font><br>可能造成威胁的人[事, 想法]<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The use of nuclear weapons is a horrible threat to the species.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 核武器对人类是一个严重威胁。</font><br>恶兆, 兆头<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The threat of bankruptcy hung over the company.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那家公司出现了破产的预兆。</font><br>\n
threaten	<h3>threaten</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>恐吓, 威胁<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They entreated and threatened, but all this seemed of no avail.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们时而恳求, 时而威胁, 但这一切看来都没有用。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The boss threatened to fire her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 老板威胁要开除她。</font><br>预示(某事)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The black clouds threaten a storm.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 乌云预示暴风雨的来临。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>似将发生<br>\n
three	<h3>three</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>num.</i></font><br>三<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They left by twos and threes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们三三两两地离开。</font><br>\n
thrill	<h3>thrill</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>强烈的兴奋、恐惧或快乐感<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His speech caused a thrill among the audience.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的演说引起了听众的极大兴奋。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使)兴奋, (使)激动<br>\n

thrive	<h3>thrive</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>兴盛; 兴隆<br>长得健壮<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Few plants or animals thrive in the desert.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 极少数植物或动物能在沙漠中茁壮成长。</font><br>\n
throat	<h3>throat</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>咽喉, 嗓子<br>颈<br>\n
through	<h3>through</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>prep.</i></font><br>(表示位置)在…之中; 在…各处; 遍及<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The earth moves through space.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 地球在太空中运行。</font><br>(表示时间)在…期间; 从…开头到结尾<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Tom bore up bravely through his father's illness.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在他父亲生病期间, 汤姆表现得很坚强勇敢。</font><br>(表示方向)从…的一端到另一端; 经过<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He went through the forest the next day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 次日他穿过了森林。</font><br>(表示状态)经历着; 度过<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has decided to prolong his visit through the weekend.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他已决定把他的访问延长到过完周末。</font><br>(表示方式)凭借; 用<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I learnt of the position through a newspaper advertisement.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我是从报纸广告上得悉有此职位的。</font><br>(表示原因)因为, 由于<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was through him that I missed my train.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 就是因为他, 我才误了火车。</font><br>(表示让步)尽管有(反对、抗议等)的声音; 顶着<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The politician struggled to speak through the shouts of the crowd.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 尽管人群中不断有叫喊声, 那位政客仍然坚持讲下去。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>通过, 过去<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can I get through by this road?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我可以从这条路过去吗?</font><br>进行到底<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm counting on you to help me through!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我正指望你帮忙帮到底呢！</font><br>\n
throughout	<h3>throughout</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>prep.</i></font><br>(表示时间)自始至终; 在…期间<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It poured with rain throughout the night.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大雨下了整整一夜。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They sang songs throughout the trip.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 整个旅途中他们歌声不断。</font><br>(表示区域)遍及…地域; 遍及…场所<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I have traveled throughout Europe.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我已游历了整个欧洲。</font><br>\n
throw	<h3>throw</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>投; 掷; 扔; 抛<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's my turn to throw.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 轮到我投了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He threw his last four grenades.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他投出了最后四颗手榴弹。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Throw me that book.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把那本书扔给我。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was thrown a book.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有人扔给他一本书。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He threw some coins to the beggar.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他向乞丐丢去了几个硬币。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He threw the door open and walked in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他猛地把门打开, 走了进去。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>投, 掷, 抛<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He made a nice throw.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他掷得好。</font><br>投掷的距离<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She achieved a throw of sixty metres in the javelin event.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在掷标枪项目中, 她掷了60米远。</font><br>\n
thrust	<h3>thrust</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>猛推, 猛塞<br>刺, 戳<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The tree thrusts its branches high.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这棵树的枝条伸得高高的。</font><br>\n
thumb	<h3>thumb</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>拇指<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This glove has a hole in the thumb.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这只手套的大拇指处有个洞。</font><br>\n
thunder	<h3>thunder</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>雷声<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There was a loud crash of thunder and large drops of rain started falling.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当时雷声大作, 大滴大滴的雨点开始落下来。</font><br>隆隆的响声<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He bowed to the thunder of applause from the audience.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他鞠躬答谢观众席上发出的雷鸣般的掌声。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>打雷<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is thundering.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 正在打雷。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It thundered, but no rain fell.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 光打雷不下雨。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>发出隆隆声<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The guns thundered in the distance.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 炮声在远处隆隆作响。</font><br>\n
Thursday	<h3>Thursday</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>星期四<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mrs. Jones is at home on Thursday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 琼斯太太每星期四在家接待客人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She works Thursdays.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她每星期四上班。</font><br>\n
thus	<h3>thus</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>以此方式, 如此, 这样<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Thus the question was finally settled.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个问题最终就这样解决了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Its people were thus reduced to slavery.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 就这样, 它的人民都沦为奴隶了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Italy had thus practically declared her independence.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 意大利几乎就是这样宣告独立了。</font><br>其结果是, 因此, 于是<br>\n
tick	<h3>tick</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>钟的嘀嗒声<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The silence was broken only by the tick of the clock.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 除了时钟的滴答声外, 一片寂静。</font><br>(表示正确无误的)记号<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He put a tick by her name on the list.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在名单上他在她的名字旁打了一个勾号。</font><br>证券价格的增额<br>(寄生于体大动物的吸血小虫)壁虱<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>发出滴答声<br>标以记号<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He ticked the items one by one.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把这些项目一个个标出记号。</font><br>激怒<br>\n
ticket	<h3>ticket</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>票<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please show your ticket to the stewardess when you board the plane.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 登机时请向空中小姐出示机票。</font><br>标签<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The sales ticket says the coat is 2００.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这件外套售价标签上标明是200美元。</font><br>交通违规的通知单, 罚款单<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The driver got a ticket for speeding.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 司机超速行驶, 接到违章罚单。</font><br>〈美〉候选人名单<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The governor ran on the Democratic ticket.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 州长参加了民主党的竞选。</font><br>\n
tide	<h3>tide</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>潮, 潮汐<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The tide is in[out].</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 涨[退]潮了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The ships departed on the tide.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那几艘船在涨潮时启航。</font><br>潮水<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Strong tides make swimming dangerous.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在汹涌的潮水中游泳是危险的。</font><br>潮流, 趋势<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The tide of the battle turned against us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 战况变得对我们不利。</font><br>\n
tidy	<h3>tidy</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>整洁的, 整齐的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was shown into a tidy living room.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我被引到一间很整洁的起居室里。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His bedroom was not very tidy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的卧室不太整齐。</font><br>〈口〉(数量)相当大的; 可观的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That must have cost you a tidy sum.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那必定让你花了一大笔钱。</font><br>\n
tie	<h3>tie</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>领带, 领结<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He always wears a shirt and tie.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他总是穿衬衫打领带。</font><br>关系; 联系<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They have ties with an American corporation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们与美国一家公司有关系。</font><br>束缚, 牵连, 累赘<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Family ties have kept him from success.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 家庭束缚使他没有成功。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>系, 拴, 绑<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He tied the parcel.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他捆上包裹。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>打结; 系上<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is a rope too heavy to tie.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是一根重得不能打结的绳子。</font><br>\n
tiger	<h3>tiger</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>老虎<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A cat is similar to a tiger in many respects.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 猫和虎在很多方面相似。</font><br>凶猛的人, 勇士, 猛士<br>\n
tight	<h3>tight</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>牢的; 紧的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She took a tight hold of his arm.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她紧紧地抓住他的胳膊。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Top of the bottle was tight; he couldn't get it off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 瓶盖封得太紧, 他打不开。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The box is so tight that I can't open it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个盒子太紧, 我打不开。</font><br>紧身的, 紧贴的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was wearing a tight dress.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她当时穿着紧身衣服。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can't take my boots off;  they're so tight!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 靴子太紧了, 我脱不下来！</font><br>(安排)紧凑的, 紧密的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I've got a very tight schedule today so I can't see you until tomorrow.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 今天我的日程已经排得很满, 所以明天才能见你。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Time is going to be tight, so you'd better hurry.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 时间很紧, 你最好抓紧一点。</font><br>不漏的, 不透的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Are you sure this roof is completely tight?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你能肯定这个屋顶一点都不漏吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There was tight security at the airport when the President's plane landed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 总统的专机降落时, 机场的保安措施很严密。</font><br>银根紧的, 难借得到的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Money is tight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 银根很紧。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He's really tight with money.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他真是一毛不拔。</font><br>\n
till	<h3>till</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>conj.</i></font><br>直到…时(为止)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please wait for me till I come back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请等我回来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I sat up till she came back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我一直坐到她回来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I waited till they should return.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我一直等到他们回来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He will wait till I arrive.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他将等到我来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He had hardly reached the station till the train arrived.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他刚到火车站, 火车就进站了。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>prep.</i></font><br>(表示时间)直到(某一时刻)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They talked till dawn.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们一直谈到天明。</font><br>(表示时间)直到(发生某事)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was not till 11 o'clock that he came back last night.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 昨晚直到11点他才回来。</font><br>\n
timber	<h3>timber</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>木料, 木材<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The timber has started to decay.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 木材已开始腐烂。</font><br>树木, 横梁<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A timber fell from the roof.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一根横梁从屋顶落下。</font><br>\n
time	<h3>time</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>时间<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The philosopher speculated about time and space.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这位哲学家在思索时间和空间问题。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What time is it?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 现在几点钟?</font><br>次, 回<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He told the same style old jokes I've heard fifty times before.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他讲的老笑话, 我已听过五十遍了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When I saw him the second time, he had already got married.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我第二次见到他时, 他已结婚了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Three times four is[are] twelve.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 三乘四等于十二。</font><br>时代, 时期<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It doesn't meet the requirements of the times.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 它不适应时代的要求。</font><br>时机, 做某种活动的时候<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This time is ripe for action.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 采取行动的时机已经成熟。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is high time for action.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 该采取行动了。</font><br>\n
timetable	<h3>timetable</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>交通工具的运行时间表<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Look up the trains to Beijing in the timetable.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 查火车时刻表上到北京的列车。</font><br>计划; 时间表<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There are ten English classes listed in the timetable.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 课表上列有10节英语课。</font><br>\n
tin	<h3>tin</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>锡<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Is that box made of tin or steel?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个盒子是锡做的还是铁做的?</font><br>罐头盒<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I never eat anything out of a tin.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我从来不吃罐头食品。</font><br>\n
tiny	<h3>tiny</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>极小的, 微小的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The baby put his tiny hand in mine.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个婴儿把小手放在我的手中。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I live in a tiny cottage.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我住在一间极小的茅屋里。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Some stars look as tiny as pinheads, but they are even bigger than the sun in fact.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有些星星看起来像针头一样小, 但它们实际上甚至比太阳还大。</font><br>\n
tip	<h3>tip</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>尖端, 末端<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That stick has a metal tip.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那根手杖的顶端是铁的。</font><br>(装在某物顶端的)小部分, 小物件<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使)某物侧边提高, 倾斜, 翻倒<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The boat tipped to one side.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 船向一边倾斜。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He tipped his soup bowl towards himself.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把汤碗歪向自己。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>将(所盛之物)倒出<br>给小费<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Did you tip the waiter?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你给那侍者小费没有?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I tipped the porter 50p.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我给了搬运工人50便士小费。</font><br>轻打<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The sword tipped his shoulder.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 剑轻轻触到他的肩。</font><br>就(某人或某事物)提出意见[建议]<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He tipped me the wink not to buy at that price.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他眨眼暗示我按那个价格就不要买。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Ade has been widely tipped as the Prime Minister.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 很多人认为艾德将继任首相。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mr. Smith is being widely tipped to succeed the next President.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 人们普遍猜测史密斯先生将任下一届总统。</font><br>\n
tire	<h3>tire</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使)疲劳<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Young children tire quickly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 幼童一下子就累了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Walking quickly tires me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 快速步行使我疲倦。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>对(做)某事感到厌倦<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He soon tires.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他不久就厌倦了。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>〈美〉轮胎<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The tires of the earliest cars were solid.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 最早的汽车轮胎是实心的。</font><br>\n
tired	<h3>tired</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>疲倦的; 困倦的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp John was a tired man when he got back from the long journey.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 约翰长途旅行后感到疲倦了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is dead tired.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他疲倦极了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was too tired to continue.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她太疲劳无法继续下去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm so tired that I could sleep for a week.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我真是累极了, 简直能睡上一个星期。</font><br>对…不耐烦的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm tired of your stupid remarks.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我听烦了你的蠢话。</font><br>陈旧的; 陈腐的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The scripts had a rather tired plot.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这部陈旧的剧本的情节是非常俗套的。</font><br>\n
tissue	<h3>tissue</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>组织<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The teacher showed the students the pictures of brain tissues.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 老师给学生们看脑组织的图片。</font><br>薄纸, 棉纸<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Give some face tissues to me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 给我些面巾纸。</font><br>一套, 一系列<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What he said is a tissue of lies.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他所说的是一派谎言。</font><br>\n
title	<h3>title</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>题目, 标题<br>称号, 头衔<br>权益, 权利<br>冠军<br>\n
to	<h3>to</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>prep.</i></font><br>(表示时间)到, 直到, 在…到来之前, 离…<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The Parliament was prorogued to the tenth of February.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 议会休会到二月十日。</font><br>(表示方向)朝, 往, 通向<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He turned to his companion before he replied.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他转身朝向他的伙伴然后回答。</font><br>(表示状态)紧贴着, 紧靠着, 对着<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The two lovers danced cheek to cheek.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那对情侣脸贴着脸跳舞。</font><br>(表示对象)对, 对于, 对…来说<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What will Doris say to it?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 对此事多丽丝将怎么说呢?</font><br>(表示比较)比, 相对于<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The men are noodles to her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 与她相比, 这些男人都是笨蛋。</font><br>(表示方位)在…方向[方位], 处于…顺序<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Scotland is to the north of England.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 苏格兰在英格兰之北。</font><br>(表示距离)离, 距离<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is ten kilometres to the station.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 到车站十公里。</font><br>(表示目标)到达, 直到<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We came to a picturesque cottage.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们来到一座风景如画的村落。</font><br>(表示结果)转换为, 转变为, 趋于<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Wait until the lights change to green.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 等交通灯变成绿色再走。</font><br>\n
toast	<h3>toast</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>烤面包, 吐司<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I ate two slices of toast.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我吃了两片吐司。</font><br>干杯; 祝酒词<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I suggest to propose a toast to our friendship.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我建议为我们的友谊干杯。</font><br>接受敬酒的人<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The old man was the toast of the whole neighbourhood.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这老人受到邻里的交口称赞。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>烤<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The bread toasts well.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这面包烤得很好。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She toasted slices of bread for refreshments.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她烤了几片面包当茶点。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I toasted the bread very dark.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我把面包烤得很焦。</font><br>向…祝酒, 为…干杯<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let's all toast the bride and bridegroom.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 让我们为新郎新娘干杯。</font><br>\n
tobacco	<h3>tobacco</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>烟草, 烟叶<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This shop is licensed to sell tobacco.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这家商店获准经销烟草商品。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is a mild tobacco.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是一种味淡的烟。</font><br>\n
today	<h3>today</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>(在)今天<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The meeting today is very important.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 今天的会议很重要。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They are coming here today week.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们将在下星期的今天来这里。</font><br>现在, 现今, 现代<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Full-length coats are vogue today.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如今流行长外套。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>今天<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Today is Sunday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 今天是礼拜天。</font><br>现代, 当代<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is a writer of today.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是位当代作家。</font><br>\n
toe	<h3>toe</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>脚趾; 足尖部<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He stepped on my toes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他踩着我的脚趾了。</font><br>\n
together	<h3>together</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>在一起; 共同<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They often confer together.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们经常在一起协商。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He did more than the rest of us did together.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他做的比我们其余人合在一起做的还要多。</font><br>同时, 一齐<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't all speak together.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要都同时说话。</font><br>一致地, 协调地<br>不间断地; 连续地<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The man talked for hours together.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个人一连讲了几个小时。</font><br>\n
toilet	<h3>toilet</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>厕所, 洗手间<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The living room connects with the toilet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 客厅与洗手间相连。</font><br>〈旧〉洗漱, 打扮<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She made a grand toilet as if for a ball.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她盛装打扮好像要去参加舞会似的。</font><br>\n
token	<h3>token</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>代币<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The council gives old people free tokens.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 委员会发给老年人免费代金券。</font><br>象征<br>\n
tolerance	<h3>tolerance</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>宽容, 容忍<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has a sense of humour plus tolerance and patience.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他具有幽默感又能宽容和忍耐。</font><br>忍耐力<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Human beings have limited tolerance of noise.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 人类对噪音的忍耐力有限。</font><br>偏差, 公差<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It has a tolerance of 0.001 of an inch.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 允许有0.001英寸的偏差。</font><br>\n
tolerate	<h3>tolerate</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>容许; 承认<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The teacher cannot tolerate eating on the class.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 老师不容许在课堂上吃东西。</font><br>忍受; 容忍<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She can tolerate that rude fellow.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她能容忍那个粗鲁的家伙。</font><br>\n
toll	<h3>toll</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>通行费<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A man collected tolls at the gateway.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一个人在大门口收通行费。</font><br>慢而有节奏的声音<br>损耗<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>缓慢敲响<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A remote bell is tolling.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 远处的钟声响了。</font><br>\n
tomato	<h3>tomato</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>番茄, 西红柿<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They planted tomatoes in the field this year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们今年在地里种的是西红柿。</font><br>\n
tomorrow	<h3>tomorrow</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>明天<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Tomorrow will be Saturday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 明天是星期六。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let me look at tomorrow's arrangements.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 让我看一下明天的安排。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We put there for the night and set out on the tomorrow.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们在那里住了一晚, 并于翌日动身。</font><br>将来, 未来<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The cars for tomorrow will be small, safe and very cheap.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 未来的汽车小型、安全, 而且价格十分便宜。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>(在)明天<br>\n
ton	<h3>ton</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>吨<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The ship has a cargo of about 200 ton.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这条船大约有200吨的货物。</font><br>大量, 许多<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I've got tons of work to do.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我有好多工作要做。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It will save a ton of money.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这会节省很多钱。</font><br>\n
tone	<h3>tone</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>腔调, 语气<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His tone is rather unfriendly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的口气很不友好。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don't like your tone of voice.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不喜欢你说话的腔调。</font><br>音, 音调<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This violin has very good tone.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这把小提琴的音色很好。</font><br>风格; 气度<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The lady has real tone.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这位女士气度非凡。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These dreadful people bring down the tone of the neighbourhood.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些讨厌的人败坏了这一地带的风气。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>给(某物)定调子或色调<br>\n

too	<h3>too</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>也, 还<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They are coming tomorrow and I hope you will come too.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们明天要来, 我希望你也来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Here, too, the colon must be followed by a dash.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这里也是一样, 应当在冒号后加破折号。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Too, the reader will find in this book many interesting illustrations.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 读者还能在书中看到许多有趣的插图。</font><br>太, 过于<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was evidently too tired to go any further.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他显然太疲劳, 一步也走不动了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This box is too heavy to be lifted.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这箱子太重搬不起来。</font><br>很, 非常<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Beginners are too apt to make mistakes in grammar.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 初学者极易犯语法错误。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We are all too pleased to listen to the opinions of other.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们非常乐意听别人的意见。</font><br>\n
tool	<h3>tool</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>工具, 用具<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I have a complete set of carpenter's tools.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我有全套的木工工具。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The king was just the tool of the military government.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 国王只是军政府的一个傀儡。</font><br>\n
tooth	<h3>tooth</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>牙, 齿<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I went to my dentist to have a tooth taken out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我去找牙医拔了一颗牙。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The dentist took out two of my teeth and asked me to come back again to have further treatment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 牙医拔掉了我两颗牙, 并让我再来做进一步的治疗。</font><br>\n
top	<h3>top</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>顶, 顶部<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When you reach the top of the hill, bear to the right.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当你到达山顶时, 向右转。</font><br>上部, 上端<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She feared for the little boy when she saw him at the top of the tree.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她看到那个小男孩在树顶上时, 着实替他捏了一把汗。</font><br>首位, 最高位, 精华<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is at the top of his class.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是班上最优秀的学生。</font><br>盖<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That top belongs to this box.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个盖子是这个盒子的。</font><br>陀螺<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>最高的, 最优良的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There was a fire in the top story of the building.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大楼的顶层着火了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is top in French.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的法语学得最好。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>给…加顶; 给…盖盖子<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is going to top the barn tomorrow.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他打算明天给粮仓封顶。</font><br>达到…的顶端<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A church tops the hill.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 山顶有一座教堂。</font><br>超过; 胜过; 高过<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He tops the rest in scholarship.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的学识超过其他人。</font><br>\n
topic	<h3>topic</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>题目, 论题, 话题<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The book jumps from one topic to another.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这本书从一个主题跳到另一个主题。</font><br>\n
