uncover	<h3>uncover</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>揭开…的盖子<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please uncover the pot.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请拿掉锅盖。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In spring we uncover the swimming pool.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 春天我们移去游泳池的覆盖物。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The dish had been uncovered when I entered the kitchen.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我进厨房时, 那盘菜已被掀开。</font><br>揭露, 发现<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was two young reporters who uncovered the whole plot.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 是两位年轻记者揭露了整个阴谋。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Geologists uncovered the hidden riches.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 地质学家发现了地下的宝藏。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We ought to look below the surface of things and then uncover the essence of them.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们应该透过事物的表面进行观察, 然后揭示其本质。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His criminal activities were finally uncovered.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的犯罪活动最终被揭露出来。</font><br>\n
under	<h3>under</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>prep.</i></font><br>在…下面, 在…底下<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They lay down under the shade of a tree.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们躺在一棵树的树阴下。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The village nestles under the hill.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那村庄紧靠在山脚下。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All this happened under his eye.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这一切都发生在他的眼皮底下。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was carrying her handbag under her armpit when I saw her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我看到她时, 她腋下夹着手提包。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The old chair suddenly folded up under him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那张旧椅子让他一坐突然被压垮了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This field has been laid under grass.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这块地已经长满了草。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The soldiers stood firm under gunfire of the enemy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 士兵在敌人的炮火下不屈不挠。</font><br>少于, 低于<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His income is under ￡2000 a year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他每年的收入不到两千英镑。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is under the original.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这低于原价。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He cannot be under thirty years of age.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的年龄不会小于三十岁。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It took us under a day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们用了不到一天的时间。</font><br>在…情况下, 在…过程中<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The car is under repairs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这辆汽车在修理中。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't overload your lecture with details that do not bear on the topic under discussion.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 讲课时不要过多地谈与本题无关的细节。</font><br>在…管辖下; 在…影响下<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She has three secretaries under her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她手下有三名秘书。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The army is under the command of General Smith.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这支部队由史密斯将军指挥。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We learned a great deal under her teaching.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在她的教导下我们学到了很多东西。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This falls under the head rhetoric.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个属于修辞学项目。</font><br>使用(某名称)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He never wrote under his real name.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他从来不用真名实姓写作。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He didn't attend that meeting under the pretext of sickness.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他以生病为借口, 没参加那个会议。</font><br>根据…的条款<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Under the terms of the agreement, you have to pay a weekly rent.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 根据这份协议的条款, 你得支付一周的房租。</font><br>\n
undergo	<h3>undergo</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>经历, 承受<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He underwent a lot of hardships in his childhood.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在童年时代经历了许多坎坷。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The explorers had to undergo much suffering.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 探险者不得不忍受很多困苦。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This new plane is undergoing safety tests.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这架新型飞机正在接受安全试验。</font><br>\n
undergraduate	<h3>undergraduate</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>(未获学士学位的)大学生, 大学肄业生<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is a course for undergraduates.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是为本科生开的一门课。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mr. Stone spent his undergraduate days in Columbia University, majoring in economics.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 斯通先生在哥伦比亚大学度过了他四年的大学生活, 主修经济学。</font><br>\n
underground	<h3>underground</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>地下的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is an underground park here.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这里有一个地下停车场。</font><br>地下组织的, 秘密的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The spy never told his family about his underground activities.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个间谍从来不把他的地下活动告诉他的家人。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>在地下<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The railway track goes underground for a short distance.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 铁轨有一段不长的路程铺设在地下。</font><br>秘密地<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The news has been passed on underground.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这消息被秘密传开来。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>地铁<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp London has a well-developed underground system.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 伦敦的地铁很发达。</font><br>地下组织或活动<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His father is a member of the underground.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他父亲是一名地下组织的成员。</font><br>\n
underline	<h3>underline</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>在…下面画线<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Underline the sentence.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在这个句子下面画线。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please underline the noun clauses in the passage.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请用线画出短文中的名词性从句。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He underlined his signature with a little flourish.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他挥笔在签名下画了一条线。</font><br>加强, 强调<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That article underlined the same problem.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那篇文章强调了同一个问题。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In his speech he underlined several points.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在讲话中强调了几点。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She underlined her disapproval of the proceedings by walking out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她退席以表示不赞成这些做法。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The sudden summoning of the Cabinet underlines the seriousness of the situation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 内阁会议的突然召开, 突出了局势的严重性。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The accident at the factory underlines the need of better safety standards.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 工厂里发生的事故表明了需要更高的安全标准。</font><br>\n
undermine	<h3>undermine</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>在某物下挖洞或挖通道; 侵蚀…的基础<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Badgers had undermined the foundations of the church.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 獾在这座教堂的地基处打了洞。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The soldiers undermined the wall.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 士兵们在墙下挖洞。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Rivers undermine their banks.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 河水冲刷堤基。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The house is unsafe since the foundations were undermined by floods.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这栋房子不安全, 因为地基被洪水损坏了。</font><br>暗中破坏; 逐渐削弱<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Illness undermined his strength.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 疾病逐渐削弱了他的力气。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Many severe colds undermined the old man's health.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 多次严重的感冒损害了老人的健康。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Insults undermined her confidence.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一再受到侮辱之后, 她渐渐丧失信心。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She tried to undermine our friendship.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她试图破坏我们的友谊。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These incidents could seriously undermine support for the police.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些事件会严重影响对警方的支持。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The President's enemies are spreading rumours to undermine his authority.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 总统的敌人在散布谣言以逐渐破坏他的威信。</font><br>\n
underneath	<h3>underneath</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>prep.</i></font><br>在…下面; 在…底下<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The ball rolled underneath the table.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 球滚到了桌下。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What have you got underneath your shirt?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你的衬衫里面有什么?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He staggered underneath a burden.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在重负下摇摇晃晃。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They lived underneath a crushing tyranny.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们生活在难以忍受的暴政下。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Underneath his rather severe manner, he is really very kindhearted.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他待人态度相当严厉, 但心地确实十分善良。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>在下面[底下]<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Have you looked underneath?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那底下你找过了吗?</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>底面, 底部<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There's a crack on the underneath of the bowl.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 碗底有一道裂缝。</font><br>\n
understand	<h3>understand</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>懂; 理解<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I didn't understand.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不懂。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't always rely on others to understand and sympathize.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要老是指望别人的理解和同情。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My wife doesn't understand me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的妻子不了解我。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Do you understand French?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你懂法语吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can't understand neglecting children like that.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 对孩子这样毫不经意, 我不能理解。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can't understand him behaving like that.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不能理解他那种行为。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>听说, 获悉; 知道, 认为<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Do you understand what to do next?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你们知道下一步该做什么吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She doesn't understand how to look after you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她不知道应该怎么照顾你。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We understand that you'll be returning next year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们知道你打算明年回来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is understood that hard work can bring success.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不言而喻, 艰苦的工作可带来成功。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I understand him to be a distant relation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我知道他是一位远亲。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is understood to be a man of ability.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他被认为是一个有能力的人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I understood him to say that he wouldn't be able to come.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我听他说过他不能来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The President is understood to have secretly left the country.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 人们获悉总统已秘密地离开了这个国家。</font><br>\n
understanding	<h3>understanding</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>了解; 相互理解, 谅解; (非正式)协议<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This argument aimed at the understanding rather than the emotions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这场辩论针对的是理解而不是感情。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We have reached an understanding with them.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们和他们达成了协议。</font><br>理解(力); 认识<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His understanding of English is good.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他对英语的理解力很好。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We must have a clear understanding of the problem.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们对这一问题必须有一个清醒的认识。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>体谅的; 谅解的; 通情达理的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The youth was fortunate in having understanding parents.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个青年有通情达理的父母, 真幸运。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Because she is understanding, people around her confide in her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 因为她通情达理, 周围的人都相信她。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Try to be understanding.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请多谅解。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was understanding about what happened.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她了解所有发生的事。</font><br>\n
undertake	<h3>undertake</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>担任, 承揽; 保证<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I want you to undertake all the responsibility.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我要你承担所有的责任。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Who will undertake the job of decorating the auditorium?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 谁来负责装饰礼堂的工作?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'll leave you to undertake an important mission.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我要让你承担一项重要使命。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The lawyer undertook the case.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 该律师承办这个案子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He undertook the leadership of the team.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他担任了这个团队的领导。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If the equipment is not up to the agreed specifications and quality, we will undertake to replace them.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果设备达不到议定的规格质量, 我们将负责调换。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can undertake that you will enjoy the play.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我保证你会喜欢这个剧。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We can't undertake that you will make a profit.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们不能保证你会获利。</font><br>着手, 开始<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He undertakes a dangerous job.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他从事一项危险的工作。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Their team will undertake exploration for oil.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们队将着手进行石油勘探工作。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She undertook to revise my compositions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她着手批改我的作文。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Next he undertook to pay off the debts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 然后, 他负责偿还债务。</font><br>\n
undo	<h3>undo</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>松开, 解开<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you undo this knot?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你能解开这个结吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He undid the parcel.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他打开包裹。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He undid the string round a parcel.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他解开了绑包裹的绳子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He bent down and undid the laces of his shoes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他弯腰解开鞋带。</font><br>毁灭; 败坏<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His pride will undo him some day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的傲慢总有一天会毁了他。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He did wrong, and in the end his wrongs undid him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 行恶者终以其恶毁其身。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This mistake has undone all our good work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个错误使我们所有良好的工作白做了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The evil that he did can never be undone.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他做的坏事永远不会被抹掉。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What is done cannot be undone.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 覆水难收。</font><br>\n
undoubted	<h3>undoubted</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>无疑的; 肯定的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is undoubted star of British ballet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她是英国毋庸置疑的芭蕾明星。</font><br>\n
uneasy	<h3>uneasy</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>心神不安的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She had an uneasy feeling that they were still following her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她有一种他们仍在跟踪她的不安感觉。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He feels uneasy today.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他今天心里感到不安。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I am uneasy about this decision.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我为这一决定感到不安。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There was one thing that made me very uneasy after hearing what he had said.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 听了他的讲话后, 我感到非常不安。</font><br>不稳定的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The nuclear deterrent has maintained an uneasy peace.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 核威慑一直使和平处于不稳定状态。</font><br>不舒服的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She felt uneasy with her new in-laws.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她和新姻亲在一起感到不自在。</font><br>\n
unemployment	<h3>unemployment</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>失业<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The riots took place against a background of widespread unemployment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 暴乱是在普遍失业的情况下发生的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A rapid rise in price soon eventuated in mass unemployment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 物价迅速上涨, 结果造成了大量失业。</font><br>失业(人数), 失业率<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Unemployment among married women reached a peak.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在已婚女性中失业率达到了峰值。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is an equation between unemployment and rising crime levels.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 失业人数增加则犯罪数量增加。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Unemployment was high despite the gains of the civil rights movement.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 尽管民权运动有所进展, 失业率仍然很高。</font><br>\n
unexpected	<h3>unexpected</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>没有料想到的, 意外的, 突如其来的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is an unexpected guest to her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 对于她来说, 他可是位不速之客。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This was a sudden and unexpected blow.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是一个突如其来的意外打击。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His unexpected death is unexpected news.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的猝死是一个意外的消息。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His promotion was unexpected.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的升迁出人意料。</font><br>\n
unfair	<h3>unfair</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>不公正的; 不公平的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The referee made an unfair decision.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 裁判作出不公正的判决。</font><br>违反规则或准则的<br>\n
unfortunate	<h3>unfortunate</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>不幸的, 倒霉的; 时运不佳的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He hurled curses at the unfortunate man who had made the mistake.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他对着这个犯了错误的可怜人大声叫骂。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I count myself to be unfortunate.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我认为我自己时运不佳。</font><br>可叹的, 令人遗憾的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is indeed unfortunate!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那的确是令人遗憾的！</font><br>不合适的, 粗野的, 不得体的<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>不幸的人<br>\n
uniform	<h3>uniform</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>制服<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The new uniforms will arrive tomorrow.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 新制服明天就到。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Soldiers, policemen, and nurses wear uniforms.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 士兵、警察和护士们都穿制服。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was in uniform three years.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他服役三年。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>全都相同的, 一律的, 清一色的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The earth turns around at a uniform rate.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 地球以相同的速度旋转。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The windows in the house are all uniform.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 房子里的窗户都是一样的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They are uniform in size and shape.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 它们的大小和形状都相同。</font><br>\n
union	<h3>union</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>联合, 结合, 合并<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Union between the two countries would be impossible.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这两个国家的联合是不可能的。</font><br>联盟, 联邦; 工会; 俱乐部<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The President gave his speech on the state of the Union.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 总统发表了国情咨文演讲。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The Student Union is[are] holding election today.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 学生会今天举行选举。</font><br>和睦, 一致<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They lived in unspoilt union.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们和睦相处。</font><br>结婚, 婚姻<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp God will bless this union.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 愿上帝保佑这桩婚姻。</font><br>\n
unique	<h3>unique</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>独一无二的, 仅有的, 惟一的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I am in a rather unique position, as my job is different from anyone else's.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的情况很特殊, 因为我的工作与众不同。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The tranquil beauty of the village scenery is unique.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这乡村景色的宁静是绝无仅有的。</font><br>异常的, 特有的, 少见的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is a rather unique position.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是一个相当好的位置。</font><br>\n
unit	<h3>unit</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>(工作)单位<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The family is the basic unit of society.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 家庭是构成社会的基本单位。</font><br>(计量或计数用的)单位<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The metre is a unit of length.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 米是长度单位。</font><br>(课本中的)单元<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A Reading Practice section is added to each unit in Book Two.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在第二册书里每个单元都加上了阅读练习部分。</font><br>(特定功能的)装置<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All the units employ hollow burned-clay blocks as the basic raw material.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 所有构件都用空心陶土砖做基本原料。</font><br>\n
unite	<h3>unite</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使)联合; 合并; 统一<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The broken bones of a child unite easily.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 儿童的断骨容易接合。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They unite to form a new company.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们联合组成一个新公司。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A piece of wood unites the two parts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一块木头将两部分接合起来。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>团结<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They should be able to unite students.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们应该能团结同学。</font><br>\n
unity	<h3>unity</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>统一; 统一体<br>一致, 同心协力; 和谐<br>\n
universal	<h3>universal</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>全体的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His speech met with universal applause.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的演讲博得全场的喝彩。</font><br>广泛的, 普遍的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's a universal truth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是一个普遍真理。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These habits are both universal among mankind and peculiar to individuals.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些习惯在全人类中很普遍, 而对个人来说又很独特。</font><br>在世界各地的, 世界性的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Climate change is a universal problem.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 气候变化是个世界性的问题。</font><br>\n
universe	<h3>universe</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>宇宙; 天地万物<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our world is but a small part of the universe.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们的地球只是宇宙的一小部分。</font><br>星系, 银河系<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Are there other universes outside our own?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在我们的银河系之外还有别的星系吗?</font><br>\n
university	<h3>university</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>大学<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The boy scared up enough money to go to university.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这孩子筹措了足够上大学的钱。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He graduated from Yale University in １９１５.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他1915年毕业于耶鲁大学。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is a student at the University of Cambridge.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她是剑桥大学的学生。</font><br>\n
unless	<h3>unless</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>conj.</i></font><br>除非, 如果不<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You will fail unless you work hard.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果你不积极工作, 就会失败。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let's have dinner out — unless you are too tired.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 咱们出去吃饭吧——除非你太累了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Substances have no tendency to expand unless (they are) heated.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 除非受热, 物质不会有膨胀的倾向。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I will be very angry unless you have already spoken to her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 除非你已经对她说过了, 否则我会很生气。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't ask me to explain unless you really don't understand.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要叫我解释, 除非你真的不懂。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Unless paying by credit card, please pay in cash.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果不用信用卡付账, 就请付现金。</font><br>\n
unlike	<h3>unlike</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>prep.</i></font><br>(表示属性)与…不像, 与…不同; 非…的特点<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She's very unlike her mother.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她一点也不像她母亲。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's unlike him to be late; he's usually on time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他不是会迟到的那种人, 他通常很准时。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>不同的, 相异的, 不相似的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The two men are unlike in disposition.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这两个人的气质不同。</font><br>\n
unload	<h3>unload</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>从…卸下货物<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The ship is unloading.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这艘船正在卸货。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Dockers started unloading the ship.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 码头工人开始卸船。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>摆脱<br>\n
until	<h3>until</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>prep.</i></font><br>到…为止,在…以前<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>conj.</i></font><br>到…为止,在…以前,直到…才<br>\n
unusual	<h3>unusual</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>罕有的, 异乎寻常的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was an unusual day for summer, damp and chilly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是夏季少有的一天, 又湿又凉。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The boy's unusual behaviour puzzled the doctor.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这男孩的异常行为使医生困惑不解。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is unusual to see snow in this region.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个地区难得见到雪。</font><br>独特的, 与众不同的<br>\n
up	<h3>up</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>成直立姿势; 起床<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They stood up when he came in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当他进来时, 他们都站起来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He got up very late.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他很晚才起床。</font><br>向上, 趋于较高处<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please lift your head up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请把头抬起来。</font><br>向北, 在北部<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She lives up north.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她住在北部。</font><br>完全地, 彻底地<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We finished all work up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们完成了所有的工作。</font><br>成碎片; 分离<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He tore up the clothes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把衣服撕碎了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We divided up the money.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们把钱分了。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>向上的, 上行的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He caught the up train.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他赶上了上行的火车。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>站起身, 提高(价格等)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He upped and left.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他站起身走了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You simply couldn't up it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你根本不能提高了。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>prep.</i></font><br>(表示位置)在…的上端<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There was a workman up the ladder.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有一个工人在梯子上工作。</font><br>(表示方向)朝…上, 向…上<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They climbed up a hill.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们爬上了山。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The ship is sailing up the Nile.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这艘船顺尼罗河向上游航行。</font><br>\n
upon	<h3>upon</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>prep.</i></font><br>在…上面<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She sat upon the sofa.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她坐在沙发上。</font><br>当…时候<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Upon seeing her, I smiled and ran toward her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 看到她我笑了, 并跑了过去。</font><br>\n
upper	<h3>upper</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>较高的, 上部的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is a member of the upper house of legislature.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是上议院的成员之一。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>大写的<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>用大写字母排印/upper crust面包表层的皮贵族阶层, 上流阶层; 最上层/upper works〈海〉水线以上的船体<br>\n
upright	<h3>upright</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>直立的, 垂直的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He stood in an upright position.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他直直地站着。</font><br>正直的, 诚实的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp An upright man is respectable.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 诚实的人是值得尊敬的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The man is very upright.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个人非常正直。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>垂直[竖立]地<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He stood himself upright.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他笔直地站着。</font><br>\n
upset	<h3>upset</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>打翻, 弄翻<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A tall bottle upsets easily.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 高瓶子容易翻倒。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He upset the cup.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他打翻了杯子。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>打乱, 扰乱<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She upset our plan.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她打乱了我们的计划。</font><br>使苦恼, 使心烦; 使不适<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The news upset him emotionally.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这消息使他心烦意乱。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Chocolate upset his stomach.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他吃巧克力后感到胃不舒服。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>翻倒, 扰乱, 不安, 不适<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I couldn't bear the upset.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不能忍受这种扰乱。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>心烦的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was very upset.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他非常心烦。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was upset at not being welcomed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他因不受人欢迎而生气。</font><br>不舒服的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He had an upset stomach.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他肚子不舒服。</font><br>\n
upstairs	<h3>upstairs</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>在楼上, 往楼上<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He's upstairs taping.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在楼上自己录音呢。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We went upstairs to bed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们上楼去睡觉。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>楼上的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is waiting in the upstairs hall.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他正在楼上的大厅里等候。</font><br>\n
up-to-date	<h3>up-to-date</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>现代的; 最新的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He bought an up-to-date textbook.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他买了一本最新的教科书。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All my correspondence is up-to-date.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我所有的通信手段都是跟上时代的。</font><br>\n
upward	<h3>upward</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>向上的, 上升的, 升高的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Downward movement is much faster than upward one.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 向下移动比向上移动快得多。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Prices have an upward tendency.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 价格有上升的趋势。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>向上地, 上升地<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The birds flew upward.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 鸟儿向上飞去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Prices are tending upward.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 物价正在上涨。</font><br>\n
upwards	<h3>upwards</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>向上地, 上升地<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The world urban population is rocketing upwards at a rate of 6.5 per cent per year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 世界城市人口以每年6.5％的速度急速上升。</font><br>\n
urban	<h3>urban</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>城市的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Traffic is a major urban problem.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 交通是城市的一个主要问题。</font><br>\n
urge	<h3>urge</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>力劝; 敦促<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He urges his sister's study.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他敦促妹妹学习。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She urged my going to see him immediately.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她劝我立即去看他。</font><br>鼓励; 极力主张<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He urged the necessity for immediate action.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他强烈要求立即采取行动。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He urged leaving.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他极力主张离去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We all urged him to go ahead with his plan.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们都鼓励他实施他的计划。</font><br>驱策, 促使<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Your progress will urge us to work hard.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你的进步会促进我们努力学习。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>强烈的愿望<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has an urge to become a film star.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他非常希望成为电影明星。</font><br>\n
urgent	<h3>urgent</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>急迫的, 紧要的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We have an urgent thing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们有一件紧要的事情。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He says the matter is urgent.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他说这事很紧急。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is most urgent that the patient should get to hospital.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那病人应该马上送医院。</font><br>催促的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was urgent for the doctor to come.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她催促医生快点来。</font><br>\n
us	<h3>us</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>pron.</i></font><br>我们<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp No enemy can frighten us into submission.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 任何敌人的恐吓都不能使我们屈服。</font><br>\n
usage	<h3>usage</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>使用, 用法<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Machines soon wear out under rough usage.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 机器如果使用不仔细, 很快就会磨损。</font><br>习惯, 惯例, 习俗<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That phrase has come into usage.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个短语已为大家所惯用。</font><br>\n
use	<h3>use</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>使用; 利用<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp May I use your knife for a while?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我用一下你的小刀行吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She uses every opportunity.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她利用每一个机会。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He used his job as a screen for his spying activities.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他利用他的工作作掩护进行间谍活动。</font><br>耗费, 消费<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All the paper has been used.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 所有的纸张都用完了。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>使用, 应用<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp For use only in case of fire!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 只供火警时用！</font><br>用途, 效用<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is an electronic device with many uses.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是一部具有多种用途的电子仪器。</font><br>使用能力; 使用权<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is for the use of students only.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是仅供学生使用的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The boy regained the use of his arm.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这男孩恢复了手臂的功能。</font><br>\n
used	<h3>used</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>用过的, 旧的, 二手的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He doesn't want a used car.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他不想要旧车。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is a used glass on the coffee table.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 桌子上有一个用过的杯子。</font><br>[ju:st]习惯于…的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm used to plain food.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我习惯粗茶淡饭。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is becoming used to listening to others.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他正变得习惯于听别人的意见。</font><br>\n
useful	<h3>useful</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>有用的, 有益的, 有帮助的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He's a useful person to know.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是个应该结交的有帮助的人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Information about people's language ability is often very useful.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有关人们语言能力的信息经常是很有用的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The computer is useful in processing data.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 电子计算机在处理资料方面很有用。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is very useful for a person to know how to swim.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 对一个人来说会游泳是很有用的。</font><br>令人满意的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The England cricket team scored quite a useful total.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 英格兰板球队得分总数令人满意。</font><br>\n
useless	<h3>useless</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>无用的, 无价值的, 无效的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He's a useless fellow.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是个没用的家伙。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His advise is useless to our project.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的建议对我们的计划没有什么价值。</font><br>差劲的, 不怎么样的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This method of working is useless.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这样做没成功的希望。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is useless at maths.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的数学不好。</font><br>\n
user	<h3>user</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>用户, 使用者<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The company is the biggest user of oil.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 该公司是最大的石油用户。</font><br>\n
usual	<h3>usual</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>经常的, 通常的; 寻常的, 惯常的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The plane did not fly the usual commercial route.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 飞机没有沿通常的商业航线飞。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's usual to have a holiday in summer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 夏天休假是惯例。</font><br>\n
usually	<h3>usually</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>通常, 平常, 惯常地<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The motor usually operates well.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这台发动机通常运转良好。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was usually in the morning that she saw her patients.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她通常在上午看望病人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Usually, I get up early.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 通常, 我起得很早。</font><br>\n
utilise	<h3>utilise</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>利用, 使用<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The cook will utilise the leftover ham bone to make soup.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 厨师要用吃剩的猪腿骨做汤。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is to be hoped that in her new job her talents will be better utilised than before.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 希望在她的新岗位上她的才干能够比以往得到更好的发挥。</font><br>\n
utility	<h3>utility</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>功用, 效用<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A fur coat has more utility in winter than in autumn.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 毛皮外衣在冬天比在秋天更有用。</font><br>公用事业<br>\n
utilize	<h3>utilize</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>利用, 使用<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The cook will utilize the leftover ham bone to make soup.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 厨师要用吃剩的猪腿骨做汤。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is to be hoped that in her new job her talents will be better utilized than before.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 希望在她的新岗位上她的才干能够比以往得到更好的发挥。</font><br>\n
utmost	<h3>utmost</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>极度的, 最大的, 最远的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Without problem, the utmost problem.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 没有问题是最大的问题。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He walked to the utmost edge of the cliff.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他走到悬崖的最边缘的地方。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The ability for him to get the job is utmost.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他得到这份工作的可能性极大。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>极限, 最大限度<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That is the utmost that I can do.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我最多只能做到那样。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Each man is free to exercise his special talents to the utmost.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 每个人都可以尽力发挥他的专长。</font><br>\n
utter	<h3>utter</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>以口发出声音<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The wounded man uttered a groan.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个受伤的人发出呻吟。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My name was uttered by someone near me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 近处有人喊我的名字。</font><br>说, 讲<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She didn't utter a word all night.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她整夜一言不发。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>彻底的; 完全的; 绝对的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was in utter despair.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他完全绝望了。</font><br>\n
vacant	<h3>vacant</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>未被占用的, 空的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There were many vacant seats in the theatre.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 剧院里有许多空座位。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Is the lavatory vacant?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 厕所里没人吧?</font><br>(指职位)空缺的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Are there any vacant positions in your firm?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你们公司有空缺吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The top post in the delegation was still vacant.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 代表团中的最高职位仍空着。</font><br>茫然的, 空虚的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He stared into space with a vacant expression.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他茫然地凝视着天空。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His mind seems completely vacant.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的头脑似乎空空如也。</font><br>\n
vacation	<h3>vacation</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>假期<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The children wait impatiently for the vacation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们焦急地等待着假期的来临。</font><br>\n
vacuum	<h3>vacuum</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>真空<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Sound waves cannot travel through a vacuum.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 声波不能在真空中传播。</font><br>〈口〉真空吸尘器<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I mean to buy a vacuum next month.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 下个月我打算买一台真空吸尘器。</font><br>空间; 空虚; 空白<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His resignation has left a power vacuum at the head of the party.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的辞职使得该党的领导位置出现了权力真空。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His wife's death left a vacuum in his life.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他妻子的去世使他的生活变得空虚。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>用真空吸尘器清扫(某物)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I vaccum the carpet twice every week.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我每周用吸尘器打扫地毯两次。</font><br>\n
vague	<h3>vague</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>模糊的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Through the mist I could just make out a vague figure.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 透过雾霭, 我只能看见一个模糊的人影。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The final letter is very vague; possibly an R or a K.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 最后一个字母很不清楚, 可能是R, 也可能是K。</font><br>(表达或感知)含糊的, 不明确的, 不清楚的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He had a vague idea of finding Anne and explaining it all to her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他隐约觉得要去找安妮, 向她解释所发生的一切。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He returned only a vague answer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他只给了个含糊的回答。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I haven't the vaguest idea who he is.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我根本不知道他是谁。</font><br>不具体的; 不精确的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our holiday plans are still rather vague.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们的度假计划仍然没有明确。</font><br>\n
vain	<h3>vain</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>自负的; 爱慕虚荣的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is one of those vain people who never take others' advice.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她属于那种自负得从不听别人劝告的人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don't like a vain woman.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我讨厌爱慕虚荣的女人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He's very vain of his abilities.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他对于自己的能力很自负。</font><br>徒劳的, 无用的, 无效的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He made a vain attempt to reach the drowning child.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他试图接近那个快淹死的小孩, 但没有成功。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All my efforts were vain.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的一切努力都白费了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is vain to resist.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 抵抗是没用的。</font><br>\n
valid	<h3>valid</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>正当的, 有充分根据的, 符合逻辑的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Do you have valid reasons for your absence?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你的缺席有正当理由吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His excuse was not valid.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的借口靠不住。</font><br>有效的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has a valid passport.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的护照有效。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This railway ticket is valid for three days.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这张火车票的有效期是三天。</font><br>有法律效力的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is a valid will.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是一份具有法律效力的遗嘱。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Is this contract valid?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这份合同有法律效力吗?</font><br>\n
valley	<h3>valley</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>山谷<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The valley was hidden from view in the mist.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在雾中山谷已经看不见了。</font><br>流域<br>\n
valuable	<h3>valuable</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>贵重的, 珍贵的, 值钱的, 名贵的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has a valuable collection of stamps.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他收藏了很有价值的邮票。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Is the watch valuable?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这块表很值钱吗?</font><br>宝贵的, 有价值的, 极有用的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is one of the most valuable lessons I learned.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是我所学到的最宝贵的教训。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The book is valuable for my purpose.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这本书对我很有用。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The handbook is valuable to me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这本手册对我很有价值。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>贵重物品, 财宝<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She has put all her valuables in the bank.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她已把她所有的贵重物品存进了银行。</font><br>\n
value	<h3>value</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>价值, 价格<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The expert set a value of 10, 000 dollars on the painting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 专家给这幅画定价1万美元。</font><br>实用性, 有价值, 重要性<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Good books are of great value to students.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 好书对学生非常有用。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You don't know the value of health.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你不知道健康的重要性。</font><br>价值标准, 价值观, 职业道德, 行业准则<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our values and behaviour patterns are different from yours.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们的价值观念和行为模式与你们的不同。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>估价<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I valued the bike at 200 dollars.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我估计这辆自行车值200美元。</font><br>重视, 尊重<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I valued my friendship with my classmates.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我珍视我和同学们之间的友谊。</font><br>\n
van	<h3>van</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>(有篷的)货车<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A mail van was parked beside my house when I got home.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我回家的时候, 一辆邮车停在我房子旁边。</font><br>(铁路的)行李车; 有盖货车<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The security van that brings our wages always varies its route.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 给我们送工资来的保安车经常改变路线。</font><br>前驱; 先锋; 领导者<br>\n
vanish	<h3>vanish</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>消失, 突然不见<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp With a wave of his hand, the magician made the rabbit vanish.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 魔术师手一挥兔子便不见了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The smile vanished from her face.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 笑容从她脸上消失了。</font><br>不复存在, 绝迹<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Many types of animal have now vanished from the earth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 许多动物物种现已从地球上绝迹。</font><br>\n
vapor	<h3>vapor</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>水汽,水蒸气,无实质之物;自夸者<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>v.</i></font><br>自夸;(使)蒸发<br>\n
vapour	<h3>vapour</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>潮气, 水汽<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A cloud is a mass of vapour in the sky.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 云是天空中的水汽团块。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Strange vapours burst out of the factory during the accident.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 事故发生的时候, 有奇怪的水汽从工厂里喷出来。</font><br>蒸汽<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>蒸发的自夸的<br>\n
variable	<h3>variable</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>变化的, 可变的, 易变的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The variable weather is a great trial to me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种多变的天气真是让我受不了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The speed of the windscreen wipers is variable.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汽车挡风玻璃上雨刷的速度是可变的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our team's performance this year has been variable.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们队今年成绩很不稳定。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>可变因素; 变数<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Have you taken all the variables into account in your calculations?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在你的计算中有没有把所有的可变因素都考虑进去?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Speed was a variable in the experiment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在该实验中速度是个变数。</font><br>\n
variation	<h3>variation</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>变化, 变动(的程度)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Prices are subject to variation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 价格可以变动。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The dial records very slight variations in pressure.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 刻盘显示出压力有微小变化。</font><br>变奏(曲)<br>变异, 变种<br>\n
variety	<h3>variety</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>品种, 种类<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This variety of dog is very useful for hunting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种狗对狩猎很有用。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There are different varieties of plants in the garden.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 花园里有各种各样的植物。</font><br>种种, 各种<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This shop sells a variety of toys.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这家商店出售各种各样的玩具。</font><br>变化, 多样化<br>\n
various	<h3>various</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>各种不同的, 各种各样的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The subject may be viewed in various ways.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这问题可以从不同的方面加以考虑。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The products we sell are many and various.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们出售的产品是各式各样的。</font><br>一些, 若干<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There are various ways to solve the problem.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 解决这个问题有许多种方法。</font><br>\n
vary	<h3>vary</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>呈现不同<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This pile of apples vary in size.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这堆苹果大小不一。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使)变化, 改变<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Opinions on this point vary.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 对这一点看法各异。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Old people don't like to vary their habits.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 老年人不喜欢改变他们的习惯。</font><br>\n
vast	<h3>vast</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>巨大的, 广大的, 广阔的, 大量的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The snowstorm swept the vast expanse of grassland.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 暴风雪袭击了辽阔的草原。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Tom has made a vast improvement in his German.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汤姆的德语有了很大的进步。</font><br>\n

vehicle	<h3>vehicle</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>交通工具, 车辆<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp No vehicles are permitted into the park.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 公园内禁止任何车辆进入。</font><br>传播媒介, 手段<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Air is the vehicle of sound.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 空气是声音传播的媒介。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Newspaper may be used as a vehicle for publicity.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 报纸可用作宣传工具。</font><br>\n
veil	<h3>veil</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>面纱<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She dropped her veil.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她摘下面纱。</font><br>覆盖物<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>用面纱遮盖<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please veil your face.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请用面纱遮住脸。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Moslem women used to veil their faces before going into public.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 信奉伊斯兰教的妇女出门之前往往用面纱把脸遮起来。</font><br>\n
venture	<h3>venture</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>敢于, 冒险<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Nothing venture, nothing have.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不入虎穴, 焉得虎子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I won't venture a step farther.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不敢再往前走一步。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He ventured to speak to her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他壮起胆子跟她说话。</font><br>\n
verb	<h3>verb</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>动词<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The verb agrees with its subject in number and person.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 谓语动词的数和人称与其主语一致。</font><br>\n
verify	<h3>verify</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>证实, 核实<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All those facts verified his innocence.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这一切事实都证明他是无辜的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Subsequent events verified that his judgement was at fault.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 接着发生的事件证实了他的判断有误。</font><br>\n
version	<h3>version</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>(个人对事件的)描述, 说法, 看法<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His version of the accident seemed most convincing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他对该事件的叙述似乎最令人信服。</font><br>版本, 形式<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When I have compared the two versions I may write to you again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当我比较两种版本之后, 我可能再次给你写信。</font><br>译本, 剧本<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The book was translated into many versions and sold all over the world.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这本书被译成多种译本并行销全球。</font><br>\n
vertical	<h3>vertical</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>垂直的, 竖的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He climbed the vertical cliff.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他攀登陡峭的悬崖。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The northern side of the mountain is almost vertical.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这座山的北坡几乎是垂直的。</font><br>\n
very	<h3>very</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>正是的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is the very person I wanted to see.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她正是我要见的人。</font><br>极端的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The veriest simpleton knows that.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 最笨的呆子也知道这点。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>很, 非常, 十分, 极<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The film is very interesting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这部电影很有趣。</font><br>十足, 完全<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You are a lucky boy to have your very own boat.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你有一艘完全属于自己的小艇, 真是个幸运的孩子。</font><br>\n
vessel	<h3>vessel</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>船, 舰<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We had sighted the vessel and were following it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们已看到那船并在跟随着它。</font><br>容器<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You should put the water into a vessel.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你应该把水装入容器中。</font><br>血管, 脉管, 导管<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The doctor said I'd severed a vessel in my leg.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 医生说我割断了腿上的一根血管。</font><br>\n
veteran	<h3>veteran</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>经验丰富的人; 老兵<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The baseball veteran loved to coach young players.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这位棒球老手喜欢指导年轻选手。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My grandfather is a veteran of the Second World War.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我祖父是二战时的老兵。</font><br>退伍军人<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Some veterans of the two world wars gathered to celebrate their victory.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一些经历了两次世界大战的退伍军人欢聚庆祝胜利。</font><br>\n
via	<h3>via</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>prep.</i></font><br>(表示方式)通过(某人), 凭借(某种手段)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The news reached me via my aunt.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那消息是通过我婶婶转告我的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They have arrived at a solution via scientific investigation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们通过科学的调查研究得出了解决问题的办法。</font><br>(表示关涉)经由, 经过<br>\n
vibrate	<h3>vibrate</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使)振动[颤动]<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The bridge vibrated when a heavy truck passed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当重型卡车经过时, 这座桥就会震动。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The passing train vibrated the house.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 经过的火车使这栋房子颤动。</font><br>\n
vice	<h3>vice</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>不道德行为, 堕落<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Ingratitude is a despicable vice.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 忘恩负义是可鄙的不道德行为。</font><br>缺陷; 弱点<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In spite of his vices, he was loved by all.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 尽管他有缺点, 还是受到大家的爱戴。</font><br>恶习<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Smoking is a harmful vice.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 吸烟是一种有害的恶习。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>prep.</i></font><br>代替, 取代<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mr.Black has been appointed leader vice Mr. Brown.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 布莱克先生取代布朗先生被任命为队长。</font><br>\n

video	<h3>video</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>磁带录像, 录像<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We use video for teaching.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们用录像进行教学。</font><br>录像磁带, 录像带<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Have we got any blank videos?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们有空白录像带吗?</font><br>录像机<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I bought a video for my father.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我为父亲买了一台录像机。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>电视的; 视频的; 影像的<br>用录像磁带[录像带]的<br>\n
videophone	<h3>videophone</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>可视电话; 电视电话; 视像电话<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I will give you a videophone ring tonight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 今天晚上我给你打可视电话。</font><br>\n
view	<h3>view</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>看<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The speaker stood in full view of the crowd.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 演讲者站在大家都能看得到的地方。</font><br>视力; 视野, 视线<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My view of the harbour was blocked by the new building.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 新大楼挡住了我的视线, 使我看不见港口。</font><br>景色, 风景<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'll sit here and look at the view.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我要坐在这里观看景色。</font><br>风景画, 风景照片<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The tourists crowded closer to get a view of the painting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 游客们聚集得更近些以便观看这幅画。</font><br>观察某人[某事物]的特定机会<br>看法, 意见<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She express the view that he was a fool.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她发表自己的看法, 认为他是个傻瓜。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I take the view that we should put less money into nuclear weapons.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我认为我们应该在核武器上少花钱。</font><br>考虑, 思量; 思考的方式<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>认为, 考虑<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We can view the problem in many ways.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们可以从多方面来考虑这些问题。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She views every minor setback as a disaster.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把每个较小的挫折都看成重大灾难。</font><br>观看<br>〈正〉查看<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He determined to view the rooms behind the office.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他决定查看一下办公室后面的房间。</font><br>\n

viewpoint	<h3>viewpoint</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>观点, 意见, 角度<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He explained his viewpoint that taxes should be increased.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他解释了他认为应该增加税收的观点。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He explained his viewpoint in detail.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他详细地解释了他的观点。</font><br>\n

vinegar	<h3>vinegar</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>醋<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Vinegar is used in preserving food.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 醋可用来保存食物。</font><br>\n
violate	<h3>violate</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>违反, 违背<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The country violates the international agreements.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个国家违背了国际协议。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The bus driver violated the traffic regulation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汽车司机违反了交通规则。</font><br>亵渎<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The soldiers violated the church by using it as a stable.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 士兵们把教堂当马厩, 亵渎了教堂。</font><br>侵犯, 妨碍<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The noise violated my sleep.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 噪音妨碍了我的睡眠。</font><br>\n
violence	<h3>violence</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>暴力, 强暴<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp War is the most acute form of expression of violence.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 战争是暴力所表现的最剧烈的形式。</font><br>猛烈, 剧烈, 强烈<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They attacked with violence.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们猛烈攻击。</font><br>\n
violent	<h3>violent</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>暴力引起的, 粗暴的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They laid violent hands on him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们对他施以暴力。</font><br>剧烈的, 强烈的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The violent winds buried the village in sand.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 狂风把村子掩埋在沙中。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The madman was violent and had to be locked up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个精神病患者很凶暴, 不得不把他锁起来。</font><br>\n

virtually	<h3>virtually</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>实际上; 事实上<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was virtually a prisoner.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他实际上是个囚犯。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The job was virtually completed by the end of the week.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 到周末时这项工作差不多完成了。</font><br>\n
virtue	<h3>virtue</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>美德, 德行<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Among her many virtues are loyalty, courage, and truthfulness.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她有许多的美德, 如忠诚、勇敢和诚实。</font><br>优点, 长处<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The chair has the virtue of being adjustable.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种椅子具有可调节的优点。</font><br>\n
virus	<h3>virus</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>病毒<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is a new kind of viruses in the computer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是一种新的电脑病毒。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is suffering from a virus infection.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他受到病毒感染。</font><br>病毒性疾病<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is a virus going round the world.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 世界上流行着一种病毒性疾病。</font><br>恶毒, 恶意<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has removed the virus of prejudice.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他消除了有害的偏见。</font><br>\n

visible	<h3>visible</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>看得见的, 可见的, 有形的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is a visible star in the sky.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是一颗在天空中可见的星星。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The shore was barely visible through the fog.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在雾里海岸不可见。</font><br>明显的, 可察觉到的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It seems to serve no visible use.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这东西看不出有明显的用途。</font><br>\n

visit	<h3>visit</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>访问; 探望; 参观; 游览<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They are visiting in that city.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们正在那个城市参观访问。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm just going to visit my friend Smith.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我正要去拜访我的朋友史密斯。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The schools are regularly visited by officials from the Ministry of Education.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 教育部的官员们定期视察各学校。</font><br>在…逗留; 住宿<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is visiting at a hotel nearby.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他暂住在附近的一家旅馆里。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Many migratory birds visit this lake annually.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 许多候鸟每年到这个湖上作短期逗留。</font><br>侵袭<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>聊天; 闲谈<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let's sit here and visit together for a while.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 让我们坐在这里谈一会儿。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>访问; 参观, 游览; 逗留<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp During our visit to London we often went to the theatre.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们在伦敦逗留时常去看戏。</font><br>聊天, 谈话<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We had a nice visit on the phone.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们在电话里谈得很高兴。</font><br>\n
visitor	<h3>visitor</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>访问者, 参观者<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There was such a crowd round the distinguished visitor that I could not get to speak to him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那么多的人围着这位尊贵的来访者, 以致我无法同他说话。</font><br>游客, 宾客<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp London is full of visitors during May and June.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 五六月间伦敦挤满了游客。</font><br>候鸟<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These winter visitors will fly to British shores.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些冬季的候鸟将飞向英国的海岸。</font><br>\n
